Description: Job Description:  Cimarron is seeking junior-level, mid-level, and senior-level Mechanical Handling Engineers to support a global engineering, construction, and project management customer in Richland, WA. This position is supporting work at the Hanford Vit Plant, a waste treatment and immobilization plant. This is a great opportunity to support a one-of-a-kind facility that is turning radioactive and chemical waste left over from World War II and the Cold War into a safer form for disposal. This program is critical to protect the communities and wildlife along the shorelines throughout the Northwest. Come join the team to support this important endeavor!Richland, WA sits at the confluence of the Columbia, Snake, and Yakima rivers near two mountain ranges. This area provides access to year-round outdoor recreation, 300 days of sun a year, and the amenities of large cities (such as Seattle and Portland) nearby.This is an onsite position.  This position is expected to last for at least 1 year and has the possibility to be extended. This is a full-time/benefitted job with Cimarron that offers 1.5 times pay for overtime.Key Duties:Design the areas of material handling equipment, treatment, vitrification systems, and/or supporting utilities.Prepare technical reports, studies, procurement documentation, and design documentation.Perform calculations using engineering software and supporting systems.Interface and coordinate with other engineering disciplines and the client in the development of the design.Conduct and coordinate detailed phases of engineering work.Perform work that involves conventional engineering practice.Perform work using customer standards and appropriate 2-D and 3-D computer-aided design and computer-aided engineering (CAD and CAE) tools (Solidworks, IGRIP, Microstation).Support the procurement of equipment by developing procurement packages, reviewing quotations, and evaluating them technically.Review vendor submittals and resolution of technical issues during the procurement of mechanical equipment.Review and disposition field change notices, non-conformance reports, and condition reports.Support the creation of a work environment that fosters openness, trust, communication, teamwork, empowerment, innovation, and satisfaction.Additional Responsibilities for Senior-Level:Plan, schedule, conduct, and coordinate detailed phases of engineering work.Perform work that involves conventional engineering practices, but may include complex features, such as resolving conflicting design requirements, unsuitability of conventional materials, and/or difficult coordination requirements.Prepare and/or assist in the preparation of cost estimates, quantity take-offs, and staffing requirements for proposals, forecasts, and change orders.Required Skills, Experience, and Education:Due to facility security requirements, only U.S. citizens or permanent residents are eligible for consideration at this time.Must be able to obtain a Department of Energy badge for access to the Hanford Site.1 or more years of related experience.Bachelor of Science in Mechanical, Chemical, or Nuclear Engineering from an accredited course of study.Additional Required Skills, Experience, and Education for Senior-level:Ability to work independently, use engineering judgment, and devise new approaches to solving problems.Desired Skills, Experience, and Education:Experience in mechanical handling or equipment procurement.Knowledge of current computer applications for engineering and design, including appropriate knowledge of CAD (both 2-D and 3-D).Knowledge and ability to utilize the Microsoft Office suite.Familiar with regulations and industry codes and standards affecting complex engineering work.Familiar with the effort required to prepare standard discipline deliverables.Knowledge of how to prepare standard engineering budgets and schedules within a discipline.Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written).Engineering-in-training (or equivalent) in Mechanical, Chemical, or Nuclear Engineering.Experience in equipment design analysis in DoE or commercial nuclear facilities.Additional Desired Skills for Senior-level:Capability to develop design documents and procurement documents, including Specifications, Material Requisitions, Mechanical Handling diagrams, Mechanical Flow diagrams, and equipment data sheets, that incorporate the applicable design requirements, including nuclear safety requirements.Understanding of technical issues and costs related to the selection of typical design features within a discipline.Knowledge of how to develop all standard deliverables within a discipline.Knowledge of Bechtel Corporate guides and standards.Familiarity with the effort required to prepare standard discipline deliverables.Knowledge of how to prepare standard engineering budgets and schedules within a discipline.Professional Engineers license (or equivalent) in Mechanical, Chemical, or Nuclear Engineering.Previous waste treatment plant experience.Experience in front-end mechanical design and equipment selection for nuclear waste processing, nuclear, or nuclear chemical facilities including cranes, and other material handling equipment.Business Profile:Cimarron is a global solutions company with a strategic partnering approach to satisfying customer-driven requirements. We ensure customer success with a modern approach and experienced leadership. Driven by an entrepreneurial spirit, Cimarron is fueled by highly skilled employees, developing new innovative technologies, and delivering superior products and services. We believe in recognizing employees' worth by offering competitive salaries and benefits, including health and vision insurance, 401(k) contributions, and much more. From company communication through Company-wide information meetings led by our President and CEO, to an Awards program designed to recognize our amazing employees and their accomplishments, you will not only feel like you are a part of a team, you will be a valued member of the Cimarron family. Cimarron is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/Disability/Veteran.

Description: Joby Overview: Located in Northern California, the team at Joby Aviation is driven by our goal of creating an affordable, all-electric air transportation system. Imagine a piloted air taxi that takes off vertically, then quietly carries you and your fellow passengers over the congested city streets below, enabling you to spend more time with the people and places that matter most. Since 2009, our team has worked steadily to make this dream a reality. We’ve designed and tested many generations of prototype aircraft capable of serving in a network of electric air taxis. We’re looking for talented, committed individuals to join our team as we push onwards toward certifying the Joby aircraft with the Federal Aviation Administration, scaling our manufacturing, and preparing to launch commercial service in 2025. Overview:     Joby Aviation is seeking an all-around mechanical/aerospace engineer with strong technical fundamentals, practical ability and problem-solving skills to join our Powertrain team. As a key member of a high-performance team you will develop electric turbocompressors supplying pressurized air to hydrogen fuel cell systems that provide electrical power to aircraft propulsion systems. As part of a cross-functional team you will be responsible for the end-end product development cycle of your components with an emphasis on rapidly iterating through design/build/test cycles to achieve our ambitious performance and timing goals.  Responsibilities:  Own the complete product development cycle (conception, design/analysis, prototype build/test iterations, certification, SOP) for one or more turbocompressors Perform all 3D & 2D mechanical design work (CAD) Collaborate with teammates who:    Are subject matter experts in electrical, aerodynamic, mechanical and thermal design/analysis to incorporate their expertise into an optimized product Are responsible for adjacent products and higher-level systems to ensure that the overall system delivers the highest performance, reliability and safety with the lowest weight, size & cost. Design & Build Prototypes, including assembly fixtures and tools, document part & build quality Test Prototypes, including designing and building required testing fixtures & setups as well as data acquisition and reporting Actively support testing of higher-level systems, up to and including aircraft flight testing Required:  BS in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering (or equivalent) Strong Engineering & Technical Fundamentals Excellent problem solving & communication skills High skill level in 3D & 2D Mechanical Design & CAD (including GD&T and DFM) Basic CAE skills (FEA, CFD, engineering programming, LabView, Matlab/Simulink) Practical hands-on experience building & testing new product designs This position must meet US export control compliance requirements, therefore a candidate must qualify as a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15. “US Person” includes US Citizens, lawful permanent residents, refugees, or asylees. Desired:  Experience working on small fast-paced independent teams Participation in a full product development cycle Relevant (e.g. rotating machinery) work experience Basic Program Management experience    Compensation at Joby is a combination of base pay and Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). The target base pay for this position is $79,900-$130,900. The compensation package offered will be determined by location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.        Joby also offers a comprehensive benefits package, including paid time off, healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan with a company match, an employee stock purchase plan (ESPP), short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, and more.    Min: USD $79,900.00/Yr. Max: USD $130,900.00/Yr. EEO:     Joby is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Description: Position Overview An Associate Engineer provides engineering services associated with the design, fabrication, and installation of curtainwall and related façade systems under the direct supervision of a Professional Engineer. Responsibilities Performs basic structural engineering analysis and design calculations under the supervision and direction of a P.E. Explores opportunities to gain knowledge and experience in company policies and processes, industry standards and practices, and career growth and development. Initiates communication and interaction with experienced engineers to receive appropriate training and direction. Works collaboratively with other structural engineers, designers and technical project managers through strong oral and written communication skills. Manages assigned tasks and duties efficiently to meet project objectives and deadlines. Minimum Education/Licensure/Experience Requirements Bachelor's Degree (B.S.) from ABET accredited four-year college or university in Civil or Structural Engineering. E.I.T. certificate gained through successful completion of the NCEES F.E. exam. Technical Skills High-level mathematical proficiency in geometry, algebra, trigonometry, and calculus; two- and three-dimensional engineering aptitude in physics, statics, dynamics, and mechanics of materials; and an understanding of stress/strain, failure modes, and limit states. Computer/software competence in computer-aided design (CAD), computer-aided engineering (CAE), word processing, spreadsheets, email, and internet. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. Position: Test Engineer, Chassis & Body in White, Semi
Description: What to Expect This position will work as a member of Tesla’s reliability and test team to develop and execute component and system level testing of vehicle chassis and body structural components using servo hydraulic test equipment either in-house or at external labs What You’ll Do Conduct hands-on component and system level durability and strength tests using MTS servo hydraulic systems Work directly with reliability and design engineers for test planning activities (test scheduling, prioritization, specifications etc. ) Develop test fixtures using CAD and work with in-house or external labs for fixture fabrication Conduct detailed inspections such as torque checks, crack checks etc. Identify and root cause failures Conduct data acquisition and instrumentation of sensors such as load cells, strain gages, LVDT etc. Post process test data and make detailed test reports Be involved with general test equipment maintenance and lab expansions Work in close collaboration with test technicians, instrumentation, CAE, reliability and design teams Work with third party labs to coordinate and conduct testing as needed Maintain a clean and organized work environment What You’ll Bring BS and/or MS degree in mechanical, automotive or mechatronics engineering or equivalent experience. Strong internship experience and/or participation in competitive projects (Formula SAE etc.) preferred Experience with testing, using hydraulic or electric actuators preferred Experience with instrumentation of sensors (load cells, strain gages, LVDT etc.) and data acquisition systems Experience designing in CAD Proven track record as a hands-on engineer Able to work well under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines Excellent written & verbal communication skills Strong organization skills with meticulous attention to detail

Position: Mechanical Design Engineer, Cell Product Design
Description: What to Expect Battery Cells are the common denominator for every Tesla product. Our product requirements demand ground-up cell architectures with state-of-the-art performance, manufactured at volumes that are orders of magnitude higher than the products they power. Our environment is fast-paced and incredibly exciting, so being passionate and self-motivated to push your limits is critical. Our team works with engineering groups across various disciplines, requiring strong communication skills and a team-first mentality. You will work alongside seasoned industry experts, high aptitude recent graduates, and people from every stage in between. We look for anyone with an exceptional ability to solve problems in both individual and team settings. What You’ll Do Full design ownership of Li-on cell mechanical components and assemblies, from concept through production launch and ramp Develop and deliver new technologies to advance product performance while driving down cost and mass Own basic analysis, prototyping, and testing; support advanced analysis, prototyping and testing Produce and release detailed 2D part and assembly drawings Define technical specifications (dimensional, functional, performance, manufacturing) Participate in sourcing and managing of engineering relationships with suppliers Hands on support of manufacturing process and automation development Drive cross functional collaboration with CAE, manufacturing, and test teams to mature products from concept to production Author documentation and deliver technical presentations Research and benchmark competitive technologies Conduct DFMEA and Fault Tree analysis What You’ll Bring Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent Strong engineering fundamentals in solid mechanics and heat transfer Familiarity with properties and applications of common engineering metals and polymers Strong communication skills and team mentality Basic knowledge of GD&T (proficiency is a plus) Proficiency in 3D CAD modeling (CATIA V5/V6 experience is a plus) Experience in designing for one or more high volume manufacturing processes such as stamping, deep drawing, plastic injection molding, heat treating, and metal welding Familiarity with Lithium-ion battery cell, module, and pack design Experience in designing for high volume automated assembly Direct machine shop fabrication and prototyping skills Proficiency in structural and/or thermal FEA Experience with test design and setup, data acquisition and analysis Ability to travel to support product launch and ramp (supplier visits, Tesla factories, etc.)

Division           LINK MFG., LTD           Location           LINK CORPORATE SIOUX CENTER           Employment Type           Full Time Regular Employee           Date Posted           11/8/2023           Contact Name           Stephanie Regnerus           Contact Phone           Job Code           ENG        Job Details  Work for a company that is driven to outperform! Link innovates and manufactures a variety of suspensions specially engineered to address the unique needs of commercial vehicles and equipment. At Link, we exemplify servanthood, demonstrate respect for people, set the standard for reliability, do the right thing, and are One Team! ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: § Develops concept designs for new products and product enhancements. Reviews designs and directs design activities with engineering management supervision. § Performs and reports on intermediate analytical and simulation methods. Uses analytical results to generate conclusions and provide design direction. § Performs and reports on intermediate testing functions. Uses testing results to generate conclusions and provide design direction. § Leads product development teams with some management or senior engineering direction. Manages project timelines and ensures that all aspects of Link’s APQP product development process are followed. § Acts as change administrator for minor product lines or OEM customers. § Corresponds with vendors on project tasks. Assists in managing technical aspects of vendor product quality issues. § Performs OEM product development project tasks. Communicates with OEM technical contacts with some management or senior engineering direction. § Performs design and testing tasks on new technology assessment/development projects as directed. § Serves on continuous improvements teams. § Performs other duties as required by the Director of Product Engineering. QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each duty satisfactorily. The requirements are representative of the knowledge, skill, and / or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. SOFTWARE SKILLS: Must show an ability to learn and apply a variety of CAD/CAE software packages as required, including but not limited to Pro/Engineer, Windchill, Ansys, SuspensionSim and TruckSim. INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE: Intermediate understanding of vehicle dynamics, vehicle suspension theory and practice, vehicle component level testing (or comparable for non- suspension products). Intermediate knowledge of APQP product development process, including but not limited to DFMEA, DFM/DFA, control plans, special characteristics, and PPAP’s. Intermediate understanding of Six Sigma tools and techniques, including but not limited to QFD, boundary diagrams, DVP&R, and various statistical methods. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Engineering in addition to work experience or training where skills and abilities are demonstrated. TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS: Less than 5% overnight travel is expected.

Position: Design Release Engineer, Safety and Restraints
Description: What to Expect The Safety Restraints Design and Release Engineer owns all aspects of airbag &/or seat belt systems from inception, developing conceptual designs and production release to in-service vehicle life and any field quality concerns. This includes Tier 1 nomination & management, vehicle packaging, drawing releases, component and system validation, ensuring homologation requirements are met, plus preparation and manufacturing support. What You’ll Do Support restraint system integration work from design concept to vehicle validation Provide engineering expertise to supplier and internal interfacing departments –Studio and Vehicle Engineering, working particularly close to the CAE team to provide necessary design inputs to optimize the design and occupant restraint performance Provide robust and efficient designs for manufacturing and general assembly processes Ensure suppliers meet timing, quality, cost and validation deliverables Function as the main interaction point of contact for all supplier interfaces Ensure failure avoidance tools and processes (DFMEA/FMA) are applied to restraint components Oversee supplier component DVP and control system level testing to ensure desired performance is achieved prior to dynamic sled and vehicle testing Analyze test results and identify adjustments required to either the restraint commodity or interfacing components, determining most effective resolution Support dynamic sled & vehicle crash tests and homologation submissions What You’ll Bring Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, or equivalent Good understanding and experience in Vehicle Safety Restraint Systems and/or vehicle crashworthiness is preferred (although role would also suit a good recent graduate) Ability to optimize for cost, weight and commercial targets. Demonstrated experience of delivering results under restrictive schedule and limited resources Knowledge of CAE analysis and restraint system integration and optimization Engineering fundamentals and mechanical aptitude in problem-solving Effective verbal and written skills to articulate technical issues with peers and suppliers, ensure timely delivery of all components Excellent organizational skills, self-starting and self-motivated Demonstrated ability to multi-task on with ability to be flexible regarding evolving priorities Proficient computer skills with MS Office Suite CAD knowledge, Catia preferred

Glendale, CA - Design and analyze mechanical design components and systems associated with mechanisms and structures. Support engineering proposals, budgets, and project tasks. Work both independently and with the supervision of a senior engineer. Mentor Junior Engineers and delegate engineering tasks. Meet with clients. Decide on a project's Concept Engineering. Design Concept Review and Approval, Engineering Submittal Review and Approval. Perform engineering analysis and generate designs. Utilize various building materials and design codes. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent from ABET-accredited university. 3 years associated at all levels of design, analysis, and manufacturing. 3 years in analysis software and knowledge of current design codes and standards including American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME), American Society of Testing and Materials (ASTM), American Welding Society (AWS), American Institute of Steel Construction (AISC 360), American Society of Civil Engineers 7 (ASCE 7) and Guobiao Standards (GB). 3 years of direct engineering and design in steel, concrete, and aluminum structures. 3 years with amusement ride engineering, mechanical design, shop drawing creation, shop drawing review, metallurgical strength analysis, metallurgical fatigue analysis, weld analysis, finite element analysis (FEA), wind engineering, and earthquake engineering. 3 years in Solidworks and ANSYS Workbench and PTC CREO, Mathcad, Autodesk ACAD, LIMIT – CAE Simulation Solutions, MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. 1 year of directly performing facility acceptance testing (FAT) and site acceptance testing (SAT). Passing of the NCEES FE exam. Please submit resumes and questions to: careers@celticengineering.com and specify the position for which you are applying.

Position: Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer, Semi Drive Axle, Drive Systems
Description: What to Expect      We are a small, fast team of capable engineers. We specialize in architecture layouts and detail design of mass efficient castings and forgings like gearboxes and motor housings. We also work in plastics, sheet metal and bolted joint designs. Our work often has us reach across borders to our neighboring teams inside the drive unit and the rest of the vehicles where our Drive Units are used. Fast time to market is part of our DNA and we deliver products much faster than industry standard. The Tesla Semi is no exception.    What You’ll Do  Bring leadership and contribute a high level to the design and development of semi-truck and heavy-duty transmission designs and architectures Work with vehicle and production line integration teams to ensure successful assembly and service with the greater vehicle Work with reliability teams to diagnose and address and improve designs based on test results or issues in the field Develop designs with a heavy concentration on design for assembly at volume, in conjunction with manufacturing engineering team Own the detail design of individual components of the assembly, from the very first concept ideas all the way though sourcing collaboration, first parts incoming inspection, PPAP of volume produced parts Work with the analysis and test team to define specs, and guide fixture design for testing Engage and drive the project team for an on-time delivery What You’ll Bring  Heavy duty/Class 8 transmission design with focus on structural castings System level design ownership 3DExperience or Catia V5 experience strongly preferred Casting design for volume production Detail 3D and 2D release of Iron and aluminum casting, forgings, and molded parts Component and sub-system level structural CAE, experience in working in conjunction with CAE specialists for more complex analyses Excellent attention to detail Strong understanding of GD&T (Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing) Great time management and self-motivation

What to Expect     The Tesla Dimensional Analysis team is critical to the engineering design and development of new products at Tesla. We simulate high-volume manufacturing and influence part and process design to deliver world class quality in all our products. The team is highly skilled in computational analysis as well as statistical data analysis techniques. We have a broad responsibility that extends from the very smallest dimensional precision requirements of a battery cell through to the functional requirements of large castings and assemblies.      We are seeking a passionate candidate to join the Dimensional Analysis team in our Fremont, California office.   What You’ll Do  Dimensional CAE simulation – Utilizing dedicated dimensional variation analysis software to analyze and communicate dimensional requirements within engineering teams and with a global manufacturing and supplier base Full vehicle exposure – The Dimensional Analysis team gets involved in the mechanical design of most vehicle systems, from seats to battery packs and autopilot hardware Design Cycle Experience – the team works on parallel design programs, so there is the opportunity to get involved in every stage of the design cycle from early design concept to production ramp-up Cross functional Interaction – Through the Dimensional Engineering process, there are very broad interactions with other teams including Styling, Design, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Quality and many more GD&T (Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing) expertise – GD&T is a key skill that any mechanical designer should be fluent in. It will be one of the most useful assets throughout your career What You’ll Bring  Bachelor's Degree in engineering, or equivalent 1+ years' experience in a dimensional engineering, metrology, or CAE role Strong mechanical engineering fundamentals and a robust first-principals approach Catia or similar CAD system experience Excellent communication skills with ability to clearly convey information and to influence others Proficiency in 1D and 3D dimensional variation root cause analysis Comfortable with multi-variable capability analysis and statistical testing Appreciation for craftsmanship and excellent gap and flush control in consumer products Familiarity GD&T and ASME Y14.5 Prior experience in similar role is valued, but the team has openings from entry-level to expert

Position: Mechanical Design Engineer, Seat Belt Systems
Description: What to Expect     Engineer to deliver whole vehicle seat belt systems for the current & upcoming Tesla vehicle programs.   What You’ll Do  The design release of all seat belt systems in the vehicle, product packaging, validation, & consideration for robust and efficient manufacturing processes Act as the primary technical interface to the design studio, body, interior & seat engineering teams to develop the optimum seat belt packages for occupant protection performance, comfort, and interior styling Manage and direct tier 1 suppliers for engineering development and program timing Support all testing and production validation to meet occupant injury and product performance criteria per established Tesla targets, and regulatory requirements Support restraint system integration work Provide expertise on seat belt design to ensure five-star NCAP safety ratings for our new vehicles Work closely with CAE team to provide design inputs and utilize CAE results to optimize component design Support crash tests from early development to homologation phase Ensure components are supplied to correct pedigrees for all test vehicles and other vehicle level validation and homologation requirements Support supplier & field quality issues to ensure high quality products for our customers Support work on R&D projects to design the next level restraint system What You’ll Bring  A Bachelor's Degree in engineering, or equivalent Relevant mechanical design engineering project experience on a university or professional level Ability to work out ways around obstacles, see opportunities while facing technical difficulties and restrictive timing Effective verbal and written skills to articulate technical issues with peers and suppliers Engineering fundamentals in problem solving & strong hands on skills Knowledge of manufacturing methods and component/assembly tolerancing Intermediate/Advanced 2D drawing & 3D modeling CAD skills (preferably CATIA) Excellent organizational skills, self-starting and self-motivated Automotive safety restraints system experience, especially in seat belt design Good understanding and experience in vehicle crashworthiness Working knowledge of relevant regulations & requirements (FMVSS/ECE/GB/etc)

As North America's premier YAG laser weld house, our legacy is built on a foundation of precision, innovation, and unparalleled expertise. Our specialties encompass Laser Welding, TIG Welding, and Cladding, allowing us to adeptly repair, modify, and assemble a diverse range of components – from injection molding dies to cutting-edge Aerospace and Medical devices. or 3D engineering design and manufacturing tools (e.g., AutoCAD, ProE).Comprehensive knowledge of engineering analysis tools (e.g., ANSYS, ProMechanica).Familiarity with mathematical computing and Position    Advanced Inverter Electrical Engineer    Location    Indiana Technical Center with Locations in Noblesville & Kokomo, Indiana    About us    BorgWarner is a global product leader in delivering innovative and sustainable mobility solutions for the vehicle market. We are a company of innovators and independent thinkers that brings together talented employees, meaningful work and amazing technology in a unique environment. At BorgWarner we constantly work towards our vision of a clean and energy-efficient world.    Our Culture    We believe health and safety of our employees are a top priority, we care about our local communities and the global environment. BorgWarner promotes and nurtures a diverse and inclusive environment, honors integrity, strives for excellence, commits to responsibility for our communities and the environment, and builds on the power of collaboration.    Career Opportunities    We manage talent as seriously as we manage our businesses and encourage you to learn about our proud history, strong culture, technologies and future vision. We offer a strong local presence and interesting global opportunities. Start your future with BorgWarner now!    Job purpose    BorgWarner PowerDrive Systems is currently looking for “dynamic, results driven” individual to join as an Advanced Inverter EE. The Advanced Inverter EE will work as part of a team developing next generation traction inverters and be responsible for the associated circuit design, implementation, and system level testing.    Key responsibilities  Concept, design, and execute traction inverter designs Perform simulation and analysis using CAD and CAE tools Select or specify components to meet design requirements Effectively articulate electrical implications while supporting mechanical packaging and system design Checkout and debug new hardware & perform design confirmation testing in a lab environment Guide ECAD and MCAD to deliver optimal circuit performance and flawless designs   What we’re looking for  BSEE required, MSEE preferred 1+ years of experience in electronic design required, 5+ years preferred Strong hardware design and analytical skills Experience designing analog circuits, digital circuits, and microprocessor based controllers Experience with high voltage testing is preferred Experience with circuit design and layout techniques for EMC is desirable Excellent oral and written communication skills are required Strong interpersonal skills required Ability to travel 20% both domestically and internationally   What we offer  Medical and prescription drug insurance Dental and vision insurance Retirement Savings Plan (401k) Life Insurance Paid Parental Leave Company paid Holidays Company Paid Vacation Tuition Assistance Onsite Noblesville Wellness Center with Nurse Practitioner   What we believe  Inclusion - We value diversity in people, ideas, and experiences. Integrity - We believe in transparency, authenticity, and depend on each other to deliver what we promise. Excellence - We contribute to our developments by seeking knowledge and sharing information. Responsibility - We care about our local communities and the global environment. Collaboration - We are one BorgWarner.   Join the company that is creating solutions that support a cleaner, more energy-efficient world    For more information about BorgWarner, please visit      www.borgwarner.com     Safety    This position will adhere to the Global Star Safety Program, including safety rules, practices and training as outlined in the BorgWarner Safety Policy Manual. This individual will work in a manner that stresses the importance of preventing accidents and illnesses. He/she must take every precaution reasonable in the given circumstance for the protection of themselves and co-workers. In addition, he/she is responsible for reporting all injuries and/or possible dangerous situations, incidents, or occurrences to their immediate supervisor.    Equal Employer Opportunity Statement    BorgWarner is an equal employment opportunity employer such that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Description: Be a Part of Simulating Future Innovations and Ideas  COMSOL is seeking an Applications Engineer to join its Pre-sales and Applications team to work with pre-sales and post-sales support of users of the COMSOL® software.  As the successful applicant, you are expected to have a well-rounded education within an engineering or scientific discipline and experience with simulating technical applications. With this basis, you will be expected to develop your technical proficiency in new areas of science and engineering as you help COMSOL’s users simulate their future innovations and ideas.  Primary Responsibilities Pre-Sales Leads Qualification and Prospect Support Demonstrate the building of clear and understandable simulation examples for prospective customers on simulations of their applications, primarily in the field of heat transfer and fluid flow.Support prospective customers on the modeling of their applications with COMSOL Multiphysics®.Demonstrate use of the COMSOL® software and summarize its features in web-based workshops and other marketing and sales events, along with customer meetingsA willingness and ability to travel for limited periods of time to current and potential customers in order to run COMSOL-sponsored events and activities in North America. Post-Sales Technical Support Support customers on use of the COMSOL® software for their heat transfer, fluid flow and chemical species transport applications, along with a variety of multiphysics applications involving other engineering disciplines.Initiate and participate in subsequent sales opportunities to existing customers or the colleagues and other departments of existing customers. Training and Mentoring Develop your technical and simulation knowledge and abilities through working with sales and support cases both independently and in cooperation with other sales and applications engineers.Run introductory training courses along with heat transfer and related courses.Develop and mentor new applications engineers, technical account managers, and sales engineers on the COMSOL® software and its uses in certain application areas. Minimum Qualifications A master’s degree in engineering, physics, applied mathematics, or a physical science with six months or more experience in modeling CFD or heat transfer applications based on numerical methods, such as the finite element method or similar.Excellent communication skills on the phone, in person, and in writing.Current eligibility to work in the U.S.Employment-based visa sponsorship will not be offered for this position.This is an in-office position. Preferred Qualifications 3 peer-reviewed journal publications with a focus on computational modeling / numerical modeling in one of the following areas: Applied Mathematics/Physics, Heat Transfer, Computational Fluid Dynamics, or Chemical and Electrochemical Processes.Strong background in modeling radiative, convective heat transfer and turbulent flow. Experience with numerical methods and modeling in one or more of the following applications: surface-to-surface radiation and participating media, other heat transfer applications, such as thermal stresses, or conjugate heat transfer and other fluid flow-based heat transfer applications.A bonus would be a background or knowledge of electronics cooling, thermal management, furnaces etc.), multiphase flows (mold flow, evaporation etc.), combustion, rarefied flows (vacuum pumps, vacuum deposition etc.), and particle tracing, etc. Personal growth  Supporting your success in your role as an Applications Engineer will be other simulation engineers and software developers who occupy the top echelons of their areas of expertise. You will see and participate, on a daily basis, the development and operation of many and varied cutting-edge new technologies. As an applications engineer, you will work with some of the most preeminent engineers and scientists in their respective fields who are simulating innovations and ideas for the future.  About COMSOL  COMSOL is the leading innovator of multiphysics software for research and development (R&D). Our products are continuously pushing the boundaries of computer-aided engineering (CAE), so that our customers can solve challenging science and engineering problems and develop better products, faster.  The COMSOL product family enables our end users to solve even the most sophisticated science and engineering problems, thanks to our intuitive and flexible graphical user interface. We create the tools that drive new breakthroughs in physics and engineering — and we love what we do.  Working at COMSOL  The Burlington, MA, location is spacious, bright, and comfortable. Our kitchens are always stocked with fresh fruit, tea, and coffee. Employees enjoy a casual dress code, relaxed atmosphere, and free gym access. Our office is in an easy-to-find central location and we are within walking distance of many restaurants and the Burlington Mall.  The COMSOL Group is a fast-growing, high-tech engineering software company that was founded in Stockholm, Sweden, in 1986 and has grown to include 17 offices and a distributor network throughout the world. At COMSOL, Inc., we offer our employees:Compensation commensurate with skills and experience.Health and 401(k) plans with a company match and other benefits.A spacious, bright, and comfortable office with private workspaces.A surrounding office park with onsite restaurants, hotels, bars, and a free fitness center with workout classes. COMSOL is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.  Reference REF-6471 Job title Applications Engineer: Heat Transfer & CFD Location Burlington, MA, USA
Benefits: ['401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'Health insurance']

Description: We are the movers of the world and the makers of the future. We get up every day, roll up our sleeves and build a better world - together. At Ford, we’re all a part of something bigger than ourselves. Are you ready to change the way the world moves? Product Development uses design thinking & user experience methods to deliver breakthrough products and services that delight our customers. We bring innovative, exciting, and sustainable ideas to life. We have opportunities around the world for you to contribute to advancements in autonomy, electrification, smart mobility technologies, and more!  Ford’s Model E team is charged with delivering the company’s vision of a fully electric transportation future. Model e is customer-obsessed, entrepreneurial, and data-driven and is dedicated to delivering industry-leading customer experience for electric vehicle buyers and owners. You’ll join an agile team of doers pioneering our EV future by working collaboratively, staying focused on only what matters, and delivering excellence day in and day out. Join us to make positive change by helping build a better world where every person is free to move and pursue their dreams. In this position... Professional position utilizing engineering education and experience to design and release body in white and paint static sealing/adhesive systems. The Static Sealing D&R Engineer is responsible to design, develop, release, and validate both bulk material applications and sealing parts with an emphasis on functional performance, quality, cost, and weight. The Static Sealing D&R Engineer of a vehicle interfaces with the entirety of the vehicle structure and body production process offering a rewarding combination of teamwork, systems design, and critical thinking at the component level.   What you'll do… The engineer will lead the following design engineering activities from pre-program through launch: Understand sealing design to meet vehicle attributes including NVH and corrosion. Lead Purchasing and Finance in sealing supplier selection to achieve program targets. Develop sealing strategies and designs that meet customer requirements. Collaborate with Structures D&R’s and Vehicle Operations manufacturing teams to develop joints and processes that enable efficient and robust sealing. Interface with engineers of surrounding components and systems (closures, electrical, trim, etc.). Lead sealing supplier in development and delivery of sealing components. Kick off injection molded component tooling, manufacturing, layout, and testing. Release 3-D CAD that meets system design requirements. Lead prototype vehicle level build support for static sealing. Support vehicle control plan testing for water and air leaks. Deliver Final Engineering Sign-off and production vehicle launch at Ford assembly plants. You'll have… Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent field 2 years of experience as D&R Engineer or relevant course work for new graduates Strong collaborative, organizational, and visualization skills Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote), intermediate skills preferred Working knowledge of Catia CAD Excellent communication skills, including visual Willingness to support vehicle launches in both US and Canada Should also have… Reviewing CAD drawings and CAE models Reviewing and signing-off on component drawings Leading brainstorming and creating decision matrices to identify optimal solutions Applying 8D, fish-bone, and other problem solving methodology to root cause issues Applying DMAIC and DFSS principles Creating Boundary Diagrams, P-Diagrams, & DFMEA Leading design reviews based on Failure Mode Avoidance Maintaining DVP&R and signing-off on DV tests – including FMVSS requirements Even better, you may have... Recent product development experience with Ford body commodities Working level knowledge of Ford’s Global Product Development System Knowledge of Ford software systems: AIMS, WERS, FEDE, Team Center, Digital Buck, and Integrator You may not check every box, or your experience may look a little different from what we've outlined, but if you think you can bring value to Ford Motor Company, we encourage you to apply!   As an established global company, we offer the benefit of choice. You can choose what your Ford future will look like: will your story span the globe, or keep you close to home? Will your career be a deep dive into what you love, or a series of new teams and new skills? Will you be a leader, a changemaker, a technical expert, a culture builder…or all of the above? No matter what you choose, we offer a work life that works for you, including:   Immediate medical, dental, and prescription drug coverage Flexible family care, parental leave, new parent ramp-up programs, subsidized back-up child care and more Vehicle discount program for employees and family members, and management leases Tuition assistance Established and active employee resource groups Paid time off for individual and team community service A generous schedule of paid holidays, including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day Paid time off and the option to purchase additional vacation time. For a detailed look at our benefits, click here: https://clicktime.symantec.com/15uBY4g6VgSkUyaBh4tsa?h=3XP7E8eo50SrdpY7E1wIHWKUGg3C6EcO3s_DPxiuWd4=&u=https://fordcareers.co/GSRnon-HTHD Visa sponsorship is available for this position.  Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status. In the United States, if you need a reasonable accommodation for the online application process due to a disability, please call 1-888-336-0660. #LI-Hybrid

Description: Defense Design Engineer Department: Defense Engineering Shift: Office Day Shift Monday - Friday POSITION DETAILS Position Summary – Defense Screw Pump Design Engineer The Design Engineer is the central point for engineering activity through the design and manufacture of screw pumps made to customer or internal specifications. In the defense organization, the design engineer is presented with unique operational requirements which ultimately ensure that US service men and women return from duty safely. This is accomplished by leveraging your technical skills to meet the technical challenges presented by our customers and their unique applications. As a Design Engineer, you will collaborate with customers, sales teams, program manager, Quality, and manufacturing team members. You will efficiently utilize computer-aided engineering (CAE) systems, material requirements planning (MRP) systems, Engineering standards, and other analysis tools to create bills of material (BOMs), design new products, and revise existing products. You will also work closely with pump testing personnel to assess factory acceptance testing data, develop trends for similar pump types, and make data driven decisions on process improvements. Principal ActivitiesCreates CAE models, drawings, layouts, assembly instructions / visual guides, test specifications, BOMs and reports in support of customer orders, and finite element analyses.Completes drawing checks and tolerance stack-ups and drives the use and application of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T).Performs analysis of new design concepts, adapts concepts for success and produces analysis reports. Performs design verification and validation of custom order projects.Supports the development of Engineering standards, design specifications, analysis methods, design verification and product validation methods, development plans and structures necessary for translating engineering knowledge into new product designsInitiates and contributes to the creation of installation and operation instructions, care and maintenance instructions, assembly, visual aids and other customer facing documentation.Looks for ways to improve robustness of designs to reduce lead times and/or extend service life of units.Strives to grow their technical expertise in the understanding and application of new methods, technological developments, advanced concepts, principles, and methods, as assigned. When needed develops or improves analysis methods, tools and programs.Interprets, organizes, executes and coordinates the timely completion of assignments.Performs Pre- and Post-sale customer support as required.Any other duties needed to help fulfill our mission to support critical applications, while abiding by our organization’s values.Job Requirements: CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS Knowledge Skills & AbilitiesWorking knowledge of Solid Edge, Solid Works, or equivalentWorking knowledge of IFS (MRP/ERP system) or similar.Experience with BOM structuring and modificationStrong working knowledge of ASME Y14.5 GD&TWorking knowledge in Engineering Change Request/Order/NoticeAbility to work on cross-functional teams in the context of complex technical projects.Ability to serve as a project or team leader when required by the task or situation, while modelling appropriate positive influence and consensus building skills.Ability to create and present design, testing and other technical reports.Working knowledge of Lean as applied to both Engineering and Manufacturing processes including Six Sigma, Kaizen, DFMEA, PPAP, VA/VE, PFMEA, etc.Knowledge of foundry, machine shop and fabrication practicesAbility to program using languages such as VB, MATLAB, etc is desirable.Ability to travel (10% Domestic & International). Education & ExperienceBS in Mechanical Engineering.1-5 years of Engineering experience on industrial equipment (ideally fluids or rotating machinery related)Due to Government Contracts, all candidates must be a US Citizen CIRCOR is an EEO Employer of Females / Minorities / Veterans / Individuals with Disabilities  Get job alerts by email.   Sign up now! Join Our Talent Network!  Job SnapshotEmployee Type Full-Time   Location Monroe, NC (Onsite)   Job Type Design, Engineering, Manufacturing   Experience Not Specified   Date Posted 11/10/2023

Position: CAE Engineer - Occupant Safety(CPT, OPT, H1B)
Description: As a Safety Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in our organization, utilizing your technical expertise to ensure the safety and quality of our products. You will be responsible for a range of engineering tasks, from design analysis to project management. Your ability to work in a team, your commitment to excellence, and your communication skills will be essential in this role.Key Responsibilities:Complex Design Analysis: Utilize Computer Aided Engineering (CAE) software to perform intricate design analysis.Customer Requirements: Understand and interpret customer requirements and expectations for new product design and improvements.Independent Engineering Design: Develop engineering designs independently, showcasing your technical proficiency.Engineering Changes: Implement engineering changes as necessary to enhance product safety and performance.Problem Solving: Develop alternative design solutions and provide quick engineering solutions for complex issues.Documentation: Maintain detailed records of all activities and results in the CAE project database.Design Review Meetings: Participate in design review meetings, offering appropriate recommendations.Compliance and Standards: Ensure that all work adheres to company design, safety, quality, environmental compliance, and procedural standards.Communication: Communicate effectively with team members and customers regarding project-related matters.Design Guidance: Provide timely design guidance and support to the team to meet customer requirements.Project Planning: Assist management in establishing and updating project plans and priorities.Team Collaboration: Maintain positive working relationships with all levels of the organization.Skills Required:Solvers: Proficiency in LS-Dyna, Abaqus, Radioss, and Pamcrash is an advantage.Pre-Processors: Familiarity with ANSA and Primer is advantageous.Post-Processors: Experience with MetaPost, ANIMATOR, Hypergraph, and HyperView is advantageous.Operating Systems: Basic knowledge of Linux and Windows.Communication Skills: Strong communication skills with attention to detail.Software Proficiency: Medium knowledge of MS Office tools (Word, Excel, & PowerPoint) to provide written reports summarizing tasks.Teamwork: Dynamic team player with the ability to work self-sufficiently and proactively.Language: Fluency in English.Teamwork and Commitment: Ability to work effectively in a team, along with flexibility and commitment.Regulatory Compliance: Ability to understand and meet regulatory and other agreed design requirements and standards is essential.Education/Experience Required:Education: Technical background with a Graduate Diploma in Mechanical Engineering or a similar degree.Independence: Must be capable of producing results with minimal guidance.Regulatory Understanding: A creative attitude with the ability to understand and meet regulatory and other agreed design requirements and standards is essential.Experience: Several years of professional experience in the field of crash and safety.Customer Communication: Experience and skill in communicating effectively with customers.At our organization, we prioritize a healthy work-life balance and offer a hybrid working policy to ensure flexibility for our employees. Join us as a Safety Engineer and make a meaningful impact on product safety and quality.Job Type: Full-timePay: $70,778.70 - $80,711.98 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceExperience level:3 yearsSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Irvine, CA 92618: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Experience:Occupant Safety CAE: 3 years (Required)Work Location: Hybrid remote in Irvine, CA 92618

Description: About Hexagon    Hexagon is a global leader in sensor, software and autonomous solutions. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, and quality across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, safety, and mobility applications. Our technologies are shaping urban and production ecosystems to become increasingly connected and autonomous – ensuring a scalable, sustainable future. Hexagon’s Manufacturing Intelligence division provides solutions that utilise data from design and engineering, production and metrology to make manufacturing smarter.   Vacancy Name    Consulting Engineer III   Vacancy No    VN5900   Work Location    Novi, MI   Location Country    United States   Basis    Employee   Employment Type    Regular   Duration (if Temporary Contract) Main Tasks & Requirements      Responsible for ADAMS-focused MSC simulation services projects. Support numerous full-vehicle modeling and simulation programs onsite within an OEM Powertrain Dynamics/NVH team, analyzing time and frequency domain responses. Model detailed vehicle system models for durability load case generation. Correlate activities for suspension level and full vehicle assemblies to physical tests. Component and subsystem dynamic modeling, including powertrain, drivelines, leaf springs, bearings, and gears. Develop ADAMS-based custom events including ADAMS/Car-to-ADAMS/Car FMU co-simulation methodologies. Customization and scripting through Adams command language/Python macros. Technical resource for MSC.ADAMS Product Development for migrating ADAMS-focused events and templates from ADAMS/Chassis to ADAMS/Car. Technical resource for documentation, training material, presentations, and support, as needed, for internal sales staff.      REQUIREMENTS:  Master’s degree (or foreign equivalent)      in Mechanical Engineering, Aeronautical Engineering, or related field plus 2 years of experience in the offered position or as Mechanical Design Engineer, Consulting Engineer, or related position.      SPECIAL SKILLS REQUIREMENTS: Must possess expertise/knowledge sufficient to adequately perform the duties of the job being offered. Expertise/knowledge may be gained through employment experience or education. Such expertise/knowledge cannot be “quantified” by “time”. Required expertise/knowledge includes:     Experience with multi-body dynamics simulation tool. Experience with CAE engineering analysis. Experience with numerical analysis. Experience with vehicle modeling and simulation and powertrain simulation. Experience with correlation and debugging. Experience with suspension design and analysis. Flexible body integration experience. Macros and scripting experience. Custom functionality development experience. Knowledge of FEA.OTHER: Job Site: Novi, MI; 40 hours/week; Salary: $84,302 per year; If offered employment must have legal right to work in U.S. EOE.     CONTACT: Hexagon Manufacturing Intelligence, Inc., Attn: Lauren Fuhring, contact via email at lauren.fuhring@hexagon.com (Must Reference Job Code: MI1229)      This position is eligible for Hexagon Manufacturing Intelligence Inc.’s Employee Referral Program.

Description: Date Posted: 2023-11-28  Country: United States of America  Location: HOH12: Wheels & Brakes - Troy 101 Waco Street, Troy, OH, 45373 USA  Position Role Type: Onsite  Collins Aerospace is seeking an experienced Principal Dynamics Engineer who will provide support for the Aircraft Wheels & Brakes product line as it relates to managing the dynamic response to braking (friction induced vibration) and other sources of excitation due to product operation. This will include commercial and military product lines new product development supporting root cause investigation and design mitigation. In addition, you will interact with internal and external customers and collaborate with various global value stream groups. This role serves in an Onsite capacity at our Troy OH. facility Relocation assistance is available Primary Responsibilities Create and validate dynamics models (modal analysis, stability assessment, transient analysis, etc.), using ANSYS Mechanical, LS-Dyna and other CAE tools. Determine the parameters of the dynamics related dynamometer test program for development and qual (ie: fixture design/settings, stop parameters, etc.). Provide testing oversight supporting data acquisition and analysis. Maintain tools (instrumentation, macros, scripts, etc) needed for Dynamics support across programs. Provide design recommendations based on model and test results to understand and improve dynamic response and resolve exceedances as required. Lead technology development efforts resulting in new CAE tools and experimental methods to better support the product line. Travel 10% domestically and internationally when circumstances permit Communicate to Senior Level Leadership regarding brake dynamics items. Perform other duties as required. Basic Qualifications Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) unless prohibited by local laws/regulations and typically a minimum of 8 years prior relevant experience or an Advanced Degree in a related field and typically a minimum of 5 years of experience U.S. Person (U.S. citizen, permanent resident, refugee or asylee) or eligible to obtain necessary export authorizations required. https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-22/chapter-I/subchapter-M/part-120/subpart-C/section-120.62 2 or more years’ experience with Structural Dynamics, Noise Vibration Harshness (NVH) and/or Friction Induced Vibration product development. Experience with CAE (Computer Aided Engineering) software Experience performing FEA (Finite Element Analysis) Preferred Qualifications Aerospace experience with wheels and brakes Dynamics modeling proficiency (modal analysis and stability assessment) with CAE software platforms (ANSYS, LS-Dyna, etc.). Experience in testing setup, data acquisition and correlation of analytical results to test results. Experience in programming/scripting using MATLAB and Python. Collins Aerospace, a Raytheon Technologies company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market. Our Advanced Structures team leverages advanced materials and additive manufacturing to develop complex interior and exterior solutions. These solutions ensure structural integrity of the aircraft, help aircraft take off and land, stay trim in the air, move forward, carry cargo and conduct rescues. We delight our customers with superior products and best-in-class service. Our global team is committed to continuous improvement – we work hard to make our solutions lighter-weight, stronger and more technically advanced, so that plane travel can be safer, more affordable, and more sustainable in the years to come. We are looking for the best and brightest to fly and land with us! Diversity drives innovation, inclusion drives success. We believe a multitude of approaches and ideas enable us to deliver the best results for our workforce, workplace, and customers. We are committed to fostering a culture where all employees can share their passions and ideas so we can tackle the toughest challenges in our industry and pave new paths to limitless possibility. WE ARE REDEFINING AEROSPACE.Please consider the following role type definitions as you apply for this role. Onsite: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite. This includes all production and maintenance employees, as they are essential to the development of our products. Regardless of your role type, collaboration and innovation are critical to our business and all employees will have access to digital tools so they can work with colleagues around the world – and access to Collins sites when their work requires in-person meetings. Some of our competitive benefits package includes: Medical, dental, and vision insurance Three weeks of vacation for newly hired employees Generous 401(k) plan that includes employer matching funds and separate employer retirement contribution, including a Lifetime Income Strategy option. Tuition reimbursement program Student Loan Repayment Program Life insurance and disability coverage Optional coverages you can buy pet insurance, home and auto insurance, additional life and accident insurance, critical illness insurance, group legal, ID theft protection. Birth, adoption, parental leave benefits Ovia Health, fertility, and family planning Adoption Assistance Autism Benefit Employee Assistance Plan, including up to 10 free counseling sessions. Healthy You Incentives, wellness rewards program Doctor on Demand, virtual doctor visits Bright Horizons, child, and elder care services Teladoc Medical Experts, second opinion program And more! At Collins, the paths we pave together lead to limitless possibility. And the bonds we form – with our customers and with each other - propel us all higher, again and again. Apply now and be part of the team that’s redefining aerospace, every day. Collins Aerospace Landing Systems Video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7qcXPa0ZCeE RTX is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. Description: About Hexagon        Hexagon is a global leader in sensor, software and autonomous solutions. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, and quality across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, safety, and mobility applications. Our technologies are shaping urban and production ecosystems to become increasingly connected and autonomous – ensuring a scalable, sustainable future. Hexagon’s Manufacturing Intelligence division provides solutions that utilise data from design and engineering, production and metrology to make manufacturing smarter.       Vacancy Name        Aerospace Application Engineer       Vacancy No        VN5903       Work Location        Home Office - US or Canada       Location Country        United States       Basis        Employee       Employment Type        Regular       Duration (if Temporary Contract) Main Tasks & RequirementsHexagon's Manufacturing Intelligence division is seeking an Aerospace Application Engineer.             At             Hexagon, we strive to help industrial manufacturers develop the disruptive technologies of today and the life-changing products of tomorrow. Our strength comes from our global footprint and enormous portfolio of advanced industrial sensors, measurement technologies, factory automation, simulation, and analytics tools.            Description: Hexagon Design & Engineering's Technical team engages our customers, both existing and prospective, to drive adoption and demonstrate ongoing value. Application Engineers develop existing customers by engaging technical leads and executive teams in the use and expansion of our products and managing renewals. Application Engineers assist new customers with integrating Hexagon's CAE products into their engineering workflows to solve some of the world's most challenging problems.             A successful candidate in the D&E Application Engineer role will possess all of the attributes listed below in addition to an outgoing personality and ability to manage competing priorities. This is an established role on a high-performance team, so you can expect a fast pace, a challenging and rewarding work environment, and lots of autonomy.            What You’ll DoDrive retention and growth with customers, from small startups to large enterprises, by understanding their business needs and connecting those needs to a technical solution. Enable successful roll-out of Hexagon CAE products to customer employees, including sharing and developing relevant creative assets, brainstorming ideas, and attending launches virtually or in person. Maintain a cadence of communicating with customers about their adoption trends, sentiment, and mining opportunities for deeper engagement. Identify opportunities for customers to act as Hexagon advocates (e.g. testimonials, case studies) Collaborate closely with Sales to support presales activities, renewals, and expansion opportunities. Marshall resources across the Hexagon D&E org as needed to support customers' needs. Represent the voice of the customer to inform our sales process and product roadmap.RequirementsMinimum BS in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering; MS or PhD is a plus. 5+ years' experience with a high-level CAE solver (Nastran, Adams, Marc, or similar); experience in Customer Success, Customer Support, Application Engineering or similar role is a plus Exceptional communication skills, highly organized, collaborative and detail oriented Experience building and maintaining relationships, while working to mitigate churn and drive engagement and renewals. Empathetic, positive attitude with a desire to help our customers reach their goals. Must be authorized to work in the US.SkillsResults-driven mentality, with a bias for speed and action Strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into insights. Experience with Patran/Nastran, or other high-level CAE tools, is essential. Strong presentation skills. Previous experience as an instructor is a plus. Strong Python skills, as well as Linux scripting experience. Comfort in an environment that moves quickly and where you wear many hats At             Hexagon Manufacturing Intelligence, our spirited energy and engagement are evident in our commitment to our work, passion for what we do and the speed by which we achieve it. Here you will find the opportunity to build your career, develop professionally, and explore opportunities across a large, diversified company that prides itself on its innovative spirit and commitment to integrity.             We strive to attract the most talented and dynamic individuals in their fields because our success is in our people! Our culture encourages independent thinking and a team mentality. And we offer a competitive benefits package that’s second to none!            Exceptionalmedical, dental, vision insurancesFlexible Spending Accounts (FSA)401kwith employer matchGenerous Paid Time Off (PTO)Tuition Reimbursement Hexagon Metrology, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Vet/Disability E-Verify Participant

Description: Saratoga, CAE-Space US – Manufacturing /Full-Time/ On-Site     Ready to make connectivity from space universally accessible, secure and actionable? Then you’ve come to the right place!        E-Space is bridging Earth and space to enable hyper-scaled deployments of space-powered Internet of Things (IoT) solutions and services. We are fundamentally changing the design, economics, manufacturing, coverage limitations and service delivery associated with traditional satellite and terrestrial IoT systems.        By building a highly-advanced low Earth orbit (LEO) space system—with a unique antenna design, highly sustainable spacecraft system and low-cost, small portable end-user devices—we can extend global satellite coverage, capacity and connectivity beyond legacy space services to provide a new kind of IoT platform that lets users sense, track, connect and act on information gathered, anywhere.        We’re intentional, we’re unapologetically curious and we’re 100% committed to saving space, protecting our planet and turning connectivity into actionable intelligence.    What is this role: As a Manufacturing Engineer, you will be responsible to employ 'Design for X’ methodologies to every aspect of a new satellite product development program. Through careful planning, experimentation and automation you will be responsible for producing several spacecraft components, which includes owning the process from an early prototype phase through high volume production. For this role, you must have at least 3-5years of expertise in industrial, material or process engineering to procure, design, validate, test and operate an automated production system to create a uniquely designed, fully assembled spacecraft. This position will report to the Head of Manufacturing Engineering and will work closely with mechanical, electrical, RF and materials and process engineers. This position is based in our Saratoga, CA office. What you will do: Conduct trade studies, establish hardware requirements, lead design reviews and initiate procurement of robotic assembly process equipment Manage characterization, qualification and acceptance test planning and execution, including design and development of in-house prototyping Identify and implement continuous improvement projects with respect to first pass yield, cycle time reduction, product reliability, capacity enhancement and cost reduction Provide technical support analyzing and/or performing failure analysis for discrepant production components, assemblies and field returns Analyze prototype designs and existing manufacturing processes to identify risk, lead DFMEA/PFMEA reviews and incorporate and validate critical tests used in manufacturing Create process documentation and lead operator training of manufacturing equipment Drive maturity of the overall plant knowledge of technology, adoption of new technologies and ensure factories in the regions have the best access to the latest technological thinking and possible solutions Research, purchase, implement and troubleshoot electromechanical equipment problems including collaboration with third party equipment makers, as needed What you will bring to this role: Bachelor’s/Master's/PhD of Science in Industrial, Mechanical, Design Engineering or equivalent, plus 3-5 years of experience in relevant fields Hands-on team player, capable of safely operating various fabrication tools such as drill presses, power saws, soldering irons, vacuum chambers, etc. Solid understanding of continuous improvement methodologies such as LEAN or Six Sigma Demonstrated prior success working in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary, small-team environment with an ability to manage competing priorities Excellent technical communication and presentation skills,especiallyto a non-technical audience Enthusiastic energy to support and drive the development, implementation and operation of Industry 4.0 and IIoT initiatives Strong collaborative and analytical skills Ability to travel internationally up to 4wks of your time Bonus points: Prior experience working with advanced mechanical assemblies and/or PCBA integration Previous knowledge and responsibility for deploying robotic or another form of industrial automation on a factory production line Prior oversight for managing a production line producing over 30,000 parts per year     $50,000 - $130,000 a year        The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position in question, which is based on market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on location, skills and expertise, depth of relevant experience, and other relevant factors. For questions about this, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply for the role and are selected for an interview.        We want you to make the most of your journey at E-Space. That’s why we support and invest in the physical, emotional and financial well-being of our team members and their families. Some of what you can expect when working at E-Space:    Why E-Space is right for you: We want you to make the most of your journey at E-Space. That’s why we support and invest in the physical, emotional and financial well-being of our team members and their families. Some of what you can expect when working at E-Space:    An opportunity to really make a differenceSustainability at our coreFair and honest workplaceInnovative thinking is encouragedCompetitive salariesContinuous learning and developmentHealth and wellness care optionsFinancial solutions for the future Optional legal services (US only)Paid holidaysPaid time off

Description: JOB SUMMARY Conducts analytical structural and forming studies through FEA techniques on automotive components and systems. QUALIFICATIONS Education Required: Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or related field of study Education Preferred: master's degree in mechanical engineering or related field of study Years of Experience: Minimum three to five (3-5) years of related experience required; five to seven (5-7) years of related experience preferred. Other Skills/Experience -Required: Knowledge of FE software such as Ansa/Hypermesh, Nastran, Abaqus, Optistruct, Heeds, LS Dyna, nCode, FEMFAT, optimization tools, and post-processing tools Able to perform linear, non-linear, and dynamic simulations. Knowledge of structural requirements for durability, NVH, and crashworthiness Strong theory knowledge in solid mechanics, strength of materials, and dynamics Other Skills/Experience -Preferred: Process and manufacturing knowledge covering forming, joining, and assembly. Experience in developing BIW, closures, and chassis components Experience working with TeamCenter PLM ESSENTIAL DUTIES: Interpret and follow project guidelines with minimal follow-up or additional resources needed to complete tasks. Run multiple simulation projects correctly and efficiently to meet all program timelines. Actively work on developing new processes, procedures, and methods for analysis. Provide further development of calculation methods, in particular the definition of substitute load cases or replacement models. Use computer FEA software and equipment (i.e. Ansa/Hypermesh, Nastran, LS-Dyna, Abaqus, nCode, FEMFAT, and optimization-DOE/post-processing tools) to perform engineering simulations. Ensure model and post-processing are completed in accordance with quality requirements, customer specifications, and Company standards. Work with cross-functional teams to support the design, test, and structural development of components and systems by applying root-cause analysis and countermeasure proposals for issues identified during product development and testing phases. Correlate experimental data to simulation data. Analyze FEA results and proposed product changes to determine feasibility or potential improvement of components and systems to initiate optimization within the project. Write technical reports to explain the FE results and provide recommendations to improve overall design. Perform additional duties as assigned. HEALTH, SAFETY AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSIBILITIES Required to follow health, safety and environmental regulations specified in the Employee Handbook as well as any rules or standards otherwise specified by government regulations and/or government agencies. Expected to exercise safe work practices in all work activities and report any unsafe conditions or actions, injuries, or near misses involving yourself or other team members to the appropriate supervisor. PHYSICAL DEMANDS While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to speak, hear, and use hands to keyboard, handle, grasp, and touch. The employee is required to reach with hands and arms and have adequate mobility to stand, walk, sit, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to twenty-five (25) pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. WORK ENVIRONMENT The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate but may occasionally approach very high levels when moving around a factory floor.
