Description: Company Overview: M.C. Dean is Building Intelligence™. We design, build, operate, and maintain cyber-physical solutions for the nation’s most recognizable mission-critical facilities, secure environments, complex infrastructure, and global enterprises. Our success relies on great people delivering innovative projects and solutions for Fortune 100 companies and the most recognized agencies in government, defense, and security. Join our more than 4,500 employees worldwide who engineer and deploy automated, secure, and resilient power and technology systems; and deliver the management platforms essential for long-term system sustainability. Together we are creating the integrated systems and technologies that shape the built and cyber-physical world. Position Overview: The Controls System Engineer 4 is responsible for Designing, Developing, Installing and Maintaining equipment used to monitor Control Systems, Machinery, and processes. This position will be supporting a multitude of industries including Industrial Controls, Water/Wastewater, Power Controls, and Transportation Systems. The Controls System Engineer 4 is expected to provide overall development, training & leadership to Junior Engineering Leadership, Design Production & Detailing personnel as it relates to the strategic planning, overall implementation & ownership of project completion. Core Market Sector: The candidate being considered must have an extreme knowledge & understanding of Controls Engineering, Automation Systems, and Specifications Development across complex, New-Build & Design-Build Commercial & Industrial industries on a national scale. Position Requirements: Must have experience and previous knowledge in developing and providing quality solutions to complex challenges within Electrical & Controls Design specific to specialty engineering & construction. Key understanding of Subsystem Design components including CAD, Panels, Layouts, Wiring, SCADA Screens, Hardware & Communications. Advanced knowledge and working experience in technical engineering aspects including: o Application of Engineering Principles, Design Techniques, Systems Start-Up, Troubleshooting & Testing, Configuration, along with Controls schematics knowledge specific to a multitude of Controls Engineering and Design Systems for a variety of key-clientele. Applied experience utilizing collaborative techniques to effectively lead a diverse project-team in a constructive and positive manner. Explicit understanding of diverse Programming, Configuration & Troubleshooting efforts within Automation & SCADA applications including: o PLCs o RTUs o HMI Systems  Provide success in leading technical meetings, strategy driven discussions and solution-method ideas that result in positive conclusions.  Proficient understanding of Cost Estimation, Finance Systems and Advanced Principles of Financial Management as it relates to Engineering & Specialty Construction. Key understanding of Subsystem Design components including CAD, Panels, Layouts, Wiring, SCADA Screens, Hardware & Communications. Position Responsibilities: Responsible for all Design & Engineering efforts for a multitude of Controls & Automation specialties specific to both medium & small projects in support of complex programs. Develops, Executes & Reviews design documents, design procedures, test reports & ensures the preparation of specifications for all projects assigned. Ability to perform technical functions related to Testing, Troubleshooting, Deployment & Commissioning of Controls Systems within technical specialty scopes. Creates & conducts test plans, testing & commissioning procedures for a multitude of control systems. Performs QA/QC functions & reviews all technical designs to ensure accuracy of engineering plans. Ensures all troubleshooting is performed on service calls to existing & legacy system operations. Responsible for the development of test fixtures & simulation devices, along with performing Factory & Field-Testing Maintenance. Ability to Evaluate & Price change orders as required within timeline expectations to ensure all project deliverables are being met. Ability to perform a multitude of Preconstruction efforts to include: o Development of Cost Estimates o Bid Package Creation o Development of Bid Proposals Previous experience leading Bid Proposal meetings with Executive Leadership & Key-Stakeholders specific to both medium & large projects. Partners with Key-Stakeholders to review project-scopes & scheduling progress on a consistent basis. Applied proficiency in effectively utilizing presentation tools and techniques, to deliver a clear understanding of project details to the appropriate parties. Build Testing, Design Plans & Procedures for Integrated Systems Factory Testing. Ability to perform Cost Estimates, Create Bid Packages & lead Bid Proposal meetings with Executive Leadership & Key-Stakeholders specific to both medium & large projects. Leadership Responsibilities: Conducts research & follows technical trends to contribute to business pursuit strategies specific to complex project scopes across diverse controls & automation specialties. Responsible for leading design & engineering project teams as it pertains to assigning technical deliverables to junior engineers & administrative support for all projects aligned. Develops & Mentors entry-level Engineers, along with providing the daily direction of critical tasks & coordination necessary to ensure pending items are completed on-site. Education, Experience & Technical Qualifications: Minimum 7-9 years of technical Controls Engineering & Systems Design experience with a Bachelor’s Degree in Construction Management or an Engineering discipline with a strong preference to Electrical. 5-7 years of related experience with a Master’s Degree in Construction Management or Engineering. Required knowledge within Engineering Leadership functions including technical design & engineering abilities, proficiency of applied principles, & prioritization of deliverable deadlines tied to each specialty-trade simultaneously. Minimum 5+ years of experience & established Electrical System knowledge specific to Controls, Automation, Complex Programming, SCADA Systems & Simulation Devices within scopes including both new construction & existing building upgrades. Extensive experience leading diverse teams & complex engineering solutions specific to projects & industries within Government, Commercial, Industrial &/or Manufacturing. Proficiency in a multitude of Engineering Software’s, Technologies & Application Methods Including: o Computer Networks o CAD/CAE Software (AutoCAD/EPLAN) o Microsoft Project or Primavera P6 o Microsoft Office Required Certifications: PLC/Automation Platforms Including one or more of the following: o Schneider o Rockwell o Siemens o Niagara SCADA Platforms Including one or more of the following: o Wonderware o Iconics o Ignition Desired Licenses & Certifications: Design Build Institute of America (DBIA) Certified SCADA Security Architect (CSSA) Certified Automation Professional (CAP) Professional Engineer (PE) in relevant field. Physical Abilities Required: Exposure to computer screens for an extended period. Sitting for extended periods of time. Reach by extending hands or arms in any direction. Have finger dexterity to manipulate objects with fingers rather than whole hands or arms, for example, using a keyboard. Dana is a global leader in the supply of highly engineered driveline, sealing, and thermal-management technologies that improve the efficiency and performance of vehicles with both conventional and alternative-energy powertrains. Serving three primary markets – passenger vehicle, commercial truck, and off-highway equipment – Dana provides the world's original-equipment manufacturers and the aftermarket with local product and service support through a network of nearly 100 engineering, manufacturing, and distribution facilities. Job Purpose Assist in all phases of customer BEV programs / projects from customer RFQ to production launch. Facilitate internal communications between Engineering, Sales, Quality, Manufacturing and Assembly for specific programs / projects (voice of customer within the Dana organization). Perform Dana product application & performance analysis for new customer programs Lead in determining and specifying the best vehicle architecture configurations to meet customer vehicle requirements Lead in packaging Dana BEV sub-systems & components into customer chassis. Complete engineering/design requirements/definition for offshore design group. Benchmarking of competitive BEVs and components/sub-systems. Complete customer program PDS, BOM, DFMEA, DVP, ED&T, and support RFQ response. Lead and provide hands-on support of special vehicle builds as well as coordination of special orders. Support Advanced Program Quality Planning and Design Review activities. Develop and lead implementation of BEV component cost savings and assembly process improvement proposals. Attend/facilitate/host customer engineering meetings and help bring open issues to closure. Provide BEV expertise in support of the customer's requirements. Engage with customer engineering community, representing Dana in a positive, ethical, and professional manner. Qualifications Desired: Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering (BSME) preferred. Consideration may be given to candidates with other engineering degrees such as manufacturing, industrial or aeronautical with strong experience in product design. 5+ years’ experience in design or manufacture of driveshaft components and assemblies for automotive industry. Experience in drivetrain/powertrain/chassis engineering or related field is a plus Experience with battery electric vehicles and/or components a plus Basic CAD, CAE, and dimensional stack-up skills Excellent mechanical aptitude, along with strong analytical capability. Understanding of engineering prints and specifications. Must have excellent interpersonal skills to work with people at all levels within Dana and customers in a professional manner. Ability to develop strong customer relationships Strong project management/follow-up skills in order to organize multiple responsibilities and meet multiple deadlines. Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills. Knowledge of automotive quality standards including APQP, DVP&R, 8D, PPAP,VE/VA, & FMEA Must be self-directed and motivated individual who is willing to accept responsibility. Willing and able to work excess hours when necessary. Must be able and willing to travel domestically and internationally. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Position: Mechanical EngineerBig Metal Additive (BMA) is an engineering and manufacturing company. We produce high value customized metal components for our space, aerospace, maritime, energy and industrial customers. We provide value added engineering services with these products. BMA has captured and executed engineering development projects for pressure vessels, cryogenic tanks, satellite chassis components, air vehicle components and other products. We are now in a phase of production readiness for several products which require strict compliance with material standards, process standards, performance requirements, inspection requirements and adherence to our Quality Management System.We are looking for a professional Mechanical Engineer experienced with CAD, CAM and CAE software and metal product manufacturing operations. We produce large metal products with CNC controlled additive manufacturing machines and robots. The Mechanical Engineer provides the digital analysis, model adjustments and toolpath work instructions to operate the machines. Experience with CAM for CNC machining is a prerequisite. Working closely with Manufacturing Engineers, Operators and Quality Engineers is considered daily teamwork.Our company culture has a lean business model with hardworking, professional people, and an emphasis on a respectful and pleasant work environment. Our leadership team includes a globally recognized, award winning founder who continues to challenge the team with exciting new opportunities. BMA has recently won a prestigious industry Innovation Award for which we were nominated by a customer.Description:Big Metal Additive is seeking an experienced Mechanical Engineer responsible for product digital design and manufacturing. Customer CAD models are analyzed for producibility, and recommendations are made for adjustments to improve manufacturing. The additive manufacturing process is planned in CAM software, creating toolpaths, and verifying them with simulation. Toolpaths are post processed for a CNC controller and shared with a Manufacturing Engineer; close collaboration on machine operation and performance is a big part of the job. The BMA process uses MIG welding to produce large, sophisticated components – therefore MIG welding experience is helpful to understand the manufacturing process. Weekly assignments include coordinating activities for multiple manufacturing projects and development efforts, prioritizing tasks appropriately to deliver on a range of responsibilities.The Mechanical Engineer shall use CAD software to examine, analyze and manipulate customer digital models. The Mechanical Engineer shall plan toolpaths for the additive manufacturing process using CAM software. The Mechanical Engineer shall simulate the toolpaths in a virtual environment for validation and post process the toolpaths to CNC code. The Mechanical Engineer shall work closely with BMA teammates during the additive manufacturing process to adjust toolpaths, part design or CNC code. Responsibilities include creating and editing production work instructions, accurate daily project documentation, and complying with quality standards and customer requirements.Experience with Siemens NX is highly valued. Experience working in a factory manufacturing environment with Additive Manufacturing or CNC type machines is necessary. Work experience in an AS9100 or API Q1 quality management manufacturing environment is important (ISO9001 may be considered). This position reports to the General Manager and includes frequent cross functional collaboration with other BMA engineers.Good technical writing skills are critical. Effective creation/editing high quality, technical PowerPoint presentations and written reports are essential. Regular documentation of operations, processes, and records are essential. Meeting deadlines on time is imperative.The company values at Big Metal Additive are hard-working, high integrity founded on personal accountability and kind behavior that embodies acceptance of other people. It can be a professionally demanding workplace but for those who match the company values, it is a rewarding place to work.Big Metal Additive (BMA) is committed to manufacturing high-quality metal components that meet or exceed the requirements and expectations of our customers. This will be ensured by having an efficient and reliable Quality Management System in accordance with AS9100D and API Q1. We will actively pursue measurable and continuous improvement of our products, processes, and people. Everyone at BMA is expected and encouraged to be a champion for quality, continuous improvement, and customer satisfaction.Requirements:· US Citizen with BS engineering degree from accredited engineering college· Significant experience CAD, CAM and simulations (NX preferred)· Significant experience with CNC manufacturing operations· Significant experience with business operations software and applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote and Outlook· Experience operating, documenting, and delivering within a Quality Management System manufacturing environment· Experience with engineering MIG welding5+ years’ experience in manufacturing, mechanical, metallurgical, or engineering fields involving complex or high-performance products compliant with quality standards and delivered to customers.Additional Information:Big Metal Additive is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.Job Type: Full-time (40 hours per week minimum)Salary: BOEBenefits:401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Denver, CO 80239: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (required).Work Location: On-site, Denver, CO 80239Job Type: Full-timePay: $70,000.00 - $110,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftWork Location: In person

Description: What We Do  FOX Factory designs, engineers, manufactures and markets performance-defining products and systems for customers worldwide. Our premium brand, performance-defining products and systems are used primarily on bicycles, side-by-side vehicles, on-road vehicles with and without off-road capabilities, off-road vehicles and trucks, all-terrain vehicles, snowmobiles, specialty vehicles and applications, motorcycles, and commercial trucks. Some of our products are specifically designed for and marketed to a variety of leading cycling and powered vehicle original equipment manufacturers ("OEMs"), while others are distributed to consumers through a global dealer and distribution network. Fox Factory Holding Corp. is the holding company of FOX Factory, Inc. and is publicly traded (FOXF) on Nasdaq.   Why you should join us    Not only do we provide competitive wages, you will also have access to great benefits and employee    discounts. But more importantly, it’s a fun environment where we truly enjoy working as a team and    bringing great products to our customers!    If this sounds like something you would love to do, and a place you want to be a part of, get in touch    with us by submitting your application. We look forward to hearing from you!    Position Summary:    Apply shock building expertise to generate industry leading prototype products for our customers. Will be required to work in a fast-paced environment with numerous internal and external teams to meet deadlines.    Position Responsibilities:  Follows directions to modify or create CAD models and detail drawings. Use computer-assisted drafting (CAD) equipment and software. Assists with the drafting of final drawings. Uses mathematical formulas for calculations frequently. May utilize CAD/CAM/CAE or other mini or PC technology. Perform assembly tear downs for quick root cause analysis. Collect and aggregate component data into various software packages Perform basic data analysis guided by engineering team needs. Maintain measurement equipment for proper function, calibrations and necessary service or upgrades. Works in a safe manner in accordance with Fox policies. Quality is a top priority. Adaptability & Innovation: Proactively and willingly adapts to changing business needs and conditions and presents creative and fresh ideas on how to solve problems, gain efficiencies and improve quality. Relationship Building: Builds constructive working relationships characterized by a high level of inclusion, cooperation and mutual respect. Accountability: Takes personal responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work and strives to exceed requirements. Decision Making and Judgment: Makes timely, informed decisions that take into account the facts, goals, constraints and risks. Talent Development (Self and Others): Displays an ongoing commitment to learning and self-improvement; making an effort to acquire new knowledge or skills associated with job responsibilities. Willingness to work with others and coach/teach in effort to develop and support other employees’ development.   Position Qualifications:    Education:    AA degree in a technical discipline or equivalent experience    Experience:    2+ years of relevant work and CAD/drafting experience    Work Environment and Physical Requirements:    Office Environment    Ability to lift 50 lbs.    Requires walking, standing, bending and lifting for long periods of time    Vision abilities required to validate and enter data on computer    Some physical work including but not limited to shock disassembly and part measurement  Disclaimer: This list does not represent all physical demands. Description: TITLE: Powertrain Virtual Analysis EngineerDUTIES: Responsible for performing Durability and Fatigue assessment of Transmissions, Axles and Driveline components and systems using virtual analysis tools. Following established methodologies, identifying future improvements in analysis capability and documenting new analysis procedures. Using commercial CAE tools such as, Hypermesh, Simlab, Meshworks, ANSA, Abaqus, Nastran, MASTA and Fatigue software. Requirements:  REQUIREMENTS: Master's degree (or foreign academic equivalent) in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field of study, and 2 years of experience in job offered or related position working with automotive powertrain. Experience must include: using CAE software, including Hypermesh, Simlab, Meshworks, Abaqus, Nastran; using Gear software, including MASTA and Fatigue tools Ncode / FEMFAT; working with Torque Power flow in trans/axle driveline; working with NVH; knowledge of automotive engine, transmission, or drivetrain requirements and function; and knowledge of casting, forging, machining, general manufacturing processes and transmission / axle driveline functions.OTHER: Job Site: 800 Chrysler Drive, Auburn Hills, MI 48326. 40 hours/week. Description: Gamma Technologies, LLC (GT) is looking for a Product Engineer – User Experience with a solid work ethic, excellent judgment, and a desire to build a long-term career with us. Position Summary As a Product Engineer in the User Experience team, you will help our customers get the most out of our software with GT-SUITE’s sophisticated user interface that enables our customers to build, run, and analyze output produced by our physics engine. Building models often occurs within collaborative environments at our clients, and we deliver the capabilities to efficiently re-use data, share subsystems of larger models with other groups, and deploy front-end interfaces (including web-based) for users with different levels of experience. Running models involves model validation and real-time run-time monitoring, requiring extensive user experience design. Post-processing involves setting up customized reports and utilizing data analytics techniques ranging from data smoothing and trendline generation to using sophisticated machine learning techniques to answer engineering questions. Visualization is also a key capability that allows our customers to generate plots, tables, and diagrams that allow effective digestion of physical trends to make engineering decisions. Job ResponsibilitiesEngage with customers to identify and prioritize UI / UX development opportunities to deliver best-in-class softwareDefine and own the long-term vision for the user experience of key components of GT-SUITE’s user interfaceAct as product owner for your assigned areas of our user interfaceGenerate feature proposals to satisfy design requirementsManage concurrent development projects to deliver timely feature updates to GT-SUITEParticipate in sprint planning, standups, etc. representing your component(s) of the softwareWork with customers after the delivery of features to support a high quality user experienceEducation, Experience, and SkillsBS or BA in Engineering, Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction disciplines, or other similar technical degrees.5+ years of experience with product management/ownership, or experience as a user of CAE software is preferredAdditional Qualifications Desired:Experience with product management/ownership of web applicationsExperience with Agile development methods and associated tools such as JIRAExperience with PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) Software, such as Siemens Teamcenter or Dassault Enovia/3DS is a plusSalary and BenefitsGT offers competitive pay, vacation, sick and personal days, and a work environment that allows you to grow and prosper.We offer best-in-class health benefits for you and your dependents.We offer a 401k and Roth 401k retirement plans.We provide an onsite fitness center.The primary work location will be our Westmont, IL office. We’ve adopted a hybrid work policy asking employees to report to the office three days per work week.As an organization, we value collaborating and learning from our peers in person, while providing the necessary flexibility for our employees to have a meaningful work-life balance.Other Requirements and Notes:Due to the issuance of Executive Order 14042 which effectively mandates COVID-19 vaccination for all U.S.-based employees of federal contractors and subcontractors, all U.S.-based GT employees will be required to be fully vaccinated by January 18th, 2022, or by their first date of employment if after that date, subject to legally required accommodations.All candidates must be eligible to work in the US for any employer; no third parties, please.Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere is at the heart of our company. We promote diversity of thought, culture, and background, which connects the entire Gamma Technologies community. As such, Gamma Technologies is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance.About Gamma Technologies, LLC GT, a leading multi-physics CAE simulation software provider, develops a suite of integrated solutions that guides and accelerates the engineering transformation of today’s products in the transportation, power generation, and industrial equipment industries. GT’s flagship product, GT-SUITE, an engineering simulation software is used by over 600 companies including all global automotive manufacturing companies GT-SUITE includes a complete library of physics-based modeling templates covering fluid flow, thermal systems, mechanics, electrics, magnetics, chemistry and controls. It supports the entire product development cycle from concept to validation. GT-SUITE applications include a wide variety of engineering systems such as conventional, electrified and fully electric vehicles and their powertrains, engines and catalysts, batteries, motors and power electronics, pumps and compressors, thermal management and HVAC, hydraulics and lubrication, multi-body mechanics and much more. GT-SUITE software comes with exciting and easy-to-learn User Interfaces, ranging from 3D pre-processing to real-time monitoring. The entire software platform uses state-of-the-art backend technologies that leverage the growing popularity of high-performance centers and the cloud. At GT, we are committed to using technology to make a global impact by helping the industry deliver products for a cleaner, sustainable environment! We pride ourselves on our company culture which encourages collaboration between all levels at the company, from entry-level to upper management. Within a team, daily interactions and outside social events allow us to form bonds that result in higher productivity and job satisfaction.

Description: Position Overview:     Navistar has an exciting new opportunity for an   Engineer – Frames and Assemblies at our headquarters in Lisle, IL. The Engineer will work in Navistar’s Chassis Engineering product development group which is accountable for all design development and system ownership of frame systems across all our commercial vehicles. The systems include frame ladder (long members, cross-members, front end castings, and sheet metal structures, etc.), cab and chassis access steps and step mounting structures, after treatment device covers, battery boxes, fifth wheels, high voltage battery mounting, and fuel tank protective structures for buses.    Duties include design release, CAD modeling, BOM structure, development of engineering requirements and verification plans for new product development. Also, includes sustaining projects including current product manufacturing issue problem solving. Duties include assignments on multiple programs to deliver to cost and quality goals utilizing engineering analysis and experience in metal fabrications, castings, and extrusions.    The Engineer – Frames and Assemblies will be required to perform engineering judgment and provide recommendations in a design review environment.  Responsibilities:  Research and Design new products and systems for customer needs Modify existing products or processes to improve vehicle performance using computer-aided design (CAD) and computer-assisted engineering (CAE) Integrate suppliers into design development to create prototypes for Design Validation Develop new options and combinations of features to meet customer needs Provide technical support and information to production plant team to ensure product integrity Maintain production orders by performing containments (interim corrective actions) and releases (permanent corrective actions) Mentor junior engineers in the accomplishment of the tasks listed Participate in the budgeting process by estimating program effort and preparing project plans for assigned work Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 2 years of experience in product design/development and/or computer science experience   OR  Master’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science Additional Requirements:      Qualified candidates, excluding current Navistar employees, must be legally authorized on an unrestricted basis (US Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident, Refugee or Asylee) to be employed in the United States. Navistar does not anticipate providing employment related work sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B status)    Desired Skills:  Experience in truck and/or automotive design and development process Experience in design release process Experience in Unigraphics/NX 3D modeling software is a plus Understanding of manufacturing processes such as metal forming, stamping, and casting Structural design experience is a plus MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Project Company Overview:     Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t.  Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts.  With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com. Description: Description:  About Sanden Sanden Corporation is a multinational manufacturing company that specializes in a wide range of products, including automotive air conditioning systems, refrigeration equipment, vending machines, and electric compressors. With its headquarters located in Japan, Sanden Corporation has a global presence, with production facilities and offices in countries such as the United States, Mexico, China, India, and Thailand, among others. We have a strong commitment to innovation, sustainability, and customer satisfaction, and it has been a trusted supplier for some of the world's leading automotive and refrigeration brands. Sanden Corporation's extensive expertise and advanced technology make it a leader in the industry, and its dedication to quality and efficiency has made it a respected name in the global market. Purpose of this Job: This job is responsible for supporting OEM applications of Sanden electric compressor products and obtaining new business through promoting technical capabilities Principle Duties/Essential Functions: Function as technical interface between customer and Sanden internal departments and ensure customer satisfaction Conduct product DFMEA, design changes, validation plan, validation reports reviews with customers and obtain approvals Manage math data and software changes, and work with customer vehicle integration team to ensure Sanden product meets vehicle requirement Responsible for Sanden product warranty analysis and coordinated return parts analysis Other Tasks/Responsibilities: Cascade customer requirements to Sanden internal departments and coordinate internal activities to ensure product development is complying with customer technical requirements and milestones Gather voice of customer on new product direction and communicate to Sanden headquarter Attend vehicle program team meetings as directed by the customer Lead packaging study and work with Design Engineering to ensure Sanden product fits vehicle packaging requirement Responsible for awareness and compliance with company Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. Contributing to the effectiveness of the EHS policies and procedures by communicating and reporting unsafe conditions and/or non-compliance Competencies: Critical Thinking Technological Knowledge Active Learning Complex Problem-Solving Skills Innovative Thinking Organizational Skills Requirements:   Education: Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering Knowledge, Skills, and Experience: 4+ years working with automotive electrical products similar to compressors, inverter/motor design & control software/hardware, including CAN / LIN communication. Knowledge of HVAC system Knowledge of mechanical compressors, especially scroll compressors Working knowledge of current computer technology and applications such as CAE and MS Office applications Excellent communication and presentation skills with internal and external customers Knowledgeable of ISO-9001, ISO-14001 and IATF procedures Physical Demands: Routine lifting of 25 lb. loads (compressors) may be necessary Possible exposure to high noise levels Possible exposure to chemicals (oils, refrigerants, solvents). Exposure to environmental temperatures of 30 - 110 degrees Fahrenheit Ability to work effectively under pressure and be able to prioritize workloads Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): PPE may be required based on specific projects Work Environment: The primary work area is in an office setting. Open office layout promotes collaboration, conversation, and teamwork to drive results. Healthy work-life balance – flexible hours and paid time off. Normal office hours – support may be needed during off hours. Diverse culture. Benefits: health, dental, vision, disability, and retirement plan. Primary Work Location: Plymouth, MI Company management reserves the right to add, delete, or otherwise alter assigned duties at any time. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The minimum qualifications listed are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required.

Position: CAE Engineer II - CAE Methods Development
Description: Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Goken America is an Engineering Services and Product Development company founded in 2004. At Goken America we strive to expand and deliver upon our company motto of “Creating Something Different”. We are continually striving to strengthen our organization, and are always seeking talented individuals who have a strong desire to work in an environment where they can make a difference.    Our “Vision” is to empower our associates to affect change wherever change is needed. Our “Mission” is that in building trust we foster greatness in our people, excellence in our clients and impact in our communities.    Goken America provides an excellent benefits package, one month of paid time off per year and a very competitive compensation plan. In addition, when applicable, we will also provide relocation assistance, temporary housing, visa support and other fringe benefits.  This role will be responsible for creating and validating CAE methods and processes related to the Optimization of 1D/3D CAE models, Automation of CAE workflows, and robustness (stochastic) processes. Responsibilities Utilize CAE and programming language tools for creating and validating CAE methods and processes related to the Optimization of 1D/3D CAE models, Automation of CAE workflows, and robustness (stochastic) processes. Must be able to optimize and correlate analyses with real-world test results. Communicates effectively within the group about issues, and outside the group to accomplish goals. Analyze and resolve problems with moderate level of guidance and direction. Lead research activities to develop new and improve existing CAE methods. Utilizes Excel to create and update project schedules. Travel to client site required. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Engineering and 5+ years relevant exp. or Master’s degree in Engineering and 3+ years relevant exp. Education with the following specialties preferred: Mechanical, Mechanical Technology, Aerospace, Automotive, Electrical. Strong Microsoft Office skills, including excel. Proficiency with CAE software such as iSight and modeFRONTIER. Proficiency with programming language software such as Matlab, Python, and VBA. Experience with Hypermesh and Ansa. Experience with various CAE software such as Abaqus, Nastran, StarCCM+, GT-Suite, SimPack, AmeSim is preferred. CAD (CATIA V5/V6) design experience preferred. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to handle or feel and reach with hands and arms.   Goken America (“Goken”) is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, or any other applicable protected basis under federal, state, or local law. Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is, in simple terms, a change in the way things are typically done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity. Please inform Goken’s personnel representative if you need assistance completing this application or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Description: We're ALTEN Technology USA, an engineering company that provides solutions for engineering, technology, and product development projects. Description: In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!  When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.  Job Description: Ready to be part of a team that tackles infrastructure challenges? Want to take your Engineering skills to the next level to work on tough projects that will make a huge impact on the community?   Parsons is now hiring experienced Engineers with a desire to work on large infrastructure projects that change the fabric of our community. Parsons extensive experience in this field, combined with your engineering knowledge, will propel your career forward with opportunity for advancement with top performance. Training, development and opportunities to work on marquee projects as you and our fastpaced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, enthusiastic to work in highly flexible, team oriented environment and who have exceptional communication, analytical and organizational skills. In this role, you will perform a variety of engineering tasks by applying standard engineering techniques and analyses within a discipline, which may involve CAE (computer aided engineering)/CAD (computer aided design) applications. Willingness to travel to supplier, client, or construction site locations is expected.   Responsibilities: Completes a variety of assignments such as drawings, specifications, and other materials suitable for procurement and construction purposes, utilizing CAE/CAD as applicable. Prepares standard engineering computations, material quality takeoffs, estimates, surveys, and designs. Prepares detailed requisitions for equipment and materials. Reviews small and portions of larger supplier drawing submittals and assists in performing technical bid analyses. Prepares and issues specifications, data sheets, and other construction documents. Provides input and technical guidance to CAD Designer/Drafters, Designers, and lower level Engineers working on the same project. Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.   Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering (or related field) and 3+ years of related work experience Experience in chemical process design projects, including rotating equipment selection and specification, developing and reading P&IDs, and managing equipment lists. Experience working on interdisciplinary teams to design modifications to existing chemical process systems. Engineer in Training (EIT) Certificate preferred Working knowledge of CAD and other PC software packages typically associated with engineering Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None  This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.  For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.  Salary Range: $68,400.00 - $142,600.00  We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!  The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates. Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.  We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

Description: Chassis CAD Design Engineer Major Responsibilities Work as a mechanical design engineer (CAD based) within the Chassis department working from our development center in Irvine, California (hybrid role = expectation to be able to attend on site for weekly team meetings and design reviews upon request)  Work closely with Design Release Engineers (DREs) to design / package a variety of chassis components ranging from; wheels, brake components, suspension & control arm components, structure & subframe components, service kit / jack components, steering mechanism and control components.  Rapid iteration from concept through to optimization  Package reviews / presentations  Attend design reviews  Produce CAD assemblies to support design standard creation  Regularly represent the department in design review and work closely with suppliers and other departments, such as studio, body, skateboard, and packaging teams.  Prepare hardpoint models such as wheel bogey models  Prepare dynamic swept volumes for packaging Required Skills Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in Automotive or Mechanical engineering preferred, but equivalent qualifications and experience considered.  Minimum 5 years working in automotive design engineering (OEM).  Solid fundamental knowledge of chassis component production technologies and materials; casting, forging, machining, pressing, sheet metal, injection molding, extrusion, welding, stamping, rolling of aluminum, steel, magnesium & polymers.  Solid fundamental knowledge and proven experience working on chassis related projects.  Experienced user of CAD (ideally CATIA V5/V6) in solid and surface modelling.  Quick turn over of work.  Ability to produce clear and thorough reports.  CAE experience beneficial but not essential.  Candidates should be self-motivated and able to work in a fast-paced team environment.  Excellent communication skills, able to interact effectively with domestic and international teammates & suppliers.  Must be a self starter, use initiative and engineering judgement.  Ability to interpret data and solve complex problems using first principles.  High degree of competence with GD&T.  must have ability to manage multiple component designs at once and able to prioritise workload. Responsibilities: for the quality system planning and performance of a section in body manufacturing, paint, or general assembly. The position utilizes the combined skills of data analysis, manufacturing process knowledge, automotive quality tools, and 8D problem solving to support and improve the team's quality performance. The intent of this position is to ultimately transition into the Quality Assurance Engineering role with full responsibility for the quality performance of a section within the plant. - Participate in APQP process related to responsible area - Support manufacturing team equipment and process capability analysis - Assist in developing product and process validation/inspection plans - Assist in delivering quality tool training on various topics - Identify and contain suspect material - assist supplier quality functions - Own 8D/RCCA resolution for internal quality issues - Participate in utilizing metrology equipment to solve problems - Assist in the analysis and improvement of quality performance - Share responsibility for quality related continuous improvement projects - Monitor, create, and provide quality performance data for KPI boards - Perform 8D/PFMEA/Control plan review/update - Utilize warranty and dealer quality input to improve processes - Assist in developing, maintaining, and improving the quality culture within responsible area - Potential business travel to support product /process development at company and supplier locations - No direct reports - Technical team leadership skills required to achieve goals This is what you'll need: In order to qualify for the Quality Engineer job role, the successful candidate will have a combination of experience and/or education that would indicate a general knowledge of and trainability in the following: - Engineering, Quality, or Technical Bachelor Degree, or equivalent combination of education and experience - APQP (Design for Quality) - Problem solving - 8D method - Manufacturing/assembly process - PPAP documents - PFMEA - Control plan - MSA - Metrology equipment - CAD (Catia preferred) - Statistical process control / control charts - Minitab or similar software - Data analytics software skills; ex. Excel, Tableau, Looker, etc. - Kaizen / continuous improvement process - The desire to achieve 6 Sigma greenbelt or blackbelt - Good oral and written communication skills - Project management skills - Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization - Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry - Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists - Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Ability to communicate in a high pressure environment

Position: Brunswick Boat Group Technology Center - Mechanical Development Engineer II
Description: Are you ready for what’s next? Come explore opportunities within Brunswick, a global marine leader committed to challenging conventions and innovating next-generation technologies that transform experiences on the water and beyond. Brunswick believes â€œNext Never Restsâ„¢,â€� and we offer a variety of exciting careers and growth opportunities within united teams defining the future of marine recreation. Basic Accountability Statement: As a Mechanical Systems Engineer at the Brunswick Boat Group Technology Center, you will play a pivotal role in engineering and integrating mechanical system designs at our facility in Edgewater, Florida. Your responsibilities encompass the use of Computer Aided Engineering (CAE) tools to create 3D models for components and mechanical system layouts. Duties and Responsibilities: · Define requirements and component specifications for various systems in boats, including but not limited to fuel systems, fresh water, raw water, black water, air conditioning, hydraulic steering systems, power generation, water makers, refrigeration systems, air heater systems, and drainage systems. · Lead internal and external engineering reviews to ensure that systems meet both internal and external expectations. · Provide accurate material and component specifications for sourcing new and replacement components. · Collaborate with suppliers on the development of new systems and components to enhance the quality and value of boat systems continually. · Ensure that new designs and components meet cost, performance, and functional requirements for new and enhanced boat programs. · Create engineering drawings for new designs and approve all prints for boat release. · Generate, review, and approve engineering change notices (ECNs) as needed. · Participate in manufacturing integration activities to ensure successful product launches and continuous improvement initiatives. · Review and approve owner’s manuals for accurate and complete descriptions and information. · Support manufacturing and customer service in resolving issues. · Validate designs to ensure they meet system specifications and performance requirements. · Utilize warranty data to identify and mitigate issues related to mechanical systems. · Provide technical evaluations and reports on issues for customer service and field problems. · Ensure compliance with all necessary industry, domestic, and international government regulations. · Verify that materials used in finished products have been tested and approved for quality and reliability. · Conduct final system design verification tests as required. · Ensure the timely and comprehensive completion of all project phases. · Be willing to travel (minimum 10%). Education/Training: · Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Naval Architecture, Marine Engineering, or a related discipline. · Consideration will be given to candidates with significant work experience in lieu of educational requirements. Experience and Skills: · 2-5 years of marine product design experience with knowledge of manufacturing/production processes. · Proficiency in Computer Aided Design, with experience in Siemens NX preferred, and familiarity with software like SolidWorks, Catia, Creo, or Pro-E. · Excellent 3D solid and free-surface modeling skills. · Understanding of Finite Element Analysis. · Proficient understanding of component and assembly interactions at the system level. · Lean Six Sigma certification or experience is a plus. · Commitment to quality and industry standards. · Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with employees, departments, vendors, dealers, and retail customers. · Willingness to work extra hours when required to ensure timely project completion. · Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications. · Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities. · Passion for the recreational marine industry. Work Environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts, work at heights, fumes or airborne particles, and potentially toxic or caustic chemicals. The noise level in the work environment is typically moderate. Next is Now! Saratoga, CAE-Space US – Space Systems Engineering /Full-Time/ On-Site     Ready to make connectivity from space universally accessible, secure and actionable? Then you’ve come to the right place!        E-Space is bridging Earth and space to enable hyper-scaled deployments of space-powered Internet of Things (IoT) solutions and services. We are fundamentally changing the design, economics, manufacturing, coverage limitations and service delivery associated with traditional satellite and terrestrial IoT systems.        By building a highly-advanced low Earth orbit (LEO) space system—with a unique antenna design, highly sustainable spacecraft system and low-cost, small portable end-user devices—we can extend global satellite coverage, capacity and connectivity beyond legacy space services to provide a new kind of IoT platform that lets users sense, track, connect and act on information gathered, anywhere.        We’re intentional, we’re unapologetically curious and we’re 100% committed to saving space, protecting our planet and turning connectivity into actionable intelligence.    What is the role:     The functions of this role include providing strategic direction and implementation in the following areas:        Work with various engineering disciplines on concepts and requirements for spacecraft harnesses, coax, PCBs, enclosures, motors, etc.        End to end ownership of harnessing including 3D design, drawing creation, prototyping, and manufacturing support.        Own the mechanical strategy and design of rigid and flex PCBs from system level to detailed level including form factors, mounting, interconnect, environmental considerations, etc.        Mechatronics design support and testing.        Interface with systems engineering on ICDs, spacecraft AI&T, system testing, etc.    What you will do: The functions of this role include providing strategic direction and implementation in the following areas: Work with various engineering disciplines on concepts and requirements for spacecraft harnesses, coax, PCBs, enclosures, motors, etc. End to end ownership of harnessing including 3D design, drawing creation, prototyping, and manufacturing support. Own the mechanical strategy and design of rigid and flex PCBs from system level to detailed level including form factors, mounting, interconnect, environmental considerations, etc. Mechatronics design support and testing. Interface with systems engineering on ICDs, spacecraft AI&T, system testing, etc. What you bring to this role: Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or similar. 10+ years of experience in mechanical or electrical engineering with at least 5 years of electro-mechanical design including harnessing and PCB mechanical work. Skilled with CAD and harness design tools. Familiarity with harness design best practices including applicable IPC standards. Familiarity with rigid and flex PCB technologies. Demonstrated success working in a dynamic environment. · Proficiency with basic lab equipment like multimeters, soldering irons, crimpers, and hand tools. Bonus points: Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or similar. Experience with Solidworks and RapidHarness. Experience with mechatronics including motors and electro-mechanical actuators. Familiarity with NASA, ECSS, or SAE standards for PCB and harness design and manufacturing. Experience with coax cable and RF signal basics. Experience with Altium Designer or other PCB design tools. Experience designing for space environments.     $50,000 - $180,000 a year        The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position in question, which is based on market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on location, skills and expertise, depth of relevant experience, and other relevant factors. For questions about this, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply for the role and are selected for an interview.        We are redefining how satellites are designed, manufactured and used—so we’re looking for candidates with        passion, deep knowledge and direct experience on LEO satellite component development, design and in-        orbit activities. If that’s your experience – then we’ll be immediately wow-ed.    Why E-Space is right for you: We want you to make the most of your journey at E-Space. Description: Requisition #: 13237 When visionary companies need to know how their world-changing ideas will perform, they close the gap between design and reality with Ansys simulation. For more than 50 years, Ansys software has enabled innovators across industries to push boundaries by using the predictive power of simulation. From sustainable transportation to advanced semiconductors, from satellite systems to life-saving medical devices, the next great leaps in human advancement will be powered by Ansys. Take a leap of certainty … with Ansys. SUMMARY ANSYS, Inc. seeks Team Lead Application Engineering to work in Canonsburg, PA and various unanticipated locations RESPONSIBILITIES Supervise a team of application engineers in executing all technical activities throughout the sales opportunity lifecycle including technical discovery, product presentations, demonstrations, evaluations, and deployments to drive software sales in new accounts and expand in existing accounts. Assist in annual performance review for team members. Engage with key customer stakeholders to establish the Ansys value proposition, understand their product design needs, develop and implement best simulation practices to improve customer productivity. Partner with sales account managers to review opportunities, forecast, build pipeline, prioritize engineering resources, develop ideas and support execution of new business growth initiatives. Mentor team members, including, but not limited to, providing the team with effective guidance to support key goals. Supervise the team to work with the Ansys product development teams to translate customer requirements into exciting new product features, test new releases of Ansys products on industrial problems and measure progress. Supervise team members to contribute to Ansys consulting services and field and digital marketing. Practice and promote One Ansys culture MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Electrical or Electronics Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical, Chemical, Aerospace or a related field of study; and two (2) years of experience in a related occupation. Alternate Acceptable Education and Work Experience Requirement: Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Electrical or Electronics Engineering, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Mechanical, Chemical, Aerospace or a related field of study, and five (5) years of experience in a related occupation. Work experience or academic coursework must have included:    Knowledge of commercial CAE, CAD, EDA and PLM; Knowledge of SysML and Model Based System Engineering software packages; Knowledge of Multi-Disciplinary Analysis and Optimization; Knowledge of Analytical tool integration; Automotive and Aerospace experience. Must be willing to travel domestically up to 25% of time. Additional work location information: 2600 ANSYS Drive, Canonsburg, PA 15317 and various unanticipated locations. Telecommuting permitted from anywhere within the US At Ansys, we know that changing the world takes vision, skill, and each other. We fuel new ideas, build relationships, and help each other realize our greatest potential in the knowledge that every day is an opportunity to observe, teach, inspire, and be inspired. Together as One Ansys, we are powering innovation that drives human advancement. Our Commitments: Amaze with innovative products and solutions Make our customers incredibly successful Act with integrity Ensure employees thrive and shareholders prosper Our Values: Adaptability: Be open, welcome what’s next Courage: Be courageous, move forward passionately Generosity: Be generous, share, listen, serve Authenticity: Be you, make us stronger Our Actions: We commit to audacious goals We work seamlessly as a team We demonstrate mastery We deliver outstanding results OUR ONE ANSYS CULTURE HAS INCLUSION AT ITS CORE  We believe diverse thinking leads to better outcomes. We are committed to creating and nurturing a workplace that fuels this by welcoming people, no matter their background, identity, or experience, to a workplace where they are valued and where diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging thrive. TAKE A LEAP OF CERTAINTY IN YOUR CAREER AT ANSYS At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary leaders across the globe. Collectively we strive to change the world with innovative technology and transformational solutions. With a prestigious reputation in working with well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high – met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head on. Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology, empowering our customers to turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at a lower cost. At Ansys, it’s about the learning, the discovery, and the collaboration. It’s about the “what’s next” as much as the “mission accomplished.” And it’s about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can, and do impact real people in real ways. All this is forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy, and ethics. CREATING A PLACE WE’RE PROUD TO BE Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a member of the NASDAQ-100. We are proud to have been recognized for the following more recent awards, although our list goes on: America’s Most Loved Workplaces, Gold Stevie Award Winner, America’s Most Responsible Companies, Fast Company World Changing Ideas, Great Place to Work Certified (China, Greece, France, India, Japan, Korea, Spain, Sweden, Taiwan, U.K.).  For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.  Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

Launch your new career with SYSTIMA a Division of Karman Space & Defense! Take a look at who we are! https://youtu.be/gB9JqcGYtWA COME JOIN OUR TEAM! We are looking for a Structures Design Engineer II for our Advanced Materials & Processes Division! Pay: $95,000 - $114,000 DOE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS: Conceptualize, develop, and design structures, tooling, and mechanisms in accordance with customer requirements, with a focus on advanced composite components Create component and assembly level CAD models Create engineering drawings, and define bill of materials, manufacturing system requirements, and quality assurance inspection requirements in accordance with appropriate standards and specifications Implement geometric tolerancing and perform basic mechanical engineering calculations Review designs for cost, manufacturing, and quality assurance issues Provide technical support to customers Designate off-the-shelf mechanical component or systems, identify vendors who can supply them, and request their purchase in a manner timely with delivery requirements Document requirements for performance, compliance with customer requirements, plans, test procedures, test reports, and any other contractual specifications Support manufacturing, quality assurance, testing, and deployment of designs from concept to delivery Support proposal/presentation preparation for business development and market surveys. Perform analysis of designs to ensure safe operation in meetings EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent experience and registration Typically possesses 2-5 years aerospace and/or defense hardware design experience Demonstrated proficiency in mechanical design, engineering, and drawing conventions Hands on experience with composite part and tool manufacturing preferred Knowledge of CAD/CAE tools relevant to mechanical systems design Proficient with CATIA V5, experience with CATIA Composite Work Bench preferred Proficient with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing methods Detailed knowledge of design based military and commercial specifications Self-motivated, able to multi-task, work independently on assignments with minimal oversight or direction, quality-oriented and safety conscious Possesses strong mechanical aptitude as well as creativity in solving problems; able to track overall goals and “see the big picture” while focusing on details Excellent communication and customer relationship skills Must be a U.S. Citizen Must hold or be able to obtain a DoD SECRET clearance COMPANY BENEFITS: Medical Dental Vision Life 401k Tuition Reimbursement Paid Holidays Employee Referral Program If an exciting career in the Space & Defense Industry is for you, we'd LOVE to talk to you! KARMAN SPACE & DEFENSE: Karman is the market leading suppliers of metallic and composite flight hardware and sub-assemblies for the space, missile, and hypersonic markets. Karman offers an unprecedented capability set to customers, creating a supply chain solution in a historically fragmented supply base. The Karman team draws on in-house expertise in engineering & design, precision machining, large part forming, welding, heat age, finishing, assembly, ablative & insulative composites, and other capabilities to serve as a strategic partner to customers. Karman is headquartered in greater Los Angeles and currently has 5 locations in Southern California and 1 location in Mukilteo, Washington. Karman is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis (“protected class”) including, but not limited to race; color; religion; genetic information; national origin; sex; pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions; age; disability; citizenship status; uniform servicemember status; or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law. Our management is dedicated to ensuring the fulfillment of this policy with respect to hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, termination, recruitment advertising, pay, and other forms of compensation, training, and general treatment during employment.

Description: Transforming the Future with Convergence of Simulation and Data CAE Engineer L2 Job Summary: Our client in Raymond, OH is looking for a CAE Engineer L2. This is a contract position. What You Will Do: This role will be responsible to create and validate CAE methods and processes related to Optimization of 1D/3D CAE models, Automation of CAE workflows, and robustness (stochastic) processes. Description: Job Summary The Senior Mechanical Engineer is responsible for the design, development and execution of core battery mechanical system components and assemblies. The individual will be responsible for defining, documenting, and designing battery pack and battery module mechanical and thermal components and assemblies, and overseeing validation of those components and assemblies. This role requires the ability to apply technical knowledge to innovative designs, driving resolution of challenges, and take ownership of new product development activities. Responsibilities Apply technical knowledge to the on-time delivery of work products through the product development life cycle for each project. Own the design and development of efficient designs for components & sub-assemblies. Work in concert with manufacturing engineers in the development of processes and tools supporting manufacture and assembly. Component definition, sizing, selection, and design of battery module and pack mechanical and thermal components (e.g., battery structure, enclosures, injection molded plastics, cooling plates, mechanical joining methods). Work closely with Systems Engineers and CAE Engineers to prove out design concepts prior to battery pack prototype builds. Act as a mentor and advisor to Design Release Engineers (DREs) on the team. Key contributor to mechanical system DFMEAs/PFMEAs, DVP&Rs and Product & Process design reviews. Lead supplier evaluation and development for responsible commodities, in collaboration with purchasing. Support prototype system builds by ensuring parts are on time and that issues are resolved in a timely manner. Adhere to federal and state regulations. Adhere to all company policies, processes, and procedures. Performs other duties as requested, directed, or assigned. Predictable and reliable attendance. Position Qualifications Master’s degree in Mechanical/Aerospace/Chemical Engineering or equivalent degree with relevant experience. Minimum nine (9) years of engineering experience. Minimum of two (2) years of experience in high voltage (>350V) electrification product design or product development. Proficient in root cause analysis and resolution. Proficient in understanding CAE models, including deciphering boundary conditions, assumptions, and model limitations. Adept in data processing and statistical analysis. Effective communicator, capable of concisely presenting highly technical test data to internal and external customers, as well as effectively communicating with suppliers. Experienced with the design, handling, and manufacture of high-voltage lithium-ion battery systems. Educated on common automotive & industry standards. Familiar with the product design process. Self-motivated problem solver; pays attention to the details. Challenges the status quo and strives for continuous improvement. Abides by safety standards and protocols. Key Competencies Decision Making & Analysis: Makes sound decisions based upon a mixture of data-driven analysis, expertise, experience, and judgment; collects relevant information, seeks input from others, and identifies connections and/or root causes of problems. Takes Initiative: Exhibits strong drive for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure; persists despite obstacles and opposition. Continual Improvement: Displays a consistent orientation toward producing the highest quality products or services, while keeping a focus on sustainability. Constantly looking for incremental improvements in work processes and results. Delivers Results: Achievement oriented, feeling a sense of urgency to reach goals on time, if not before. Mission, Vision, Values, and Strategic Priorities Focused: Understands and actively supports the organization’s mission, vision, values, and strategic priorities. Assertiveness: Maintaining a position when you know you are right; standing up to others and expressing views without fear or for approval and without engaging in unnecessary aggression. Physical Requirements / Working Conditions The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment. Ability to adjust focus, especially due to concentration on a computer screen. May need to lift and carry up to 30 pounds and/or position the body to reach items on the floor/below knee level or reach overhead. The person in this position needs to occasionally move about in industrial environments, and on uneven terrain. Works in a temperature-controlled office environment, with occasional work in outdoor weather conditions, and in industrial environments. May be required to travel to and navigate a variety of sites to fully understand material needs. Why Join Us American Battery Solutions (ABS) provides comprehensive benefit plan options at no cost and competitive salary to all associates. ABS is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Benefits Overview Paid time off includes 4 weeks, 15 holidays, and parental leave. 100% company-paid medical, dental, vision, short-term disability, long-term disability life insurance. Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) offerings. Company provided 401K savings plan with matching contributions to help you save for retirement. Voluntary benefits offerings. Tuition assistance. Employee Referral program. Employee development and career growth opportunities. About Us At American Battery Solutions (ABS) we are developing the next generation of battery energy storage systems that will power the vehicles of today and tomorrow! Our team works with the latest technologies and battery chemistries engineering, testing, and manufacturing batteries to power the world’s electric propulsion transition. At ABS you may get a chance to work on a project for an autonomous warehouse robot or an autonomous lawnmower, or you may work on a battery for a fleet of delivery vehicles or a transit bus, or even an EV start-up or a massive grid energy storage system. Our team is led by some of the industry’s most experienced professionals, but we pride ourselves on developing a diverse team of next-generation battery experts. The Location - Lake Orion, MI American Battery Solutions Headquarters and Innovation Center is located in the heart of South-East Michigan in Orion Township. Orion Township is a Pure Michigan Trail Town that has a long-standing dedication to enhancing trails and pathways in its community, which is home to the Polly Ann Trail, Paint Creek Trail, and Iron Belle Trail. The township boasts more than 50 miles of trails. Southeast Michigan also boasts some of the best eating around! Whether your interest is in furthering your education, enjoying one of the many regional sporting events, or enjoying the vast outdoors that Michigan has to offer, you’ll be at the center of it here! AMERICAN BATTERY SOLUTIONS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.
