We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to hire the best candidate regardless of age, beliefs, disability, ethnicity, gender or sexual orientation.About us We are a multi-technology company present in over 20 countries and our team of over 40,000 is made up of 90 different nationalities. They are the driving force of our company, which designs, develops and produces parts for over 900 models of the leading vehicle manufacturers, and enable us to be one of the top suppliers worldwide.Do you have what it takes to build the future of mobility with us?You will be joining a leading international group in the automotive sector with a clear commitment to innovation, a trail-blazer in Industry 4.0 and engaged with ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) criteria.This is an opening to build a career in a global environment with many opportunities to grow both professionally and personally by participating and leading innovative and international projects.You will find a supportive and friendly environment where the emphasis is on team work, continuous improvement, trust, a dynamic spirit and thinking outside the box, and a passion for a job well done.You will be working with highly qualified professionals as Gestamp is committed to the ongoing training of our teams.Join the Gestamp team!

At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams. With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow’s transportation. Do you have what it takes to make smart vehicles for a smart world? Join the Ford Product Development team. We are seeking forward-thinking, laser-focused professionals with a passion for bringing innovative, exciting, and sustainable ideas to life. We have opportunities around the world for you to contribute to such advancements as autonomy, electrification, smart mobility technologies and more!You'll have… Bachelor’s degree required: Materials Engineering, or Chemical Engineering, or Material Science, or Chemistry with application engineering experience. 3+ years' Experience with standard polymer chemistry characterization testing tools (FTIR, DSC, Rheometry, DMA, universal mechanical testing machines, etc.) 3+ years' Experience with surface preparation methods and systems and adhesive dispensing systems. Strong knowledge of Systems Engineering principles.  Even better, you'll have… Master’s degree preferred: Materials Engineering, or Chemical Engineering, or Material Science, or Chemistry with application engineering experience 3+ years automotive adhesive engineering experience Experience with high temperature adhesive interfaces Previous electrified vehicle launch experience Working knowledge of high voltage automotive systems Working knowledge of 3Dx, Catia Strong knowledge of automotive Systems Engineering principles Team oriented, strong communication & presentation skills Strong drive for results under operational pressures Self-motivated with the ability to manage multiple tasks   You may not check every box, or your experience may look a little different from what we've outlined, but if you think you can bring value to Ford Motor Company, we encourage you to apply! As an established global company, we offer the benefit of choice. You can choose what your Ford future will look like: will your story span the globe, or keep you close to home? Will your career be a deep dive into what you love, or a series of new teams and new skills? Will you be a leader, a changemaker, a technical expert, a culture builder…or all of the above? No matter what you choose, we offer a work life that works for you, including: Immediate medical, dental, and prescription drug coverage Flexible family care, parental leave, new parent ramp-up programs, subsidized back-up child care and more Vehicle discount program for employees and family members, and management leases Tuition assistance Established and active employee resource groups Paid time off for individual and team community service A generous schedule of paid holidays, including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day Paid time off and the option to purchase additional vacation time.  For a detailed look at our benefits, click here:  https://clicktime.symantec.com/15uBY4YXwiYLSagpXNqcM?h=3OIagREMw9X_tQ_H6BdPzVowygZtLVc2uqXa6M98qLE=&u=https://fordcareers.co/GSR-HTHD Visa sponsorship is available for this position.  Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status. In the United States, if you need a reasonable accommodation for the online application process due to a disability, please call 1-888-336-0660.  #LI-HybridWhat you will be able to do The Electrified Systems Engineering (ESE) organization is responsible for delivering the best Battery Electric vehicles in every segment in which we compete. Consistently delivering the best customer vehicle value and profitability by delivering optimal battery energy capability and quality. Take advantage of this opportunity to work in one of the most dynamic and growing organizations in Ford. Your duties would include: Lead design, selection and validation of adhesive materials and application technologies in electric vehicle battery pack mass production environment. Lead design requirement development for adhesive joints in the battery pack system. Collaborate with battery pack component engineers and adhesive suppliers to identify adhesive formulations, application techniques, and bonding processes that deliver battery mechanical, electrical and thermal requirements. Develop adhesive joint test procedures to assess the strength, durability, and reliability of these joints in the battery pack system. Lead adhesive interface validation via CAE analysis and physical testing to ensure that adhesive interfaces meet design (structural, NVH, thermal, etc) and mass production battery pack assembly requirements. Collaborate with battery manufacturing teams to optimize bonding processes, including surface preparation, curing, and quality control. Lead to develop adhesive interface core quality documents, e.g. dFMEA, and support development of pFMEA and Control plan. Lead to develop and maintain a standardized process, e.g. checklist, for application design and release engineers Lead to develop and maintain a list of approved adhesives and material specifications for application design and release engineers Leverage battery benchmarking learnings

Description: Saratoga, CAE-Space US – Space Systems Engineering /Full-Time/ On-Site     Ready to make connectivity from space universally accessible, secure and actionable? Then you’ve come to the right place!        E-Space is bridging Earth and space to enable hyper-scaled deployments of space-powered Internet of Things (IoT) solutions and services. We are fundamentally changing the design, economics, manufacturing, coverage limitations and service delivery associated with traditional satellite and terrestrial IoT systems.        By building a highly-advanced low Earth orbit (LEO) space system—with a unique antenna design, highly sustainable spacecraft system and low-cost, small portable end-user devices—we can extend global satellite coverage, capacity and connectivity beyond legacy space services to provide a new kind of IoT platform that lets users sense, track, connect and act on information gathered, anywhere.        We’re intentional, we’re unapologetically curious and we’re 100% committed to saving space, protecting our planet and turning connectivity into actionable intelligence.    What is the role: As a Mechanical Engineer at E-Space you will design and manufacture satellite structures and mechanisms. We are big on hardware ownership, so you will not only be a critical part of the engineering design effort, but you will also have critical involvement throughout the satellite build.        This position will report to the VP, Satellite Platform and will work closely with the broader engineering team. This role is based in our Saratoga, CA office.    What you will do: Work closely with the satellite sub-system teams to design satellite structures and mechanisms Be a CAD modeling expert (SolidWorks) managing CAD assemblies and drawings Develop build documents and drawings for your hardware Define, build and test your designs from 3D printed engineering units to flight hardware Support the fabrication assembly and testing of our flight build What you bring to this role: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Mechanical, Aerospace or equivalent real-world design and build experience 2 years of hands-on experience using your CAD skills to develop and build models and drawings Successfully implemented your design solutions in a complex environment Experience with mechanical design to survive extreme environments and challenging mass constraints Bonus points: Experience working on complex satellite/space systems     $65,000 - $175,000 a year    The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position in question, which is based on market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on location, skills and expertise, depth of relevant experience, and other relevant factors. For questions about this, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply for the role and are selected for an interview.     We are redefining how satellites are designed, manufactured and used—so we’re looking for candidates with passion, deep knowledge and direct experience on LEO satellite component development, design and in-orbit activities. If that’s your experience – then we’ll be immediately wow-ed.    Why E-Space is right for you: We want you to make the most of your journey at E-Space. That’s why we support and invest in the physical, emotional and financial well-being of our team members and their families. Some of what you can expect when working at E-Space:    An opportunity to really make a differenceSustainability at our coreFair and honest workplaceInnovative thinking is encouragedCompetitive salariesContinuous learning and developmentHealth and wellness care optionsFinancial solutions for the future Optional legal services (US only)Paid holidaysPaid time off
Benefits: ['Paid time off']

Description: CAE Engineer - Finite Elemental Analysis (FEA)Pierburg US LLC in Auburn Hills        Rheinmetall       /       CAE Engineer - Finite Elemental Analysis (FEA)      Ref.-Nr.:       US00302      Schedule type:       Full Time      Contract Type:       Full TimeWHAT WE ARE LOOKING FORPOSITION SUMMARY: This position is responsible for conducting mechanical and thermal calculations to support the Pierburg product development process which includes working closely with the local engineering and design groups as well as the central simulation departments in Europe.WHAT QUALIFICATIONS YOU SHOULD HAVEREQUIRED MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:Degree in mechanical Engineering, Physics or similar (e.g. computational engineering).Very good knowledge in solid mechanics, thermodynamics and materials engineering.2+ Years of experience in the automotive industry. First Hand Industrial Experience in the Development of Components and numerical Simulations, in the area of static, dynamic and thermal analysis.Must have experience with FEA software (ANSYS Workbench [preferred], NASTRAN, MARC or ABAQUS).Experience with meshing software (ANSYS Workbench, ANSA, Altair HyperMesh or other).Knowledgeable in numerical optimization software (Dynardo optiSLang [preferred], Altair OptiStruct or other).Experience with fatigue software (NCODE, FEMFAT or other).Basic understanding of multibody Simulation (RecurDyn, Adams or other).Understanding in physical procedures and numeric simulations.Knowledgeable in 3D-CAD, CATIA V5 (preferred).Familiar with product development processes.Innovative thinking as well as ability to make contact and willing to cooperate in global team environment.Efficient in writing, communication and presenting results.Willingness to travel as needed and to work abroad for training purposes.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Planning and execution of mechanical and thermal stress calculations (FEA) including Multibody simulations and Optimization improvements.Evaluation of structural safety margins with regard to a sufficient operational fatigue life.Works closely with other CFD and FEA (Finite Element Analysis) engineers in the simulation group in modeling, setting-up conditions, running analyses, interpreting results and presenting reports.Works and communicates closely with managers and engineers in other business units and making appropriate use of CFD inputs for product development.Coordinates and chairs necessary job/task clarification meetings with engineering team membersContinuous improvement of simulation results by comparing and correlating with measured data from internal and external testing      Active contribution to product optimization by independent development of structure mechanical modifications of the design, e. g. with numerical optimization methods

In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!  When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.  Job Description: Ready to be part of a team that tackles infrastructure challenges? Want to take your Engineering skills to the next level to work on tough projects that will make a huge impact on the community?   Parsons is now hiring experienced Engineers with a desire to work on projects that change the fabric of our community. Parsons extensive experience in this field, combined with your engineering knowledge, will propel your career forward with opportunity for advancement with top performance. Training, development and opportunities to work on marquee projects as you and our fast paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, enthusiastic to work in highly flexible, team oriented environment and who have exceptional communication, analytical and organizational skills. In this role you perform conventional and moderately complex engineering assignments, applying engineering techniques and analyses within a discipline. You will apply engineering techniques and analyses which may involve CAE (computer aided engineering)/CAD (computer aided design) applications.   Responsibilities: Independently develops and/or supervises the creation of engineering products that meet customer quality requirements. This includes defining the problem, establishing the work scope, preparing the budget and schedule, planning the work, providing technical direction, and reporting the work status. Typical products may include detailed calculations, drawings, procurement documents, design and installation packages, proposal evaluations, technical reports, and detailed analyses. Provides support for other engineering activities as required. May supervise one or more subordinates and provide input regarding performance. Provides input and technical guidance to CAD Designer/Drafters, Designers, and lower level Engineers working on the same project. Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.   Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering (or related field) and 5+ years of related work experience Engineer in Training (EIT) Certificate may be required Proficiency in utilizing CAD and other PC software packages typically associated with engineering is required NCDOT project experience preferred Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None  This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.  For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.  Salary Range: $68,400.00 - $119,700.00  We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!  The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates. Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.  We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

Position: HV Battery Cell Vent Management (CVM) Design and Release Engineer
Description: Ford Motor Company’s Electrified Systems Engineering (ESE) team is seeking a passionate Design and Release Engineer (D&R Engineer) that will be responsible for designing and releasing HV Battery Cell Vent Management (CVM) related components within the HV Battery system. The D&R Engineer will work with HV battery unit team, Cell/Array team, Manufacturing team, Test team & Component Suppliers to deliver parts that meet function, quality, weight, and cost. The D&R Engineer will also manage component suppliers throughout the entire design development process (from concept to production) and will be responsible for program deliverables including foundational documents (DFMEA’s, SCCAF), component DV testing, Supplier sourcing, requirement, and design rule compliance, etc.You'll have… BS of mechanical, thermal, or chemical engineering. Some other engineering disciplines may also be considered. 3+ years of Automotive component D&R experience 3+ years experience with FMEA, SCCAF and DVP&R documentation Willingness and passion for learning new technologies Even better, you'll have… MS of mechanical, thermal, or chemical engineering. Some other engineering disciplines may also be considered. 5+ years of Automotive component D&R experience 5+ years of high voltage Battery component design and development Experience using Teamcenter & CATIA CAD software. Experience in Ford Product development systems and tools Experience in prototype, part fabrication, and testing setup. Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently Experience with Microsoft Office Tools Clear communication skills   You may not check every box, or your experience may look a little different from what we've outlined, but if you think you can bring value to Ford Motor Company, we encourage you to apply! As an established global company, we offer the benefit of choice. You can choose what your Ford future will look like: will your story span the globe, or keep you close to home? Will your career be a deep dive into what you love, or a series of new teams and new skills? Will you be a leader, a changemaker, a technical expert, a culture builder…or all of the above? No matter what you choose, we offer a work life that works for you, including: Immediate medical, dental, and prescription drug coverage Flexible family care, parental leave, new parent ramp-up programs, subsidized back-up child care and more Vehicle discount program for employees and family members, and management leases Tuition assistance Established and active employee resource groups Paid time off for individual and team community service A generous schedule of paid holidays, including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day Paid time off and the option to purchase additional vacation time.  For a detailed look at our benefits, click here:  https://clicktime.symantec.com/15tpDLjrhq9fR5v5vzGbF?h=DS1lZ7UG2l7qu4CjksfykbJukG8poHer2J_d27Pus9o=&u=https://fordcareers.co/GSRnon-HTHD Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.  Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status. In the United States, if you need a reasonable accommodation for the online application process due to a disability, please call 1-888-336-0660.  #LI-HybridWhat you'll do… Release CVM components within the HV battery system to support all prototype and production milestones throughout the program life cycle Represent component-level interests to the HV battery unit program Develop system Boundary Diagrams, P-Diagrams, DFMEAs and other foundational documentation Support Development of 3D modeling and design Collaborate with the Engineering Team for Packaging as well as with other Internal Pack Module & Component Engineers Support all pack build phases and discuss/resolve issues with the commodity suppliers Work with suppliers to ensure timing is met with Quality, Cost, Weight, and Function Validate design changes through either CAE &/or bench level testing for the build phases Review and signoff on testing data per the DVP&R plan Release and Update Components Using the WERS System

Description: Summary      Posted: Oct 6, 2023            Role Number:       200507009      Do you love taking on big challenges that require exceptionally creative solutions? Do you deeply understand how an incredible camera experience should work? As part of our Camera Technologies group, you’ll help design the innovative technology that allows each generation of Apple products to produce photos even more incredible than the last. You’ll design and develop groundbreaking ideas for everything involved in our camera systems, from sensor to lens. You’ll collaborate with teams across Apple to research, design, develop, test, and qualify camera hardware for Apple products. Together, we’ll craft a magical photography experience that redefines what millions of customers can expect from their cameras. The Camera Hardware Engineering Team is responsible for all research, design, development, test, and qualification of camera hardware for Apple products. We are seeking an extraordinary Mechanical Engineer (FEA) to evaluate and work on camera hardware modules and component parts.     Key Qualifications5+ years of experience running non-linear static and dynamic Finite Element Analysis using Abaqus, Ansys, or equivalent CAE packagesRigorous knowledge of Solid Mechanics and Strength of computational mechanicsExperience in mechanical design and DFM is a plusStructural and thermo-structural focus; additional analyses may include electromagnetic, heat transfer, and CFDPassion for creating innovative, high quality productsDesire to work in fast-paced environmentOutstanding written and verbal communication skills; ability to interact with multi-functional teams, management, and external vendorsExperience with calibration, verification, and validation of models through physical testingPreferred experience in modeling of different classes of materials including polymers, elastomers, soft adhesives, and brittle materialsPreferred experience in testing including methods using Digital Image Correlations, Universal Testing Machines, and Dynamic Mechanical AnalysisProficiency in Matlab, Python, and Abaqus User Subroutines is a plusDescription       As a member of the Camera Hardware team, you will: - Own and drive analysis of innovative products, enabling early optimization prior to prototyping, as well as root cause and failure analysis of difficult mechanical problems. - Generate finite element models/analytical models of camera modules and camera components. - Communicate and report analysis results to team as well as multi-functional teams. - Recommend design changes/directions to meet product performance requirements. - Own and drive material characterization and testing to support modeling efforts. - Coordinate and work with other analysts to integrate module models into larger assembly models. - Participate in team brainstorming and new technology development. Consideration will be given to qualified candidates from consumer electronics, medical, aerospace, automotive, or other fields with related technology and development models.      Education & Experience       BS/MS/PhD in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Material Science or similar concentration      Additional RequirementsPay & BenefitsAt Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $138,900 and $256,500, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.  Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.  Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Description: Job Locations US-CA-Santa Rosa           Job Number             2023-13873              Category             R&D              Job Type             Regular              Open to Remote             No              Travel             <10%              Full Time / Part Time             Full Time (F)       Overview      Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Learn more about what we do.       Our powerful, award-winning culture embraces a bold vision of where technology can take us and a passion for tackling challenging problems with industry-first solutions. Diversity, equity & inclusion are integral parts of our culture and drivers of innovation at Keysight. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers.    ResponsibilitiesAbout the Team:      Our team is very competent, highly motivated, friendly, and eager to help you succeed. The team has a mix of new and experienced developers with a broad range of skills.     About the Job:      You will be part of a full cycle product development team and will work on the design, implementation, and testing of Keysight market leading products that help connect and secure the world.          Key responsibilities include:     Developing analog and digital circuits Leading component selection Schematic entry PCB/PCA design Signal integrity analysis Electrical characterization and debug System EMC design and debug This work will involve the support of your project team, working collaboratively to deliver innovative and market-leading products and solutions to Keysight customers.    Qualifications BS/MS or PhD in Electrical Engineering or equivalent applicable experience 5+ years of experience in analog circuit design, verify and debug process Proven experience in the design, verification and debug of digital and analog circuits Knowledge of circuit theory, transmission line theory, and high-speed signal design Printed circuit board design experience including experience with high-speed signal integrity Experience with CAD/CAE design tools Experience with signal integrity analysis process through simulation Good analytical problem-solving skills Ability to work independently and tackle challenging tasks Ability to function effectively in a team environment Ability to quickly learn new technologies Strong device physics knowledge as it applies to analog IC design Hands-on experience in using spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, signal generators, etc. to validate analog designs Experience in working with production test engineers to produce test plans and design for testability details Solid experience with bias, opamps, switched-cap circuits, LDOs, low power oscillators, PLLs, VGAs, feedback and compensation techniques, DC-DC converters Desired Qualifications: In depth knowledge and analytical understanding of mixed-signal design techniques Experience with designing for EMC and debugging related issue Understanding of data converter architectures and design trade-offs Good knowledge of high precision techniques in presence of device mismatch Experience in chip integration working with Digital Design and Physical Design teams Basic understanding of FPGA design and programming Experience in ASIC design experience in different application fields is a plus Experience in C/Matlab/VerilogA modeling Strong device physics knowledge as it applies to analog IC design Experience in working with production test engineers to produce test plans and design for testability details Experience in Vector Network Analyzer measurements and system design This position requires access to certain goods, software, technology, or technical data subject to U.S. export control laws and regulations. Under these laws and regulations, U.S. persons (which includes U.S. citizens, U.S. nationals, lawful permanent residents, refugees, and asylees) working for Keysight can access export-controlled items without authorization from the U.S. government. For any individual who is not a U.S. person, Keysight may need authorization from the U.S. Department of State, U.S. Department of Commerce, or other appropriate federal agency before the individual can access export-controlled items. Employment in this position for non-U.S. persons is contingent on Keysight’s ability to obtain any required government authorizations. Description: In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!  When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.  Job Description: Ready to be part of a team that tackles infrastructure challenges? Want to take your Engineering skills to the next level to work on tough projects that will make a huge impact on the community?   Parsons is now hiring experienced Engineers with a desire to work on large infrastructure projects that change the fabric of our community. Parsons extensive experience in this field, combined with your engineering knowledge, will propel your career forward with opportunity for advancement with top performance. Training, development and opportunities to work on marquee projects as you and our fast paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, enthusiastic to work in highly flexible, team oriented environment and who have exceptional communication, analytical and organizational skills. In this role, you will perform a variety of engineering tasks by applying standard engineering techniques and analyses within a discipline, which may involve CAE (computer aided engineering)/CAD (computer aided design) applications.   Responsibilities: Completes a variety of assignments such as drawings, specifications, and other materials suitable for procurement and construction purposes, utilizing CAE/CAD as applicable. Prepares standard engineering computations, material quality takeoffs, estimates, surveys, and designs. Prepares detailed requisitions for equipment and materials. Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.   Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering (or related field) and 3+ years of related work experience Engineer in Training (EIT) Certificate may be required Working knowledge of CAD and other PC software packages typically associated with engineering. NCDOT Drainage experience preferred. Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None  This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.  For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.  Salary Range: $59,300.00 - $103,800.00  We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!  The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates. Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.  We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

Description: Company / Location Information We are one of the world’s leading manufacturers of water heating and water treatment technologies in the world. We are a $3.5 billion company with 140+ years history and we employ more than 12,000 individuals globally who pride themselves on providing the world with innovative water technology. We are committed to Continuous Improvement, not just in our factories or processes, but in our people. Primary Function The Project Engineer is responsible for assignments related to the design, development, and optimization of water heating products. The Project Engineer leads the design team in the planning, organization, implementation, and completion of engineering project assignments within area of responsibility by performing the following duties personally or through other project team members. Responsibilities Oversees all aspects of a significant heat pump development project, from start to finish, so that it is completed on time and within budget. Develops an action plan and estimates requirements for resources—management, labor, materials, and time required to complete project. Prepares monthly reports, detailing progress and costs for top management. Analyzes and identifies causes of component failures. Capable of providing technical solutions to help solve manufacturing issues or address customer field issues; has some familiarity with multiple operations. Responsible for engineering assignments related to the development of heat pump products for water heating applications. Provide detailed test programs and guidance to assigned lab and CAD personnel in the conductance and documentation of product specific test standards. Evaluate data and make recommendations. Review product design for compliance with engineering principles, company standards, and customer contract requirements, and related specifications. Coordinate activities to efficiently resolve technical developments, rescheduling issues, and engineering design and test problems as they arise. Evaluate and approve design changes, specifications, and drawing releases. Interact with other Engineering Staff to provide input regarding areas of individual expertise. Prepare project expense estimates and control expenditures within the limitations of the project budget. Travel as needed to complete agency certification, review field installations, attend meetings, provide technical support to sales, etc. Analyze production methods to ensure time and cost goals are reached. Support engineering functions for a product or a product family from design through production. Use CAE tools such as Solidworks, MATLAB, LabView, Minitab, EES, CFD, FEA. Enters and modifies product data in ERP system. Initiates, reviews, and approves PCP in ERP system. Provide occasional support to manufacturing and acquire comfortable familiarity with manufacturing operation. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Mechanical engineering or related field OR Master's Degree in Engineering or related field 3+ years of related work experience, product development experience dealing with refrigeration and electronic applications Excellent written and oral communication skills. Communicates well with other engineering functions including design, process, production, quality, and reliability. Excellent analytical and organizational skills; solves complex problems. Experience with Microsoft Office; Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, etc Experience with 6-sigma and FMEA preferred. We Offer Competitive compensation package and comprehensive benefits plans which include medical and dental insurance, company-sponsored life insurance, retirement security savings plan, short- and long-term disability programs and tuition assistance.

Description: As a Scroll Compressor Design Engineer at Sanhua, you will have the opportunity to design and develop scroll compressors for our automotive applications. The ideal candidate will have an innovative mindset allowing them to design and create cost improvements internally and externally for our customers while using their engineering background Responsibilities: Design and develop scroll compressor applications Provide customer validation testing Complete compressor performance and durability testing Requirements: Bachelors Degree in Mechanical Engineering 3 years of scroll compressor experience Automotive industry experience DFMEA, Catia, CAE (FEA, CFD) Automotive manufacturing background preferred Mechanical components design experience (stack up tolerance, balancing, bearing) fTYSH6JvhX

American Battery Solutions has a full-time opening for an Electrical Battery Engineer in Lake Orion, Michigan. Job Summary: The Electrical Battery Engineer is responsible for the battery system electrical requirements, architecture, and their analysis. They apply an interdisciplinary approach to the engineering of battery systems and components; what is required of the design. They analyze and drive early integration of battery electrical systems and continue to support them over the project life cycle. They define and document overall electrical architecture and schematics at the system level and oversee verification of the electrical sub-system requirements. This includes defining electrical system requirements early in the development cycle, identifying top technical risks, contributing to the design synthesis, and driving the concept verification via testing and analysis. This individual will work closely with the systems and engineering design team, prototype manufacturing team, key suppliers, validation/testing team, customers, program managers, and business development. Responsibilities: Develop electrical system architecture and schematics. Derive sub-system electrical requirements and allocate to electrical architecture. Develop external interface specifications for the electrical interfaces to other systems. Lead cross-functional electrical system engineering meetings with other engineers. Drive resolutions in the electrical systems, between customers and design engineers Support the Lead Systems Engineer with electrical engineering related topics. Support the DREs with their design reviews of the electrical components. Analyze failure modes of electrical systems in the DFMEA; support functional safety analysis. Track and prioritize top technical risks and known electrical system issues. Develop electrical sub-system integration test plan and drive prototype testing and analysis. Develop electrical inspection requirements for end of line testing. Drive model-based analysis of the electrical battery system with CAD and CAE teams. Help troubleshoot battery pack issues and support development of engineering guidelines. Adhere to federal and state regulations. Adhere to all company policies, processes, and procedures. Performs other duties as requested, directed, or assigned. Predictable and reliable attendance. Position Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, or equivalent degree. Masters degree preferred. Minimum of three (3) years of experience in HV automotive applications or similar, such as Electronic Control Units (ECUs), HV/LV power, communication, and sensory systems. Preferred experience with High Voltage/Low Voltage battery systems, Battery Management Systems (BMS), Battery Disconnect Units (BDU), Power Distribution Units (PDU), wiring, controls, CAN, connectors, relays, contactors, fuses, and busbars. Experience with DFMEA, PFMEA, DFM/DFA, and DVP&R. Hands-on lab/shop skills (multimeters, oscilloscopes, HiPot isolation testers, LCR meters, CANalyzer/CANoe, DAQs, ect.). Ability to work hands-on with High and Low Voltage Power and Communication systems. Preferred experience in a requirement engineering management tool and systems engineering (e.g. Jama, DOORS) and MBSE modeling architectures. Preferred experience with MATLAB/Simulink/Simscape controls and simulations. Preferred experience with CAD/CAE and 3D electrical design tools. Familiar with common automotive & industry standards. Adept in basic data processing and statistical analysis. Presents strong interpersonal communication, listening, and technical writing skills. Preferred experience with the handling of high voltage lithium-ion battery systems. Preferred training in High Voltage safety and Personal Protection Equipment (PPE). Abides by safety standards and protocols. Effective communicator, capable of presenting technical test data to various audiences. Self-motivated problem solver who pays attention to details and drives improvement. Ability to travel and work flexible hours as needed (less than 10% travel on average). Ability to organize and plan effectively with project teams. Basic engineering knowledge outside electrical (mechanical, software, industrial, ect.). Key Competencies: Influences Others: Has personal and organizational impact built on mutual trust, fairness, and honesty. Flexes their style to direct, collaborate, or empower, as the situation requires. Self-Leadership: Enjoys positions of responsibility and authority. Desires and chooses to be in a leadership position. Takes Calculated Risks: Takes calculated risks to achieve goals. Finds a balance between analysis and action. When fails, accepts it, learns from it, and moves on to the next challenge. Takes Initiative: Exhibits strong drive for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure; persists despite obstacles and opposition. Teamwork: Works cooperatively with others to accomplish team goals and organizational objectives. Delivers Results: Achievement-oriented, feeling a sense of urgency to reach goals on time, if not before. Communications: Exchanges thoughts, feelings, and information effectively. Assertiveness: Maintaining a position when you know you are right; standing up to others and expressing views without fear or for approval and without engaging in unnecessary aggression. Physical Requirements / Working Conditions: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment. Ability to adjust focus, especially due to concentration on a computer screen. May need to lift and carry up to 30 pounds and/or position the body to reach items on the floor/below knee level or reach overhead. The person in this position needs to occasionally move about in industrial environments, and on uneven terrain. Works in a temperature-controlled office environment, with occasional work in outdoor weather conditions, and in industrial environments. The noise level in the work environment can be moderately loud. Why Join Us American Battery Solutions (ABS) provides comprehensive benefit plan options at no cost and a competitive salary to all associates. ABS is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Benefits Overview Paid time off includes 4 weeks, 15 holidays, and parental leave. 100% company-paid medical, dental, vision, short-term disability, long-term disability life insurance. Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) offerings. Company provided 401K savings plan with matching contributions to help you save for retirement. Voluntary benefits offerings. Tuition assistance. Employee Referral program. Employee development and career growth opportunities. About Us At American Battery Solutions (ABS) we are developing the next generation of battery energy storage systems that will power the vehicles of today and tomorrow! Our team works with the latest technologies and battery chemistries engineering, testing, and manufacturing batteries to power the world’s electric propulsion transition. At ABS you may get a chance to work on a project for an autonomous warehouse robot or an autonomous lawnmower, or you may work on a battery for a fleet of delivery vehicles or a transit bus, or even an EV start-up or a massive grid energy storage system. Our team is led by some of the industry’s most experienced professionals, but we pride ourselves on developing a diverse team of next-generation battery experts. The Location - Lake Orion American Battery Solutions Headquarters and Innovation Center is located in the heart of South-East Michigan in Orion Township. Orion Township is a Pure Michigan Trail Town that has a long-standing dedication to enhancing trails and pathways in its community, which is home to the Polly Ann Trail, Paint Creek Trail, and Iron Belle Trail. The township boasts more than 50 miles of trails. Southeast Michigan also boasts some of the best eating around! Whether your interest is in furthering your education, enjoying one of the many regional sporting events, or enjoying the vast outdoors that Michigan has to offer, you’ll be at the center of it here! AMERICAN BATTERY SOLUTIONS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

Description: The CAD Tooling & Product Design Engineer will be responsible for creating and modifying computer aided designs for complex tooling and machinery used in automotive glass manufacturing operations. This role will provide support to  Carlex manufacturing sites and recommend design and/ or fabrication changes to improve performance and function while supporting process improvement efforts. This position will also have product engineering responsibilities related to automotive glazing systems and components to support Carlex OE and aftermarket business units. Essential Job Functions:Responsible for glass fabrication tooling design and specifications for multiple facilities.Accountable for dimensional accuracy and GD&T.Develop tooling spare parts lists.Responsible for the design and engineering of all program specific tooling: Flat template, photo-tooling, and glass  bending fixtures, and assembly equipment.Support prototype tooling requirements during early prototype builds.Work with product designers and Corporate Tooling Manager to ensure design requirements for glass tooling features are achieved.Support Carlex manufacturing facilities during the tool prove-out phase.Manage any and all customer product design changes that impact glass fabrication and assembly tooling.Participate in Cross Functional Teams in the role of tool engineer to determine manufacturing feasibility and assess tooling process alternatives for complex glass designs.Support management of tooling and equipment suppliers during the design, build, tool prove-out and launch phase at the manufacturing plants.Compile information and drawings for design review meetingsMaintain tooling design timing schedule.Check computer graphic designs completed by other sources for accuracy, function and safety.Develop study programs to investigate new materials to improve tooling design function.Willingness and ability to travel to Carlex, supplier and customer sites, as needed.Requirements:Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or related discipline required.3 - Eaton’s IS AER FMC division is currently seeking a Lead Aerospace Engineer - NPD. This position is based at our Los Angeles, CA facility. The expected annual salary range for this role is $88499.97 - $129799.96 a year. Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations. From commercial fleets to mission-ready military aircraft, Eaton is preparing for the future of air travel with innovative products and services designed to improve aircraft availability with increased efficiency and performance. Within our Aerospace Fluid and Motion Control Division, the Lead Aerospace Engineer - NPD will design and optimize Hydraulic actuation devices for Aerospace applications with Computer-Aided-Engineering techniques (CAE). This role focuses on developing designs that meet customers’ expectations and any applicable industry standards by collaborating with global engineering teams. Eaton’s comprehensive portfolio of components consistently sets the industry standard for engineering excellence, resulting in superior systems design and integration capability. These products power hundreds of military and commercial aircraft platforms with a focus on improved reliability, weight reduction and fuel efficiency. What you’ll do: Primary responsibility is to provide technical design, analysis, and guidance for new product development and product improvements. Has the decision-making authority on behalf of Mechanical Engineering for system and component design and the responsibilities for guiding and directing applicable IPT technical decisions and accomplishment of objectives. Engineer works with one or more IPT to design, analyze, and implement product designs and design improvements in all phases of a product design lifecycle Lead and participate in efforts to solve problems with product design, inspection, manufacturing, and test encountered by vendors, company operations personnel, and customers. Plan, organize, control, and lead multiple simultaneous projects. Establish and oversee accomplishment of multiple project objectives. Create, update, and interpret project schedules and communicates changes and status to Engineering Leadership and IPT(s). Support targets and milestones for project budgets and schedules. Participate in resolving program change of scope issues with Project Engineering and Program Management. Serve as primary technical contact for multiple cross-functional teams and liaison between Engineering and internal and external customers. Interacts directly with internal and external customers through formal technical presentations and informal discussions. Create, develop, and guide the creation of design standards, technical documents, including Engineering drawings (following ASME Y14.5, ASME Y14.34 standards), test procedures, test reports, and design review material. Present product design and substantiating data and analysis, design findings and recommendations to customers and management. Provide technical leadership, mentoring, and coaching to co-workers. Provide direction to other engineers on project teams. Ensure standardization of design of products and adherence to engineering processes across multiple projects. Supports continuous improvement by offering input to standard processes and procedures. Proactively collaborate with peers and managers to determine key goals, objectives, and corresponding metrics. Review and amend these actions as appropriate. Focus on the timely achievement of these goals and objectives. Interpret engineering documents. Coordinate creation and update of engineering documents. Participate and lead studies and improvement for cost reduction and first-time yield. Lead and participate in cross-functional Root Cause and Corrective Action (RCCA) investigations. Provide engineering input and technical expertise and sound engineering judgment for failure investigation and for customer-returned hardware. Qualifications: Required (Basic) Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in engineering from an accredited institution required. Minimum five (5) years of Mechanical and Project Engineering including design experience utilizing 3D CAD software in the aerospace, hydraulic, or vehicle industry environment OR Master's degree from an accredited institution and a minimum of two (2) years of experience in the aerospace, hydraulic, or vehicle industry Minimum of two (2) years’ experience implementing hydraulic product design and testing in a plant environment. Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship both now and in the future. This position requires use of information or access to hardware which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee. No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates that currently reside within 50 miles of the Los Angeles, CA facility will be considered. Active Duty Military Service member candidates are exempt from the geographical area limitation. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical or aerospace Engineering from an accredited institution Master’s degree in mechanical or aerospace Engineering from an Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) accredited institution. Experience in the Aerospace Industry. Experience with Pro/Engineer, Enovia PLM, or similar 3D design and lifecycle management software tools. Experience with designing hydraulic, pneumatic, or electromechanical products using Advanced manufacturing techniques and transitioning to a production environment. Ability to apply of Geometrical Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) principles and perform tolerance stack-up analyses. Ability to perform basic structural and/or performance analysis. Working knowledge of Design for Six Sigma (DFSS), Design for Manufacturability (dfM), Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA), Design of Experiments (DOE), and Root Cause and Corrective Action (RCCA) principles. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law. Eaton considers qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with local laws. To request a disability-related reasonable accommodation to assist you in your job search, application or interview process, please call us at 1-800-836-6345 to discuss your specific need. Only accommodation requests will be accepted by this phone number. We know that good benefit programs are important to employees and their families. Eaton provides various Health and Welfare benefits as well as Retirement benefits, and several programs that provide for paid and unpaid time away from work. Click here for more detail: Eaton Benefits Overview. Please note that specific programs and options available to an employee may depend on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

Description: Position Overview:     At Navistar, we’re driving change in the transportation industry and striving to help create a cleaner, more sustainable world where future generations can thrive. With that, it’s an exciting time to be at Navistar, as we work to accelerate the impact of sustainable mobility throughout North America and, with our TRATON GROUP colleagues, worldwide. We are undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks and buses to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.  We are looking for a bright and talented   Product Engineer- Cooling Systems that enjoys working within cross-functional teams and is passionate about developing the next generation of powertrain cooling systems. Based in metro Chicago, Navistar is a leading global manufacturer of trucks and buses and member of the Traton Group. Our culture is to do things in days, not months, with the goal of delivering superior levels of product performance to our customers. Periodic trips to New Carlisle, IN.  Responsibilities:  CAD Model and print creation/release in NX/Team Center Collaboration with the CAE group Creating Component and System Design Requirements Documents (DRD’s) GD&T and Tolerance Stack Calculations Organizing and creating Bills Of Materials for large assemblies DFMEA and DVP&R creation and support in execution of APQP process 1D engineering calculations in Excel, VBA, and/or MATLab Support issue resolutions using rigorous problem-solving practices Create product build books for manufacturing and service Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 12 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies and/or computer science experience At least 2 years of experience leading new technologies or specialized technologies   OR  Master’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 8 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies and/or computer science experience At least 2 years of experience leading new technologies or specialized technologies   OR  PhD in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 5 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies or specialized technologies and/or computer science experience At least 2 years of experience leading new technologies or specialized technologies Additional Requirements:      Qualified candidates, excluding current Navistar employees, must be legally authorized on an unrestricted basis (US Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident, Refugee or Asylee) to be employed in the United States. Navistar does not anticipate providing employment related work sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B status)    Desired Skills:  Experience in truck and/or automotive design and development Experience with requirement documentation and system engineering Experience with Vehicle, Powertrain or Engine Cooling System design Design and layout experience using Unigraphics UG-NX2 or any CAD related modeling software Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment; to interface with suppliers and cross-functional teams to achieve timely execution of assigned projects Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment; to interface with suppliers and cross-functional teams to achieve timely execution of assigned projects Familiarity with design quality tools including: Failure Modes Effects Analysis & DVP Design for Manufacturing Design for Assembly Basic Dimensional Management (GD&T, etc.) Statistical Tolerance Stack-up Problem solving skills such as 8D, 3 legged 5 Why’s and statistical problem solving is a plus Company Overview:     Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t.  Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts.  With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com.  Accelerating the Impact of Sustainable Mobility:     Visit us at   www.Navistar.com to discover more about our organization  Navistar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.  #ridewithnavistar

PRODUCT DESIGN ENGINEER Location: US        Date: Nov 3, 2023                    Product Design Engineer - Auburn Hills R&D                        JOB SUMMARY                       Product Design Engineer will be responsible to design chassis parts which meets all the requirements of different OEMs.             As part of this he will work very closely with other team members including CAE, forming and process.                        DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES                       To process a chassis component from pre-concept to production which typically includes the following key tasks:             1. The Product Design Engineer will be expected to travel as required to support customer and company objectives. Approx. 80% of time will be spent on CAD in the office             2. Generate concept designs, identifying problems and solutions and delivering detailed designs             3. Ensure component designs are production feasible, using Design for Manufacture/Assembly             4. Support prototype build, product testing, product design timing plans and ongoing production needs             5. Liaise with customers’ Engineers to achieve design requirements             6. Obtain and control package information from customers             7. Produce three dimensional solid models to support customer requirements             8. Produce two dimensional Engineering drawings for prototype/production use with capable dimensional tolerances/GDT             9. Work concurrently with CAE Design Analyst to develop appropriate structural solutions to meet performance requirements             10. Arrange and lead design / feasibility reviews and ensure all released designs have formal manufacturing feasibility approval             11. Support DFMEA, VA/VE, QFD and GDT team reviews             12. Ensure departmental project compliance with ISO/TS16949             13. Identify any training requirements and follow up.                       EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE                       1. Minimum of two year degree with experience though a four-year college degree is preferred with a major in engineering.             2. 3-5 years’ experience automotive engineering design (preferably in chassis components)             3. Proficient in CATIA V5. Solid and surface modelling             4. Knowledge of Siemens NX (UG) and TeamCenter is an added plus             5. Experience with DFMEA                        KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES                       1. An understanding of stamping, tooling and welding processes would be a benefit.             2. An understanding of CAD requirements and highly skilled in CATIA V5.             3. Understanding of drafting standards and geometric dimensioning and tolerancing.             4. Good communication skills to interact at all levels across the business including customers and suppliers             5. The ability to generate design concepts that are fit for purpose, directionally correct and support the company’s overall objectives and strategy             6. Ability to understand, interpret and act upon results from design analysis to optimize component designs             7. Knowledge of Microsoft software such as Excel, PowerPoint and Word             8. Strong team-working skills, decision-making, and ability to provide direction as appropriate.           We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to hire the best candidate regardless of age, beliefs, disability, ethnicity, gender or sexual orientation.About us We are a multi-technology company present in over 20 countries and our team of over 40,000 is made up of 90 different nationalities. They are the driving force of our company, which designs, develops and produces parts for over 900 models of the leading vehicle manufacturers, and enable us to be one of the top suppliers worldwide.Do you have what it takes to build the future of mobility with us?You will be joining a leading international group in the automotive sector with a clear commitment to innovation, a trail-blazer in Industry 4.0 and engaged with ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) criteria.This is an opening to build a career in a global environment with many opportunities to grow both professionally and personally by participating and leading innovative and international projects.You will find a supportive and friendly environment where the emphasis is on team work, continuous improvement, trust, a dynamic spirit and thinking outside the box, and a passion for a job well done.You will be working with highly qualified professionals as Gestamp is committed to the ongoing training of our teams.Join the Gestamp team!

Position: Mechanical Engineer / Principal Mechanical Engineer – Mechanical Design
Description: In a world full of possibilities, why not pursue a path that offers endless opportunities? Next, imagine the possibilities at Quadrus Corporation! When it comes to your career aspirations, if you can imagine it, you can achieve it at Quadrus Corporation. Envision a career where you collaborate with intelligent and diverse individuals who share a common goal. Picture a workplace that embraces your uniqueness and fosters your growth. At Quadrus Corporation, we have exactly what you're searching for. Quadrus Corporation is a trusted provider of Multidisciplinary Engineering, Consulting, and Staff Augmentation services for complex defense, space, and commercial projects. With a proven track record since 1995, we have successfully partnered with entities such as the Army, NASA, school systems, nonprofits, and commercial customers. Our commitment sets us apart. Join us at Quadrus Corporation and unlock your full potential. Your next career move awaits! Quadrus Corporation is seeking a Mechanical Engineer / Principal Mechanical Engineer to join the Command and Launch Team. This position is located in Roy, UT, and supports the Ground Based Strategic Deterrent (GBSD) program. The final grade is determined based on the candidate's experience. What You’ll Get To Do: The selected candidate will support the Launch Equipment Sup-IPT mechanical design/development and will be responsible for the following:Evaluating mechanical systems, products, components, and applications by reviewing designs.Ensures product quality by reviewing mechanical designs and validating that current standards are applied.Supports the delivery of Mechanical Systems design Technical Data Packages, as-built TDPs, PDPs, interface models, and additional design artifactsSupporting structured trade studies to evaluate alternative design solutions to resolve technical issuesDeveloping and presenting design change requests, coordinating with impacted internal and external stakeholders, and ensuring configuration control of the technical baseline.Identifying risks and opportunities associated with or driven by design factors and executing handling/mitigation/capture actions to reduce risk or realize opportunities.Developing and maturing Mechanical System designs that meet Weapon System requirements, UFC, MIL-STD, and other applicable codes and regulations. As a full-time employee of Quadrus Corporation, you are eligible for our robust benefits package including:Medical, Dental & Vision coverage401kEducational AssistanceLife Insurance Paid Time OffHealth & Wellness Resources This role may offer a competitive relocation assistance package. You’ll Bring These Qualifications: Engineer: Bachelor of Science degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) discipline and 2 years of experience; 0 years with a Master’s Degree Principal Engineer: Bachelor of Science degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) discipline and 5 years of experience; 3 years with a Master’s Degree; 0 years with a PhDExperience with Finite Element Analysis toolsA current DoD Secret Clearance granted or re-investigated within the last 6 years with the ability to obtain Special Program Access clearances. These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:Experience with any of the following software packages: Siemens NX, ANSYS, Abaqus CAE, FEMAP, NastranExperience with either of the following programs: AFGROW, NASGROExperience with metallic and composite structure sizing.Experience working on Special Access ProgramsParticipation in multiple design cycles in spacecraft/aircraft development programs

Description: We're ALTEN Technology USA, an engineering company that provides solutions for engineering, technology, and product development projects. For decades, we've been helping our clients develop products that are changing the world, whether that's by shaping the future of space exploration, saving lives with medical devices that set a new standard of care, or creating the fully autonomous electric taxi of tomorrow. Our team of more than 600 people works across industries including aerospace, medical devices and life sciences, unmanned systems and robotics, automotive OEM and tier 1 suppliers, commercial vehicle, electric vehicles, rail, and more. Our offices across the US have different industry focuses and engage with our clients in different ways, ranging from working on-site at client facilities to performing product development at our delivery centers.ALTEN Group, our parent company, has been a leader in engineering and information technology for more than 30 years. ALTEN Group operates in 30 countries across Europe, North America, Asia, Africa and the Middle East and employs more than 36,000 people, 88% of whom are engineers. The company covers the whole development cycle and offers a choice of service levels, from technology consulting to complete project outsourcing.When you join ALTEN Technology USA, you join a group of people passionate about collaborating to solve some of the world's most technical engineering challenges. Our success is tied to taking care of our employees by building relationships and providing opportunities for mentorship and career growth. We offer comprehensive benefits for all full-time employees, including medical, dental, and vision insurance; a 401(k) plan with employer matching; paid time off (PTO); paid parental leave; and mentorship to help you take your career to the next level. Individual will be responsible for coordinating the packaging with all adjacent departments (electromechanical, electrical, lighting, trim). Will be responsible for working with virtual validation groups to ensure that the CAE scorecard is met as well as manufacturing feasibility. Will be responsible for maintaining and updating DVP&R, DFMEA. Also responsible to support & manage suppliers for quality actions and VO activities.Engineer needs to support meeting throughout NA work hours and work closely with local engineering teams, Architecture/Vehicle Concepts, program science teams & PDO with iterative models to align with all packaging, functional objectives and system requirements.Basic Qualifications:Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent from an ABET accredited or equivalent programFive years of relevant experienceKnowledgeable in use of Unigraphics NX and TeamcenterIntermediate to advanced level of design/development engineering experience in Body-Body in White, Closures, or Exterior SystemsPreferred Qualifications:Knowledge and experience with composites and composite production processesKnowledge and experience with steel / aluminum forming processes.BIW in-plant launch experience.Experience with Design Failure Mode & Effects Analysis (DFMEA)Experience with Design Verification Plan & Report (DVP&R)Knowledgeable in regard to high strength steels, weld parameters and GD&T
