Description: IMI plc IMI plc is a sector focused organisation at the forefront of delivering motion and fluid control technologies that create a more sustainable world, improving the quality of life for our customers and communities and ultimately delivering our purpose of Breakthrough Engineering for a Better World. Life Technology platform is focused on technologies that enhance and improve everyday life, particularly in the areas of health, sustainability, and comfort. We help OEMs across life science and fluid control industries improve the performance of their devices, enabling better scientific research, faster diagnosis of diseases, better medical treatments, and more efficient machines, dramatically improving life for everyone. Our one big team work fairly and effectively but most importantly together to ensure we maintain the foundations that have enabled IMI’s success through over 150 years of heritage. Role Overview: The Manufacturing Engineer is responsible for optimizing the production processes of Norgren products by determining efficient methods, selecting machinery and tooling, and preparing process documents. This role collaborates with various departments, including Design Engineering, to evaluate new products and provide cost and material recommendations. The engineer designs tooling and fixtures, reviews existing processes for enhancements, and contributes to in-house machine design, sometimes involving travel to observe machinery in other plants. Interaction with the Supply Chain Department and external vendors is essential in executing these responsibilities.. Location: Onsite in Farmington, CT Key ResponsibilitiesBuild effective relationships with manufacturing personnel and management across all levels.Design and implement safety-centric equipment, prioritizing hazard-free working conditions.Design or coordinate the design of efficient machinery, test equipment, and facilities.Address ergonomic, machine-guarding, and industrial hygiene hazards by incorporating available technologies and industry-leading best practices into the design of equipment and workstations.Execute efficient cell layouts, ensuring line balance based on TAKT time for diverse demand outcomes.Identify and implement productivity savings opportunities, presenting business cases through comprehensive CAPEX forms.Complete all necessary standard work documentation – (Set up sheets, Work instructions, Standard work layout etc.)Identify opportunities for process improvements as related to material flow and presentation to assembly cells.Ensure the most economical production of parts through the recommendation of materials and manufacturing processes to be used to produce high quality parts and products.Prepare and meet cost estimates by specifying the most economical materials and procedures to be used while meeting the established quality standards.Act as Project Manager for equipment installation projects. Prepare all necessary documentation for capital equipment requirements and equipment projects.Analyze product designs for the best methods of manufacture.Provide technical support for specific plant operations and be a technical resource for the production team.Stay abreast of current product developments and trends in areas of expertise.Act as a technical resource for the production team, supporting problem-solving activities and leading improvements related to safety and quality.AII other duties as assigned by management.Critical Competencies for SuccessFour-year engineering degree (e.g. BSME) and 1-3 years of experience in manufacturing engineering.Proficient in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).Working knowledge of MRP Systems, 2D drawings and CAE softwareProficient in 3D CAD operation. Autodesk Inventor preferred.Must have strong troubleshooting skills and be familiar with changing technology used in manufacturing.Must be able to troubleshoot and repair equipment.Must have excellent communication skills and be a dynamic, high-impact individual.Effective use of APQP tools such as process flow diagrams, PFMEA's and Control Plans.Six Sigma greenbelt or blackbelt (preferred)Lean manufacturingWhat IMI can offer you: At IMI, one of our top priorities is to create an inclusive culture of health. We strive to remove barriers to care (whether that be physical or financial) and in doing so, we offer choice for all your health and wellbeing needs. See below for a general overview of our amazing perks and benefits:Multiple health plans to choose from: HMO, PPO, and High Deductible Health Plans with a low-cost shareFull suite of voluntary benefits to tap into, including but not limited to: Pet insurance, critical illness insurance, concierge services, legal insurance, commuter benefits (if applicable), and home & auto insurance.Employer contribution for Health Savings Account, and in many cases free virtual telemedicine, and teletherapy.Best-in-class 401K plan with zero vesting and up to 6% contribution matching.Mental Health and wellness programs to support you and your family.Short & long-term disability as well as basic life insurance at 2x your basic salary at no cost to the employee.Free financial advisors, webinars, and classes through Charles Schwab.Annual Employee Stock Purchase Plan with option to purchase IMI shares at a reduced employee only price - no opportunity to lose, only to profit or refund your investment 100%**Benefits plans change year over year, but we have guiding principles in place to ensure our employees have the tools and resources available to stay connected and up to date** Health & Safety: The physical demands described within the Key Duties & Responsibilities section of this job description are required to perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made for individuals with disabilities. Please contact your local HR representative to discuss the specific Work Conditions and Physical Requirements of this role. Health, Safety, and Environmental Duties – At IMI we are all personally committed to protecting our people, minimizing our impact to the environment, the communities we operate in and our company. All members of our workforce have the duty to ensure the health, safety and welfare of themselves, others, and the environment. Every employee is expected to follow all HSE operating procedures, also to challenge any observed behaviors or unsafe acts. Code of Ethics: IMI requires the highest standard of ethics in all business dealings, particularly with customers, suppliers, advisors, employees, and the authorities. In accordance with the IMI Way: Our Code of Responsible Business. Changes to This Job Description: IMI may amend this job description in whole or part at any time. IMI is an equal opportunity employer. Position: Sr. Propulsion System Simulation and Optimization Engineer
Description: About Rivian:     Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.  Role Summary:   The responsibility of this position is to integrate and maintain Rivian electric drive propulsion system model to support propulsion system simulation and optimization. This candidate will engage with integrating propulsion system component models with the overall goal of running system simulation and support propulsion system optimization. This candidate will engage with the development of vehicle dynamic model to interface with the propulsion system model. Additionally, this candidate will engage with the development of new tools and methods to facilitate overall drive system model development and enhance model accuracy. Responsibilities:  Integrate and maintain electric vehicle propulsion system component models, motor, inverter, battery pack, gear box etc., to simulate vehicle performance and energy efficiency over predefined drive cycles. Integrate and maintain vehicle dynamic model. Work closely with vehicle simulation team to incorporate durability cycles for system simulation. Perform model validation using system and component level test data. Define tests to facilitate model correlation. Work closely with the mechanical design and CAE team to incorporate thermal, structural, and NVH into system model for performance simulation and to support design optimization. Work with different cross functional teams in support of developing drive system component models. Support execution of drive system models in windows platform as well as in Linux with parallel computation in high performance computing (HPC) cluster or in cloud. Develop and support C/C++ or python-based scripting for job submission and execution in computing clusters or in cloud. Develop new tools and methods to facilitate and enhance system simulation and optimization. Ensure timely completion of project deliverables. Support both internal and R&D efforts. Travel as required, both domestic and international. Qualifications:  Minimum master’s degree with 5+ years or PhD with 2+ years of experience in electrical or mechanical engineering related to developing drive system component models and optimization techniques. Strong programing skills in Matlab/Simulink, Matlab GUI, C/C++, and Python. Strong knowledge of running drive system simulation in Matlab/Simulink, Amesim etc. Strong knowledge of fundamental physics, geometry, and general engineering principles. Working knowledge in electromagnetic FEA software such as Maxwell, JMAG etc. Working knowledge of mechanical FEA software such as Abaqus, Ansys Mechanical and knowledge of Pre- and Post-Processors, such as Hypermesh/Hyperview. Experience of 1D simulation platforms such as CarMaker, Car Sim and Car Real Time advantageous Demonstrated ability to multi-task and handle multiple projects simultaneously. Good understanding of engineering theory and principles of electric drive system components. Pay Disclosure:  Salary Range/Hourly Rate for California Based Applicants: $135,000 - $155,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law). Benefits Summary: Rivian provides robust medical/Rx, dental and vision insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Rivian covers most of the premiums. Company Statements:  Equal Opportunity   Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.  Candidate Data Privacy   Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.  Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.  Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions.  Please note that we are currently not accepting applications from third party application services.

Position: Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer, Chassis Architecture, New Programs Engineer
Description: What to Expect  The New Programs Engineering team works at the front-end of vehicle design and development, working in an iterative environment to study, simulate, build, and prove Tesla’s future generation of vehicles. This position requires frequent interaction with our Interior/Exterior Design, Human Factor & Ergonomics, and Vehicle Engineering production teams, most closely with Chassis, Body-in-White, Low-Voltage, NVH, Durability, and CAE analyses and vehicle dynamics and controls partners. You will be part of the team that creates and executes world-class new vehicle architectures. You will utilize your expertise in chassis systems and vehicle attributes and develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering systems rather than just components. This is a mechanical design engineering position where product design expertise and a fundamental, first principles approach to problem solving are far more important than extensive project engineering or automotive industry specific experience. What You’ll Do  Operate as a standalone role and responsible for owning chassis systems (comprising of suspension, brake and steering systems, subframes and wheels/tires) in the early vehicle development phase Architect, mature and develop vehicle chassis systems from initial product scope and concepts through to design & release of prototype level components and systems that represent future production vehicles Capture, document, and trade-off internal and external (regulatory) requirements for chassis systems Generate chassis concept proposals for front/rear suspension, subframes, steering and brake systems in alignment with the new vehicle program scope and attribute requirements Develop a tire portfolio and align tire size with vehicle attributes (loads, comfort, handling dynamics, NVH, efficiency, durability) while achieving desired design proportions and occupants/vehicle packaging Analyze chassis concept proposals through simulations (capturing for example kinematics and compliance and basic ride/lateral/longitudinal vehicle dynamics) Down select chassis solutions generated based on quantifiable vehicle attributes, system cost and weight. Propose and defend solutions in engineering and studio design review meetings Develop in CATIA 3D geometry of suspension, steering and braking systems starting with pick-up points in a 3D space and placeholder geometry. Develop dynamic clearance sweeps for suspension components and wheels/tires Mature 3D chassis geometry over time and align/resolve (as part of a small interdisciplinary team) interfaces and clearances with body structure, interior, thermal and powertrain components Design, release and build chassis components for early-phase physical prototyping to validate the targeted chassis attributes Innovate, develop, and improve engineering development processes continuously What You’ll Bring  BS in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent Minimum of 4 years of relevant chassis engineering experience (OEM/supplier, motorsport) Broad experience with automotive chassis systems (suspensions, subframes, brakes, steering, tires) and prototyping First-principles knowledge of vehicle attributes as it relates to chassis systems including vehicle dynamics, noise-vibration and harshness, durability, vehicle packaging Proficiency in CAD (Computer Aided Design) software using parametric elements and knowledge-based engineering tools Strong understanding of GD&T Ability to interpret CAE results and integrate recommendations into product designs Must be proactive in improving processes and driving projects, examples of this should be provided Detail-oriented personality with effective documentation and reporting Excellent communicator, resourceful, and mindful of time management Systems-level thinker with evidence of driving product design optimization across products, disciplines, and teams  Capability to run virtual kinematics and compliance analyses to optimize suspension geometry within a given boundary box Experience with subjectively and objectively evaluating braking, steering, ride and handling attributes in production and prototype vehicles Experience with by-wire chassis systems (brakes, steering) Experience in automotive systems engineering Experience with assembly/manufacturing technologies to design innovative assembly architectures and chassis systems Proficiency with CATIA V6 (3DX)

Position: Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer, Battery Architecture, New Programs Engineering
Description: What to Expect     The New Programs Engineering team works at the front-end of vehicle design and development, working in an iterative environment to study, simulate, build, and prove Tesla’s future generation of vehicles. This position requires frequent interaction with the Vehicle Design, Human Factor & Ergonomics, and Vehicle Engineering & Manufacturing production teams, most closely with Chassis, Body-in-White, Low/high voltage distribution, Thermal, CAE analyses and powertrain modelling. You will be part of the team that creates and executes world-class new vehicle architectures. You will utilize your expertise in battery engineering and attributes and develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering systems rather than just components. This is a mechanical design engineering position where product design expertise and a fundamental, first principles approach to problem solving are far more important than extensive project engineering or automotive industry specific experience.   What You’ll Do  Operate as a standalone role and responsible for owning the high-voltage battery architecture (cell, module, thermals, ancillaries, pack) concept design in the early vehicle development phase Architect, mature and develop the battery architecture from initial product scope and concepts through to design & release of prototype level components and systems that represent future production vehicles Capture, document, and trade-off internal and external vehicle targets and translate them into high-voltage battery specific design requirements Conceptualize proposals for a scalable battery architecture and identify layouts that can meet the vehicle packaging, vehicle performance, crashworthiness, and thermal targets Apply first-principal thinking to lay out a scalable high-voltage battery pack (cell series/parallel count, number of cells per module, number of modules, module packaging inside enclosure, cooling type, ancillary location, and enclosure design) based on required battery pack energy capacities Collaborate with powertrain and thermal engineering to design high-voltage distribution and thermal interfaces as it related to the battery pack system Collaborate with vehicle body structural engineering to design the interfaces to the body-in-white Collaborate with manufacturing and service engineering to understand mass production factory constraints (body shop, coatings, assembly) and service center requirements (pack removal, component servicing) Conduct architectural trade-off studies to evaluate feasibility of unique design options Down select proposals generated based on a vehicle-level roll up of attributes, cost, weight, and factory/service opportunities and constraints. Propose and defend solutions in engineering and studio design review meetings. Develop and mature CATIA 3D geometry of the CATIA parametric design of modules, enclosures, high voltage distribution and ancillary systems Mature 3D geometry over time and align/resolve (as part of a small interdisciplinary team) interfaces and clearances with body-in-white, interior, thermal and powertrain components, and requirements set by human factors and ergonomics Innovate, develop, and improve engineering development processes continuously What You’ll Bring  BS in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent Minimum of 4 years of relevant battery engineering experience (OEM/supplier/contractor) First-principles knowledge of vehicle attributes as it relates to high-voltage battery design including vehicle performance, range, safety, durability/reliability Experience with energy storage cells, modules, and packs Ability to interpret powertrain, thermal and crashworthiness simulation results and integrate recommendations into product designs Proficiency in CAD (Computer Aided Design) software using parametric elements and knowledge-based engineering tools. Strong understanding of GD&T Must be proactive in improving processes and driving projects, examples of this should be provided Detail-oriented personality with effective documentation and reporting Excellent communicator, resourceful, and mindful of time management Systems-level thinker with evidence of driving product design optimization across products, disciplines, and teams  Understanding of power electronics and how different cell chemistries can affect the high-voltage battery design Hands-on experience building/assembling (prototype) battery modules/packs Experience solving open-ended engineering problems Proficiency with CATIA V6 (3DX)

Are you detail-oriented, creative, and technically skilled at Engineering design and development? Come to Crane Aerospace & Electronics and use your excellent Engineering skills to design, improve, and deliver the next generation of products in the aerospace and electronics Industry! Crane Aerospace & Electronics has a unique and exciting career opportunity for an Electrical Engineer in Burbank, CA. Purpose of Position: In summary you will be responsible to maximize product performance by researching, designing, developing and sustaining electronic or electrical products and systems. Perform analyses on new product designs to ensure efficiency, reliability and quality. Participate in engineering design review and testing of products. The overall objective is to ensure customer satisfaction. This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home. Some conditions apply which will be discussed during the interview process. Full policy to be provided after hire. Responsibility and Accountability: Generate hardware requirements and design documents based on system requirements. Conduct technical analysis to validate requirements, traceability, designs, including but not limited to: trait studies, product design, system/component integration, mathematical modeling, reliability analysis, and development.  Responsible for circuits design, analysis, build, test and generate documents/reports for products development. Prepare and review technical reports/documentation necessary to satisfy customer, internal and program requirements, including specifications, design documents, test plans/procedures, reports, correspondence, etc.  Work in collaboration with all functional areas to design and develop products that meet customer specifications and company requirements for schedule, cost, production ability, quality and reliability. Follow the design through the entire design and manufacturing lifecycle.Highly Regarded Qualifications: Experience in designing, developing and qualifying aircraft components. Experience in leading teams. Minimum Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering or Electronics (Master’s Degree Preferred). Minimum Five (5) + years of relevant experience in Electrical Engineering Experience in products development for aerospace industry. Must have experience in the design and development of: Analog and digital circuitry, Programmable and discrete logic. Experience with LabVIEW, Altium, DO-160, DO-254 and IPC standards. Knowledge:  Knowledge of embedded digital circuitry and software control. Knowledge of circuit design and development with analog and microcontroller/microprocessor based systems. Knowledge of equipment utilized in support of testing similar/related Electronic, Aerospace and/or Defense products.Skills:  Ability to perform technical writing assignments in generation of test specifications, hardware requirements, and customer proposals. Good technical writing and verbal communication skills with proficient computer skills in common office software programs. Demonstration of a very cooperative, helpful attitude. Team members in all areas of the facility will be required to aid in developing a positive relationship between Engineering and all plant levels. Occasional travel to customer and supplier facilities for technical interchange meetings, design reviews, product support, and technical seminars. Eligibility Requirement: This position requires access to controlled data or information and therefore only US persons will be considered. As a US Department of Defense contractor, we are bound by the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). About Crane: Crane Aerospace & Electronics supplies critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. You’ll find Crane Aerospace & Electronics in some of the toughest environments: from engines to landing gear; from satellites to medical implants and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems (UAS). Crane Aerospace & Electronics brings industry-leading electronic and hydraulic subsystems for landing gear together in solutions that add value and offer superior performance our customers can count on. We are committed to operational excellence and world class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniques to optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value. Salary range: $119,204 to $142,313. Several factors contribute to actual salary, including experience in a similar role or performing comparable job responsibilities, skills, training, and other qualifications. Position: FEA Engineer (Rochester, NY or Toronto, Canada)
Description: At SimuTech Group, we truly believe that we are driving innovation and changing the world through the power of engineering simulation. Our growing team of energetic, tech savvy professionals work hard every day to inspire our clients to push the boundaries of innovation and deliver transformational products. If you are motivated and driven by a culture where excellent work ethic and passion are rewarded, then a career with SimuTech Group may be for you! Looking for your next career move? Help today’s engineers build tomorrow’s products by providing solutions and guidance with the power of simulation. We are looking for a Mechanical Engineer with 1 to 3 years of experience to join our world-class FEA Support and Consulting team! This position will be based out of our office in Rochester, NY or Toronto, Canada. The right candidate will become a key member of our technical staff; working and learning in an exciting and challenging technical environment. Success of the Mechanical Engineer will be measured not only by helping to grow SimuTech’s FEA business, but also by continued development of your own technical skills by solving challenging problems in a wide variety of industries. Each member of our staff is a FEA expert who also maintains expertise in one or more specialized fields. Many of our engineers hold advanced degrees with extensive experience in the engineering consulting business. We maintain a high level of professionalism in a friendly, cooperative, flexible environment. let Essential Job Functions/Accountabilities: The Mechanical Engineer will use software such as ANSYS Mechanical and Mechanical APDL to provide: 1. Technical Support - Provide Support to end users of ANSYS by phone, e-mail, or in person. 2. Pre-sales Support - Work with our account managers to determine the customer's software needs, answer customer technical questions during the sales process and provide software demos/presentations on a variety of subjects. 3. Consulting Work with customers to determine their analysis requirements and expectations. Develop quotes/proposals by determining scopes, costs and schedules Perform all aspects of analysis (Meshing, Load Cases, Solving, Post Processing, Conclusions) Work with customers to propose alternative design ideas Write analysis reports and other technical documents requested by the customer 4. Technical Training - Teach ANSYS classes at client sites, on-line, and in SimuTech offices across the U.S. and Canada Desired Skills/Experience: Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria: Must be permanently authorized to work in the US or Canada Professional appearance and presentation required. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Must be able to work well in a group and independently. Excellent English-based communication skills, technical writing and verbal skills required. Documented industry experience with enterprise level finite element analysis tools Ansys (preferred). Abacus, Nastran, Altair, etc: ANSYS Ability to communicate with customers on a technical pre-sales basis to help drive software and services sales Creativity Superb problem-solving and analytical skills Solid theoretical background in structural mechanics and numerical methods backed up by real-world, production-level experience Documented experience (as evidenced by industry experience and/or publications in reputable journals) in at least one of these areas:                         Structural linear and non-linear static implicit analysis methods (non-linear materials including plasticity and hyper elasticity as well as contact and large strain/large deformation) Implicit dynamics including linear (modal, harmonic, response spectrum, random vibration) and thermal analysis including both steady-state and time domain transient. Explicit dynamics modeling experience (crash impact, metal forming simulations, etc.) using LS-Dyna, Autodyn, or Abaqus Explicit Familiarity with grid generation and meshing techniques (Ansys CAE, Femap, Hypermesh) Personable attitude with an ability to work well with clients and other staff Bachelor's degree in engineering required; master's degree considered a plus Helpful Qualifications/Non-requirements: ANSYS programming skills, including GUI customization in J-script and Python Explicit dynamics modeling experience (crash impact, metal forming simulations, etc.) using LS-Dyna, Autodyn, or Abaqus Explicit Ability to use 3-D CAD to modify parts and assemblies (SpaceClaim Direct Modeler, DM, Solidworks, ProE or Siemens NX preferred) Practical ANSYS experience manipulating and/or modeling complex 3-D assemblies Academic background or work experience in fluid mechanics and CFD Experience with optimization and DOE methods LF/Maxwell experience Concrete modeling experience a plus. Benefits: Medical insurance 100% paid for by employer (no employee out-of-pocket costs required for the premiums, deductibles, and copays) Dental insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Vision insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Short Term Disability Long Term Disability 401k Plan with employer match Limited Flexible Spending Account Life Insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Referral program Tuition reimbursement Bonus plan Salary Range: $60,000 - $90,000 (depends on education and experience) ABOUT THE COMPANY: We have a 35+ year relationship with ANSYS and we are their largest Elite Channel Partner in North America. We provide world-class ANSYS engineering simulation software as well as support, training, consulting and physical testing services. We are headquartered in Rochester, NY with additional offices in Cleveland, Seattle, Montreal, and Toronto. We also have remote sales and engineering personnel throughout North America. SimuTech Group employs over 140 people with nearly half being engineers; most holding Master's or PhD degrees. SimuTech Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Description: Controls Engineers are responsible for designing, developing, installing, and maintaining equipment used to monitor and control systems, machinery, and processes. They work in various industries including industrial controls, water / wastewater, power controls and protection, and transportation systems. Join us and you’ll have the chance to work on projects including state-of-the-art federal and commercial facilities. The successful candidate will demonstrate a high degree of technical knowledge and competency with all areas of Controls Systems engineering, automation, and specifications development with multi-platform experience. You’ll be accountable for the schedule and technical quality of challenging engineering tasks, as you gain familiarity with the client’s expectations, scope, budget, and schedule. You’ll also provide on-site assistance during startup, coordinate work activities with other staff members and the discipline lead. Your multi-discipline, highly interactive team will produce designs for electrical circuits and panels utilizing control applications, designs for control systems for a variety of processes, and develop options and optimizations for all aspects of the control system and automation. You’ll also have the chance to utilize your technical expertise to mentor other professionals, helping your team discover what drives them, nurturing their purpose and guiding them forward.  Bring your curiosity, talent for multi-tasking and collaboration, and extreme organizational skills and we’ll help you grow, pursue, and fulfill what drives you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together. Technical Responsibilities Design / Engineering o Originates design documents and leads design of Large programs o Originates design documents for small projects and in support of large programs § Narrative Design Documents § Requirements Analysis § System Functional Documentation (Sequence of Operations) § Subsystem Designs (CAD / Panels / Layouts / Wiring / SCADA Screens / Hardware / Communications) § Preparation of Specifications § Perform QA/QC and technical reviews of designs. § Plans and Design Procedures and Fixtures for Integrated Systems Factory Testing § Comment Resolution  Programming o Lead programming / configuration team efforts for complex automation and SCADA applications. o Program / Configure / troubleshoot PLCs, RTUs, and/or HMI systems  Testing / Troubleshooting / Deployment / Commissioning o Author test plans for large programs Leads / supervises testing activities o Author testing / commissioning procedures Preparation of test reports o Originates test procedures o Commissioning of deployed systems o Development of test fixtures and simulation devices Perform Factory and Field Testing Maintenance o Perform troubleshooting on service calls to existing and legacy system operators Managerial Responsibilities Estimates o Leads proposal efforts (Research / Cost Estimates / Proposal Documents) for medium to large projects o Works with relevant stakeholders to review scope of project o Conducts any surveys, inspections, tours, etc. of client sites, as required Prepares cost estimates and supporting documents for small projects o Evaluation and pricing of change orders Divisional Management o Actively follows emerging technical trends and contributes to sector leadership and guidance in area of practice Personnel Management o Assigns technical tasks to engineers and administrative staff in support of projects o Assigns technical tasks and coordinates with entry-level engineers o Assigns tasks and coordinates with Technical Staff Field ExperienceExperience in reading electrical and control schematics and plans Experience in control system startup, configuration, and calibration Experience in testing and troubleshooting control systems Experience using basic electrical and machinist hand toolsExperience using testing, calibration, or industry-specific tools and softwareTools / SoftwareExperience in computer networksExperience in CAD/CAE Software (AutoCAD / EPLAN) Experience in schedule management softwareStandard Office Software (Microsoft Word, Excel, etc.)Licensure / Certification Required Certifications o Certification in one or more PLC / Automation Platform, such as: Schneider, Rockwell, Siemens, Niagara, etc. o Certification in one or more SCADA platform, such as: Wonderware, Iconics, Ignition, etc. Preferred Licenses / Certifications o Design Build Institute of America (DBIA) o Certified SCADA Security Architect (CSSA) o Certified Automation Professional (CAP) o Professional Engineer (PE) in relevant field. Education5-7 years of experience with a Master's degree in engineering or higher 7-9 years of experience with a Bachelor's degree in engineeringAbilitiesExposure to computer screens for an extended period of time.Sitting for extended periods of time.Reach by extending hands or arms in any direction.Have finger dexterity in order to manipulate objects with fingers rather than whole hands or arms, for example, using a keyboard.Listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.Communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.Read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.Apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.Identify and understand the speech of another person.Applicants for this position may be required to prove that they have received the COVID-19 vaccine or demonstrate that they have a valid religious or medical reason not to be vaccinated. Are you detail-oriented, creative, and technically skilled at Engineering design and development? Come to Crane Aerospace & Electronics and use your excellent Engineering skills to design, improve, and deliver the next generation of products in the aerospace and electronics Industry! Crane Aerospace & Electronics has a unique and exciting career opportunity for an Electrical Engineer in Burbank, CA. Purpose of Position: In summary you will be responsible to maximize product performance by researching, designing, developing and sustaining electronic or electrical products and systems. Perform analyses on new product designs to ensure efficiency, reliability and quality. Participate in engineering design review and testing of products. The overall objective is to ensure customer satisfaction. This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home. Some conditions apply which will be discussed during the interview process. Full policy to be provided after hire. Responsibility and Accountability: Generate hardware requirements and design documents based on system requirements. Conduct technical analysis to validate requirements, traceability, designs, including but not limited to: trait studies, product design, system/component integration, mathematical modeling, reliability analysis, and development.  Responsible for circuits design, analysis, build, test and generate documents/reports for products development. Prepare and review technical reports/documentation necessary to satisfy customer, internal and program requirements, including specifications, design documents, test plans/procedures, reports, correspondence, etc.  Work in collaboration with all functional areas to design and develop products that meet customer specifications and company requirements for schedule, cost, production ability, quality and reliability. Follow the design through the entire design and manufacturing lifecycle.Highly Regarded Qualifications: Experience in designing, developing and qualifying aircraft components. Experience in leading teams. Minimum Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering or Electronics (Master’s Degree Preferred). Minimum Five (5) + years of relevant experience in Electrical Engineering Experience in products development for aerospace industry. Must have experience in the design and development of: Analog and digital circuitry, Programmable and discrete logic. Experience with LabVIEW, Altium, DO-160, DO-254 and IPC standards. Knowledge:  Knowledge of embedded digital circuitry and software control. Knowledge of circuit design and development with analog and microcontroller/microprocessor based systems. Knowledge of equipment utilized in support of testing similar/related Electronic, Aerospace and/or Defense products.Skills:  Ability to perform technical writing assignments in generation of test specifications, hardware requirements, and customer proposals. Good technical writing and verbal communication skills with proficient computer skills in common office software programs. Demonstration of a very cooperative, helpful attitude. Team members in all areas of the facility will be required to aid in developing a positive relationship between Engineering and all plant levels. Occasional travel to customer and supplier facilities for technical interchange meetings, design reviews, product support, and technical seminars. Eligibility Requirement: This position requires access to controlled data or information and therefore only US persons will be considered. As a US Department of Defense contractor, we are bound by the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). About Crane: Crane Aerospace & Electronics supplies critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. You’ll find Crane Aerospace & Electronics in some of the toughest environments: from engines to landing gear; from satellites to medical implants and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems (UAS). Crane Aerospace & Electronics brings industry-leading electronic and hydraulic subsystems for landing gear together in solutions that add value and offer superior performance our customers can count on. We are committed to operational excellence and world class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniques to optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value. Salary range: $119,204 to $142,313. Several factors contribute to actual salary, including experience in a similar role or performing comparable job responsibilities, skills, training, and other qualifications. Compensation packages also include comprehensive benefits, 401K contribution and match, Paid Time Off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement and more. Position: CAE Engineer II - Vehicle Aerodynamics and Thermal Simulation (CFD)
Description: Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Goken America is an Engineering Services and Product Development company founded in 2004. At Goken America we strive to expand and deliver upon our company motto of “Creating Something Different”. We are continually striving to strengthen our organization, and are always seeking talented individuals who have a strong desire to work in an environment where they can make a difference.    Our “Vision” is to empower our associates to affect change wherever change is needed. Our “Mission” is that in building trust we foster greatness in our people, excellence in our clients and impact in our communities.    Goken America provides an excellent benefits package, one month of paid time off per year and a very competitive compensation plan. In addition, when applicable, we will also provide relocation assistance, temporary housing, visa support and other fringe benefits.  This role will support CAE development activities for full vehicle and complex vehicle system-level CAE model construction, visualization, and analysis for aerodynamics and/or thermal simulation (CFD). Responsibilities Utilize Hypermesh/Ansa for Construction of high-quality FE meshes and models of full vehicle and/or vehicle sub-systems. Conducting and analyzing full vehicle CFD simulation models for aerodynamics and/or thermal simulation using OpenFOAM and/or Star-CCM+. Interpret data, develop and report countermeasures using Hyperworks/Metapost for post-processing. Must be able to optimize and correlate analyses with real-world test results. Communicates effectively within the group about issues, and outside the group to accomplish goals. Analyze and resolve problems with moderate level of guidance and direction. Lead research activities to develop new and improve existing CAE methods. Utilizes Excel to create and update project schedules. Occasional physical test support with vehicle setup/preparation, wind tunnel/coast-down testing, and field test activities Travel to client site required. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Engineering and 5+ years relevant exp. or Master’s degree in Engineering and 3+ years relevant exp. Education with the following specialties preferred: Mechanical, Mechanical Technology, Aerospace, Automotive. Strong Microsoft Office skills, including excel. 3+ years of experience using pre-processor (Hypermesh/Ansa), post-processor (Hyperworks/Metapost), solver tools (OpenFOAM and/or Star-CCM+ and/or Fluent) for full vehicle and/or vehicle sub-systems CAE model construction, visualization, and analysis. CAD (CATIA V5/V6) design experience preferred. Hands-on experience with vehicle preparation for physical tests and Wind Tunnel testing preferred. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to handle or feel and reach with hands and arms.   Goken America (“Goken”) is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, or any other applicable protected basis under federal, state, or local law. The information collected by this application is solely to determine suitability for employment, verify identity, and maintain employment statistics on applicants.    Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is, in simple terms, a change in the way things are typically done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity. Please inform Goken’s personnel representative if you need assistance completing this application or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Description: Position Overview:     Navistar has an exciting new opportunity for a Project Engineer – Frames and Assemblies at our headquarters in Lisle, IL. The project engineer will work in Navistar’s Chassis Engineering product development group which is accountable for all design development and system ownership of frame systems across all our commercial vehicles. The systems include frame ladder (long members, cross-members, front end castings, and sheet metal structures, etc.), cab and chassis access steps and step mounting structures, after treatment device covers, battery boxes, fifth wheels, high voltage battery mounting, and fuel tank protective structures for buses.  Duties include design release, CAD modeling, BOM structure, and development of engineering requirements and verification plans for new product development. Also, includes sustaining projects including current product manufacturing issue problem solving. Duties also include assignments on multiple programs to deliver to cost and quality goals utilizing engineering analysis and experience in metal fabrications, castings, and extrusions.  The project engineer – Frames and Assemblies will be required to perform engineering judgment and provide technically sound justifications for those recommendations in a design review environment.  Responsibilities:  Research and Design new products and systems for customer needs Modify existing products or processes to improve vehicle performance using computer-aided design (CAD) and computer-assisted engineering (CAE) Integrate suppliers into design development to create prototypes for Design Validation Develop new options and combinations of features to meet customer needs Provide technical support and information to production plant team to ensure product integrity Maintain production orders by performing containments (interim corrective actions) and releases (permanent corrective actions) The role would also include mentoring junior engineers in the accomplishment of the tasks listed. In addition, the candidate will be expected to participate in the budgeting process by estimating program effort and preparing project plans for assigned work. Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 5 years of experience in product design/development and/or computer science experience   OR  Master’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 3 years of experience in product design/development and/or computer science experience   OR  PhD in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science Additional Requirements:  Qualified candidates, excluding current Navistar employees, must be legally authorized on an unrestricted basis (US Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident, Refugee or Asylee) to be employed in the United States. Navistar does not anticipate providing employment related work sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B status) Desired Skills:  Experience in truck and/or automotive design and development process Experience in design release process Experience in Unigraphics/NX 3D modeling software is a plus Understanding of manufacturing processes such as metal forming, stamping, and casting Structural design experience is a plus MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Project Company Overview:     Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t.  Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts.  With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com.  Accelerating the Impact of Sustainable Mobility:     Visit us at   www.Navistar.com to discover more about our organization  Navistar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.  #ridewithnavistar

Description: About Rivian:     Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.  Role Summary:     We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Automotive NVH (Noise, Vibration, and Harshness) Engineer to join our dynamic engineering team. You’ll work with a team of engineers and scientists to investigate and analyze unique problems, identify innovative solutions, and deliver a world-class customer experience for NVH by collaborating with a diverse group of cross-functional teams.  As an NVH Engineer you will play a crucial role in ensuring the refinement and quality of our current and future products by pushing the boundaries of what can be done in a vehicle. We are looking for a strong background in Mechanical Engineering and NVH principles, and a passion for building amazing products.  Responsibilities:  Build, refine and characterize Full vehicle simulation models (CAE), including Finite Element (FE), Statistical Energy (SEA) and Superlement models to identify opportunities for NVH performance. Utilize bench and on-road test data to drive simulation models and improve NVH CAE model fidelity to increase simulation reach and correlation between virtual models and test response. Work with NVH physical test and simulation data to build and refine NVH Simulator models (VI-Grade) to evaluate Vehicle comfort, NVH quality and character, and work with NVH team to refine user tactile and auditory experience. Utilize NVH simulation tools such as Modal and Transfer Path Analysis to understand the contribution of structure and airborne through different paths to characterize the NVH mechanism of our systems. Develop design solutions based on first principles, simulation, and test data analysis to improve product NVH experience. Collaborate and with a variety of teams, such as Powertrain, Battery, Structures, Thermal and Chassis amongst others to discuss and work with the system constraints to ensure NVH performance is achieved. Utilize coding and scripting (Python) to develop simulation tools to post-process large amounts of data and generate dashboards for easy visualization. Prepare technical documents, standards, and other visual representation to discuss and communicate the complex NVH data relationship discovered as part of your work. Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, Automotive Engineering, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. Proven experience in automotive NVH engineering, with at least 3-5 years of relevant work experience. Strong understanding of Mechanical principles and NVH fundamentals. Understanding of Digital Signal Processing (DSP) and NVH measurement Expertise in Pre-Process codes ANSA/Hyperworks and Postprocessor META/Hyperworks. Experience performing Modal Analysis and Transfer Path Analysis (TPA), Operational Deflection Shapes via Simulation CAE using either Optistruct and/or Nastran. Proficiency in NVH analysis software such as LMS Test.Lab, Siemens Simcenter, or equivalent. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively convey findings and recommendations. Knowledge of Python and other relevant programming languages is a plus. Understanding of relevant industry standards and regulations related to automotive NVH. Detail-oriented with a strong commitment to quality and safety. Pay Disclosure:   Salary Range Irvine-Based Applicants: $150,000-$173,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, and other factors permitted by law).  Salary Range Palo Alto-Based Applicants: $163,000 -$188,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, and other factors permitted by law).  Benefits Summary: Rivian provides robust medical/Rx, dental and vision insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Rivian covers most of the premiums.  Company Statements:  Equal Opportunity   Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.  Candidate Data Privacy   Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.  Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.  Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions.  Please note that we are currently not accepting applications from third party application services.

Position: Test Engineer II - Body/Chassis Strength and Durability
Description: Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Goken America is an Engineering Services and Product Development company founded in 2004. At Goken America we strive to expand and deliver upon our company motto of “Creating Something Different”. We are continually striving to strengthen our organization, and are always seeking talented individuals who have a strong desire to work in an environment where they can make a difference.    Our “Vision” is to empower our associates to affect change wherever change is needed. Our “Mission” is that in building trust we foster greatness in our people, excellence in our clients and impact in our communities.    Goken America provides an excellent benefits package, one month of paid time off per year and a very competitive compensation plan. In addition, when applicable, we will also provide relocation assistance, temporary housing, visa support and other fringe benefits.  This role will support engineering test and development activities for Automotive Body and/or Chassis sub-systems' Strength and Durability verification through concept to Mass Production. Responsibilities Lead and support the engineering test activities by applying engineering principles, experiences and various analysis tools in following established test plans/procedures to test parts/components in area of specialty to determine design feasibility and ensure parts/components meet design acceptance criteria, performance level targets and any applicable regulatory/internal standards. Depending on functional area, have to perform objective and subjective testing by driving. Utilize data acquisition tools to collect data, analyze and report results. Conduct vehicle benchmarking for the purpose of target setting. Support vehicle tuning and instrument vehicles for objective tests. Analyze and resolve problems with moderate level of guidance and direction. Negotiate with other departments internally and suppliers externally to meet the spec requirements. Coordinate with design and CAE teams to report results and develop countermeasures. Search new ways to increase overall efficiency, utilize up-to-date technology. Travel to client / test sites required. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Engineering and 5+ years relevant exp. or Master’s degree in Engineering and 3+ years relevant exp. Education with the following specialties preferred: Mechanical, Mechanical Technology, Aerospace, Automotive, Manufacturing. Minimum 2yrs experience using Data Acquisition tools. Test track / driving experience required for test driving. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Proficiency in MS office. Formula SAE (FSAE), BAJA SAE, EcoCar, Mini BAJA SAE, experience preferred. Hands on experience with wrenching and vehicle instrumentation preferred. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to handle or feel and reach with hands and arms.   Goken America (“Goken”) is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, or any other applicable protected basis under federal, state, or local law. The information collected by this application is solely to determine suitability for employment, verify identity, and maintain employment statistics on applicants.    Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is, in simple terms, a change in the way things are typically done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity. Please inform Goken’s personnel representative if you need assistance completing this application or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Description: About Fluence: Fluence Energy, Inc. (Nasdaq: FLNC) is a global market leader in energy storage products and services, and optimization software for renewables and storage. With a presence in over 47 markets globally, Fluence provides an ecosystem of offerings to drive the clean energy transition, including modular, scalable energy storage products, comprehensive service offerings, and the Fluence IQ Platform, which delivers AI-enabled SaaS products for managing and optimizing renewables and storage from any provider. Fluence is transforming the way we power our world by helping customers create more resilient and sustainable electric grids.      For more information, visit our website, or follow us on LinkedIn or Twitter. To stay up to date on the latest industry insights, sign up for Fluence's Full Potential Blog.   OUR CULTURE AND VALUES We are guided by our passion to transform the way we power our world. Achieving our goals requires creativity, diversity of ideas and backgrounds, and building trust to effect change and move with speed.   We are Leading    Fluence currently has thousands of MW of energy storage projects operated or awarded worldwide in addition to the thousands of MW of projects managed by our trading platform—and we are growing every day.   We are Responsible    Fluence is defined by its unwavering commitment to safety, quality, and integrity.   We are Agile    We achieve our goals and meet our customer’s needs by cultivating curiosity, adaptability, and self-reflection in our teams.   We are Fun    We value the diversity in thought and experience of our coworkers and customers. Through honest, forthcoming, and respectful communications we work to ensure that Fluence is an inclusive and welcoming environment for all.   As a Battery Module Mechanical Engineer you will:  Update and maintain the design of the battery module mechanical/structural components working and guiding design engineering.Work with our suppliers to ensure parts are released on time with quality.Work with the greater module team to ensure the overall performance and manufacturability of the module.Identify opportunities to improve cost and mass of the moduleIdentify module engineering design changes based on CAE and test resultsDevelop/refine Module component specifications.Lead component level DFMEA/PFMEAs What will our ideal candidate bring to Fluence? BS in Engineering 4+ years’ experience in Module engineering, preferably designing module components Experience building and using thermal/mechanical analytical models Highly tuned drive to win and deliver excellence under tight timelines Desire to work collaboratively in an entrepreneurial environment. Experience managing components developed by third party suppliers. Proficient in ASME Y14.5-2018 GD&T with the ability to perform dimensional stack ups independently Ability to travel 25% on average, up to 50% at times.   $96,000 - $144,000 a year     At Fluence we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace; if you are excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply!      Unlimited PTO      Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Pet Insurance      Generous 401K Match      Annual Bonus Incentive      #remote #energy #sustainability #inclusionmatters      Follow Fluence on LinkedIn: Fluence LinkedIn      Fluence Career Page: Fluence Careers   Fluence IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER and fully subscribes to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity to ensure that all applicants and employees are considered for hire, promotion, and job status without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital or familial status.

Location: New Berlin, WI 53151 (New Berlin Industrial Park area)
Description: We are currently seeking a motivatedProduct Design Engineerto join our team. At Radius Packaging we provide complete and differentiated rigid plastic packaging solutions that meet the needs of our customers. We know how critical packaging is to our customers’ success. After all, we partner with some of the most recognized consumer and industrial brands in the marketplace. We also know that at the heart of our success is a talented team committed to meeting the diverse needs of our customers on time, every time. A career at Radius Packaging allows you to evolve and grow while bringing creativity and a passion to accelerate what’s next for our customers, our industry, and the world we live and work in. Be a part of challenging and compelling work that matters. Radius Packaging offers an extensive benefits package including competitive pay, health, dental and vision insurance, health savings account, company paid health reimbursement account, company paid life insurance and short and long-term disability, vacation, 401k match, bonus potential, flex spending and additional voluntary benefits. At Radius our employees are the heart of our business. Radius continues to grow as a supplier of containers and lids for food, beverage, personal care, household, industrial, nutraceutical, wipes and pet care products. We are based in New Berlin and have a second facility in Delavan. We are passionate about our work and are excited for the future of our fast-growing business! What this position is: The Product Design Engineer will serve as a creative and technical team member to drive new product design of both blow molded and injection molded rigid plastic products, as well as foster innovation & sustainability initiatives. In support of Radius Packaging’s quest for innovation, the Product Design Engineer will strive to improve our product designs and customer capabilities, our team, and our environment through genuine teamwork, a positive attitude, and open communication, using a practical, hands-on approach. What we need you to accomplish: Execute design-related activities including initial concepts, 3D CAD modeling (solid & surface modeling), artistic renderings and product specification drawings. Perform design analysis through CAE tools such as Finite Element Analysis (FEA). Create and analyze 3D printed prototypes utilizing in-house additive manufacturing equipment. Lead and participate in mold design reviews for new product tooling builds. Design and analyze product secondary packaging to provide safe transport and ease of manufacturing while minimizing cost and environmental impact. Lead and facilitate ideation sessions with both internal and external customers. Develop concepts for new or existing products and utilize sketches and renderings to showcase product options. Own and drive research on market trends, aesthetics, function, serviceability, safety, budget, production costs/methods. Present and articulate designs to customers for feedback and approval. Support sales through professional presentation development. Travel to customers as needed to support new business development. Work safely, following all safety policies and proactively participating in the safe work of others and the safety of the overall environment. Position Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Packaging Engineering, Industrial Design or similar degree from accredited university and5 years of professionalexperience with preference for at least 2 years in the plastic consumer packaging industry. Self-starter with a continuous improvement mindset, always looking for the next best solution for our internal and external customers. Ability to sketch and experience with Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop. 3D CAD solid modeling, surface modeling and rendering software experience, with programs such as SolidWorks or similar. Strong design for manufacturability and finite element analysis skills. Expertise in molded plastic part design and understanding of mold and tooling design. Proficiency in drawing interpretation and GD&T. Ability to plan and manage multiple projects, while providing support for the daily needs of a production environment.
