Description: Joby Overview: Located in Northern California, the team at Joby Aviation is driven by our goal of creating an affordable, all-electric air transportation system. Imagine a piloted air taxi that takes off vertically, then quietly carries you and your fellow passengers over the congested city streets below, enabling you to spend more time with the people and places that matter most. Since 2009, our team has worked steadily to make this dream a reality. We’ve designed and tested many generations of prototype aircraft capable of serving in a network of electric air taxis. We’re looking for talented, committed individuals to join our team as we push onwards toward certifying the Joby aircraft with the Federal Aviation Administration, scaling our manufacturing, and preparing to launch commercial service in 2025. Overview:     Joby Aviation is seeking a passionate finite element analysis (FEA) engineer to join our Electric Powertrain team. This role will work primarily on developing FEA and other models to refine and develop the components and subassemblies that make up the Electric Propulsion System (EPU). The candidate will participate in the product development from concept phase through production and should be a self-starter with strong communication skills and possess a deep understanding of Finite Element Modeling, External and Internal Loads, and verification and validation.  Responsibilities:  Finite Element Model development/refinement, validation and correlation FEM over a wide scope, including non-linear large deformation, complicated mechanical systems/mechanisms, subassemblies, and material Structural design using CAD and design iteration through FEA Design, simulate, and execute structural/material/subassembly testing Required:  B.S. in mechanical engineering, or another relevant discipline At least 3+ years of working experience in relevant industry Prior FEA (Abaqus) and Computer Aided Engineering (CAE) experience Proficiency in non-linear analysis, including dynamic (crash), large deformation (plasticity and/or fracture), fatigue, and vibration Practical experience in validating FE models using component/system level, or customized tests Practical experience in modeling complicated mechanisms and mechanical systems, and model simplifications Practical experience in contact analysis and material behavior modeling Experience in directly incorporate design changes and fast iteration using CAE/FEA Deep understanding of product (structural) design principles and test design fundamentals Hands on experience in performing structural and material test Agile and adaptive in design/simulation/test Ability to work as part of a team in a fast-paced dynamic environment Desired:  Deep knowledge of Abaqus, Abaqus/CAE, explicit solver and its applications Good understanding of DFM, manufacturing methods like sheet metal forming, machining, injection molding Proficient in CAD like CATIA V6, Solidworks, etc. Hands-on experience for generating representative material model input using test data or analytical methods Hands-on experience of prototyping parts and test equipment, using CNC/lathe/milling machine Thermal/electrical/CFD modeling experiences Compensation at Joby is a combination of base pay and Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). The target base pay for this position is $98,200-$164,600/year. The compensation package will be determined by job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Joby also offers a comprehensive benefits package, including paid time off, healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan with a company match, an employee stock purchase plan (ESPP), short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, and more. EEO:     Joby is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Benefits: ['401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'Disability insurance', 'Employee stock purchase plan', 'Health insurance', 'Life insurance', 'Paid time off']

Description: What you’ll do: Position Overview: Eaton’s Power Connection business has a cooperative employment opportunity for students pursuing a degree in engineering.      The objective of this program is to develop your technical skills in engineering through a practical experience, and assist in your personal development of leadership competencies through training, networking and coaching. During the program you will provide engineering services to support the operations of our dynamic and exciting Eaton Power Connections business through an assignment in one of the following departments, based upon your interest and business need: Test Engineering, Product Engineering, or Manufacturing Engineering.      Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours.     In this co-op program your assignment may include:Supporting Product Engineers in development of new product designsPerforming failure root cause analysis and problem solving within a team to identify and isolate product issues and recommend solutionsDeveloping detailed engineering materials including technical reports to provide product documentationCommunicating plans, status, and results to senior engineers and leadershipCollaborating with suppliers, internal laboratories and test facilities to ensure the successful completion of product development and validation testingWorking in a team environment to identify process improvements, product cost reductions, and reliability improvementsCollecting and analyze manufacturing data and implement process improvements that advance safety, product quality, and operating efficiencies Qualifications: Required (Basic) Qualifications:Actively enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program in engineering at an accredited institutionMust have a combined GPA of 2.5 or higher (please do not round)Legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship on a continual permanent basis.Relocation is not provided for this role, the candidate must be located within 50 miles of Southfield, MI or Carol Stream, IL Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in EngineeringExperience in automotive industry Position Criteria:Actively enrolled in a Bachelor of Engineering from an accredited institution.Engineering knowledge and experience in product development from concept to product launch and product post launch engineering maintenanceDemonstrated problem solving and failure analysis skillsGD&T knowledgeKnowledge of typical C.A.E. software (Creo/Solidworks, MATLAB, MASTA/Romax, etc.)Self-motivated and possessing a drive for resultsWilling and able to work 2-4 years in the co-op program We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law. Eaton considers qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with local laws. To request a disability-related reasonable accommodation to assist you in your job search, application or interview process, please call us at 1-800-836-6345 to discuss your specific need. Only accommodation requests will be accepted by this phone number.

What to Expect The New Programs Engineering team works at the front end of vehicle design and development, working in an iterative environment to study, simulate, build, and prove Tesla’s future vehicle design concepts. This position requires frequent interaction with Design and Vehicle Engineering teams, most closely with our Interior, Exterior, Body-in-White and Closures Systems cross-functional partners. This is a mechanical design engineering position where product design expertise and a fundamental, first principles approach to problem solving are far more important than extensive project engineering or automotive industry specific experience. What You’ll Do Develop closures designs from initial concepts through to design & release of prototype level components and systems that represent future production vehicles. Assessment of mass, cost, manufacturing feasibility, function, etc. Closures Geometric Architecture Development: CATIA parametric design of glass barrel, glass drop, door and glass cut line, seal flanges and seal system, hinge and latch setup, liftgate and hood opening setup Establish system architecture and functional feasibility Support the creation of component specifications, component DFMEA, and other technical design documents Resolve feasibility issues with the Design Studio team Analyze concepts through both simulation and physical prototype builds Ensure product conforms to all market regulations governing assigned systems Support vehicle milestones including prototype, pre-production, and production build events Help deliver world-class craftsmanship, fit/finish and support for successful production launch Innovate, develop, and improve processes continuously What You’ll Bring BS in Mechanical Engineering or related field, or equivalent Minimum of 2 years of relevant industrial design and engineering experience Proficiency in CAD software using parametric elements and knowledge-based engineering tools. Strong understanding of GD&T Ability to interpret CAE results and integrate recommendations into product designs Must be proactive in improving processes and driving projects, examples of this should be provided Excellent communicator, resourceful, and mindful of time management Ability to balance tight deadlines with demanding engineering requirements Ability to establish and maintain a professional working relationship with external and internal teams Experience with automotive closures systems and prototyping of seals and other closures components  Capability to run FEA at part and system level Knowledge of vehicle NVH as it related to closures systems Prior experience with volume production Knowledge of relevant manufacturing processes for production and prototype (elastomers, composites, sheet metal)

We heard you knock!Job Description:Masonite is a leading global designer, manufacturer, marketer and distributor Residential and Commercial doors, high-performance door frames and door system components for the new construction as well as repair, renovation, and remodeling sectors. Since 1925, it has provided its customers with innovative products and superior service at compelling values. As a pioneering door manufacturer catering to both residential and commercial markets, it is embarking on an exciting venture by investing in consumer driven innovation to deliver on its commitment of Doors That Do More™ strategy that addresses human needs for comfort, security, style, and convenience.Product Engineering function within Masonite Innovation Center tackles complex, global product and manufacturing challenges. This position presents a unique opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing team within an industry-leading innovative company and seeks candidates who thrive in a dynamic, start-up-like environment – Inspiring/guiding multidisciplinary team, driving innovation and efficiency in product development process.As Product Engineer reporting to Engineering Manager of Product Engineering, this role envisages product design and engineering of new products, driving front-end innovation and enhancing Operational Excellence – Leveraging material selection, construction design/engineering and manufacturing process assessment along with costing, product performance, and codes and compliance requirements, to drive new products and/or refine existing designs including enhancing manufacturing process/optimization.Responsibilities:Responsible for delivering on strategic business initiatives viz., Innovation, Growth, Sustaining/Operational Excellence across Interior/Exterior Doors, Door-Systems and Components including Value-capture via IP, Technical reports, EMS documentation.Act as Project Leader to manage all aspects of the product development lifecycle from ideation to detailed design, specification, analysis, and verification – Product design and engineering, material selection, product performance testing/modeling, manufacturing process assessment, prototyping, VA/VE initiatives as well as competitive assessment.Provide technical assistance, develop engineering proposals/project charters and Installation guidelines; Craft Engineering Documentation - Specifications, drawings, test reports; Manage all tasks leading up to publications /IssuanceSupport Front-End Innovation and accelerate new product development leveraging innovative mindset, technical rigor, scientific methodology along with a solid understanding of emerging/innovative technologiesLead new concept/idea generation via prototyping, rendering, and/or modeling accounting for UX, Design Engineering Best Practices, Material selection, Construction, Product performance, Cost, New/Existing Process capabilities, Installation and Codes/Compliance requirements.Build strong relationships and collaboration with teammates and Functional counterparts to create environment that encourages innovative thinking and continuous improvement.Partner with contract manufacturers, universities, test labs, and/or engineering firms to drive product innovation and scale-up, ensuring timelines, budgets, and quality standards are met.Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders to keep them informed of progress and manage expectations – Plan, monitor, and control projects to ensure they are completed on time, within budget, and meet high-quality standards.Support Operations via Cost Reduction and Business Continuity, Quality and Process Controls (COQ/PFMEA), Value-Stream Mapping, Ensuring compliance of Product Performance attributes specs.Adopt Safety culture and Implement Site-Safety initiatives.Minimum Qualifications and Experience Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Material Sci. and/or Industrial or a related field). Advanced degrees (Master's, PhD) are highly desirable.3+ years relevant work experience in Product Development/Engineering, Technology Leadership including managing large cross-functional projects/programs.Demonstrated contributions to the development and engineering of innovative products that deliver significant business growth via Product Launches/IP etc.Solid hands-on Experience in Prototyping and Specialized Application Development Testing, Installation and Reliability Testing, Benchmarking / Reverse EngineeringFamiliarity with the Internet of Things (IoT) landscape and experience in developing IoT-integrated products would be advantageous. Knowledge/experience of electro-mechanical systems a plusProven success in product design and engineering with wood, composites, metals, plastics, fiberglass, coatings, adhesives, sealants and elastomers including their failure modes/design limits.Competent in engineering a product from scratch using sound engineering principles and best practices, taking appropriate material selections and construction designs into consideration.Good knowledge of CAD/CAE tools for product design and engineering (e.g., AutoCAD, Autodesk Inventor, Solidworks, CAE – Thermal/Structural, Matlab, geometric tolerancing etc.)Good understanding of relevant manufacturing processes, i.e., injection molding, SMC molding, extrusion, foam injection, lamination/ assembly processes of (wood-composite products)Knowledge of Lean Sigma tools for identification of root causes and proposed solutions within the realm of product engineering aspects – DFMEA/ PFMEA, Lean/ Six Sigma FundamentalsStrong project leadership, initiative/drive, problem-solving, and communication skills including ability to mentor junior engineers/Interns.Demonstrable ability to solve complex engineering problems, manage risks, and make effective decisions under pressure.Our BenefitsMedical Plans (HSA Basic, HSA Plus or PPO)Dental, Vision, Life, AD&D InsuranceShort + Long-Term Disability InsurancePaid Parental Leave and Adoption BenefitsEmployee Assistance Program (EAP/Wellness)Paid Holidays401(k) with Company MatchEducational Assistance ProgramVacation TimeAdvancement Opportunities - we promote from within the companyReferral bonusCompany Stock Purchase ProgramThis is a full-time position requiring weekday (Monday - Friday) work onsite at our Innovation Centers (either W. Chicago, IL or Colfax, NC), with limited flexibility to work from home. This position may require up to 10% domestic travel.We Help People Walk Through WallsWe respect the privacy of candidates for employment. Our Masonite Applicant Privacy Policysets forth in more detail our privacy practices, including, without limitation, our collection and usage practices, of your personal information when you apply for a position with a Masonite entity.Job Type: Full-time

Position: Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer - Seat Complete
Description: About Rivian:     Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.  Role Summary:     You will be responsible for the design and development of Complete Seats Systems for the most adventurous vehicles on the planet! You will also deliver break-through technology and capability in our products.  Responsibilities:  Be an integral member a technical team of product engineers to deliver Complete Seats for all Rivian programs Develop and implement the latest technologies in materials, processes and design execution Utilize CAE toolsets to define/optimize and verify product designs prior to physical prototype. Validate seating systems through the creation and testing of the DVP&R, DFMEA, GD&T, Functional Safety, statement of requirements (SOR) and component technical specifications (CTS) Support Purchasing in creating nomination plans, RASIC, deliverables, and service agreements for suppliers of seating systems & components and then manage suppliers from nomination to PPAP and through SOP Conduct supplier meetings to ensure product design integrity and conformance to the statement of the requirements and all technical requirements, responsible for design releases/signoff Provide technical expertise for seating systems when working in cross functional teams of body, studio, restraints, LVE, and packaging Coordinate design work to deliver timely releases that meet all design for manufacturing inputs from the supply base & manufacturing team. Develop and manage system, subsystem, and component information through the Enovia PLM to Catia V6 environment Have the opportunity to develop personally to become a leader professionally Qualifications:  Bachelors of Science in an engineering discipline (Masters degree is a plus) 5+ years of first hand experience developing, validating, and launching into production seating systems High proficiency with standard 3D CAD software, preferably CATIA V5 and/or V6 Strong understanding of the first-principle physics & requirements of seat systems – the loads, forces, and overall function of the systems System approach to design and development with the desire and curiosity to strive for continuous improvement Excellent understanding of GD&T standards Understanding of FE analysis technique to drive design and its optimization is essential Ability to conduct & drive the DFMEA process Eagerness to work cross-functionally in a dynamic environment where you are part of a team Pay Disclosure:     Salary Range for California-Based Applicants: $121,000 - $139,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, and other factors permitted by law).  Benefits Summary: Rivian provides robust medical/Rx, dental and vision insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Rivian covers most of the premium  Company Statements:  Equal Opportunity   Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.  Candidate Data Privacy   Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.  Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.  Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions.  Please note that we are currently not accepting applications from third party application services.

Description: Quest Defense is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the world’s fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are part of a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility.We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers.As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then we’re eager to hear from you.The achievers, high performers, and courageous challenge-crushers we seek, have the following characteristics and skills:Are you an experienced Mechanical Design Engineer looking for a new challenge and an opportunity to further advance your skills and career in a great working environment? Join our fast-growing team supporting leading Aerospace companies! If you are a highly motivated individual, a self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit and a genuine interest in technology, we have the perfect job for you!The RoleThe successful candidate will draw upon their experience to aid in the design and analysis of gas turbine engine components. Collaboration and a forward thinking approach are important to ensure we remain the supplier of choice for our customers. You will also be the face of QuEST to your customers. Through listening to customer challenges, and building on your previous experiences, you will find creative approaches that will solve their most difficult engineering problems.Roles & Responsibilities:Develop and/or modify designs related to Aero-engine components by analyzing product specifications, performance requirements, and existing manufacturing capabilitiesExecute mechanical design projects of gas turbine components on Structures/Rotating parts (Frames, Shaft, Disk, Blisk, seals etc.) and/or Airfoils (Blade, Vanes, Nozzles etc.)Evaluate concepts of new designs/improvements, manufacturing methods, materials or processes and complete required documentation by applying engineering principles and Industry standards, and generating reports, procedures or change proposalsCapture design & system requirements from the customer, and incorporate into the component designSupport technical substantiation, contribute & present in technical and program reviewsDevelop components and modules keeping cost, performance, life, and system requirements in mindDesign and Analysis of the component using CAE tools (NX, ANSYS Classic, ANSYS workbench)Direct interface with other internal/external engineering functionsApply technical principles, theories, and concepts to solve a wide range of challenging engineering problemsEvaluate form, fit, function and life of the components relative to the certified configurationEvaluate non-conformances by reviewing, analyzing design criteria’s and acceptability limits, recommend disposition procedures and maximizing producibilityRequired Skills (Technical Competency):We’re excited to talk to you if your qualifications meet the following criteria:3-6 years of experience in the mechanical design of Gas-turbine or Turbo-machinery componentsMinimum BS/B.Tech in Mechanical or Aerospace engineering from an accredited universityExperience with NX and ANSYS (Classic or workbench) or other similar toolsAbility to easily interpret technical drawings with understanding of GD&TDemonstrated ability to meet deadlines, work under time constraints, maintain composure and handle multiple tasks simultaneouslyAbility to interact with employees/managers at all levels with strong oral and written communication skillsProject Management experience is desired, but not requiredStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environmentLike to work in a fast paced, creative environmentEnjoy people and dynamic teams with diverse experiences. We have fun together!US Citizen or Permanent Resident requiredJob Type: Full-timePay: $65,000.00 - $75,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceExperience level:1 yearSchedule:8 hour shiftWork Location: In person

Description: Company Generac Power Systems  Name Senior Mechanical Engineer VA/VE  Req # 63444  Employment Type Full Time  Shift 1st  At Generac, our people help make the world safer, brighter and more productive. We are united by our efforts to inspire change for a better world; impact our people and community; influence and achieve positive results; and innovate the industry. Our shared goals allow people with diverse backgrounds and points of view to work together, bringing our global customers peace of mind through reliable products and exceptional support. The Senior Mechanical Engineer , located in Waukesha, WI, is responsible for providing engineering input to the product development projects assigned to him/her including interfacing with the cross-functional team consisting of Engineering, Operations (Industrial Engineering, Production, and Material Procurement), Sourcing, Quality, Service and Marketing. This position reports to the Senior Manager Engineering - Value Added Value Engineering. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Designs, validates and brings new products to market. Specify precise new product functional requirements; designs, tests, and integrates a variety of moderately complex components to produce final designs; and evaluates the design's overall effectiveness, cost (including cost/benefit analysis), reliability (risk analysis), and safety. Designs, develops, executes and evaluates fitness-for-use testing, product specifications, and process validation plans for a variety of moderately complex products and/or components; creates and reviews material part specifications and bills of materials. Collaborates with internal manufacturing partners, contract manufacturers, designers and product specialists to optimize moderately complex designs for manufacturability. Utilizes CAD (Computer Aided Desig) or CAE (Computer Aided Engineering) systems to model new designs and produce detailed engineering drawings. Supports product development plans (schedule, product cost, meeting design inputs). Acts as resource to mentor and teach less experienced engineers. Travel to other Generac facilities as necessary. Other duties as assigned. Minimal Qualifications: Bachelor of Science Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering or related discipline. 5+ years of relevant work experience. Preferred Qualifications: Ability to perform detail-oriented work with a high degree of accuracy on multiple projects. Design experience with a variety of materials (i.e. plastics, aluminum castings, sheet metal) and basic knowledge of material specs and use. Experience in new product design and development. Ability to conduct analysis using FEA, CFD, etc. Demonstrated written communication and presentation skills. Ability to translate technical information to all audiences. Applies engineering knowledge and experience to improve products, services and processes. Technical skills to include 3D modeling (Creo or SolidWorks). MS Excel, MS Word. Experience with machine design. Previous experience with SAP or equivalent ERP. Level of Independence: Works independently. Receives minimal technical guidance. Requires in-depth knowledge and experience. Uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products or services. Strong conceptualization, visualization and creativity. Strong time management, prioritization and analytical problem solving. Developing business acumen. Solves complex problems. Takes a new perspective using existing solutions. Strong decision-making skills. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Has participated in cross-functional project teams and leads some aspects of the project. ' Ensures success cross-functionally. Offer recommendations and implement solutions. Takes ownership of designs. Thorough understanding of the Engineering financial impact and a basic understanding of the needs and impact of other functions on the business. Physical demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision and ability to adjust focus. Occasional travel  “We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.”

Job Information The Simulation Engineer will virtually evaluate designs of Company components, systems, and products to predict design performance using the latest in engineering simulation tools. Additionally, this role will require you to provide simulation result interpretation and communication and make recommendations for design improvement.Location(s): Bismarck, ND; Gwinner, ND; Johnson Creek, WI Role & Responsibility Virtually evaluate design performanceCreate, modify, analyze, and maintain the engineering simulation models of assigned projects. Influence engineering decision-making by providing reliable fluid, structural, or other analysis insights.Recommend and evaluate design solutions that improve cost, manufacturability, quality, and performance.Execute product verification plan by implementing current CFD, FEA or other simulation best practices.Use problem solving skills as well as internal and external resources to troubleshoot simulation models Additional ResponsibilitiesDefine and guide tests to verify simulation solutions.Correlate simulation results with test data and make refinements as necessary.Develop CAE(Computer Aided Engineering) skills and knowledge of company systems.Work concurrently with several design and test teams across multiple product groups and sites.Communicate simulation status and results to the supervisor, design teams, and management.Collaborate with design teams to define component/system requirements and develop innovative design solutions to meet those requirements.May supervise and assist in the training and development of co-ops and student development interns.Job RequirementStrong applied mechanical and engineering skills and a willingness to use them.Experience with engineering simulation software preferred.Experience with test and validation methods preferred.Understanding of the theory and design of Company productsExcellent written and verbal communication skills.Ability to work in a team environment.Competency with MS Office Suite. Advanced computer skills.Engineering-Agriculture - Bachelors DegreeEngineering-General - Bachelors DegreeEngineering-Mechanical - Bachelors Degree0 - 2+ years experience<10% travelAs a part of the Doosan Group, which employs more than 43,000 people in 38 countries worldwide, the company offers its customers products and solutions to help build stronger businesses and communities. Based in Seoul, South Korea, with its North America headquarters in West Fargo, North Dakota, Doosan Bobcat is a leading global manufacturer of construction, agriculture, landscaping and grounds maintenance equipment, attachments and services. The company is committed to empowering people to accomplish more.  Doosan Bobcat North America is home to world-renowned brands, including Bobcat® compact equipment, Doosan® portable power products, Ryan® and Steiner® grounds maintenance equipment and Geith® attachments. Doosan Bobcat North America is a tradename of Clark Equipment Company.  Doosan is committed fostering an inclusive and a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, age, race, color, religion, creed, citizenship status, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other status or characteristic protected by law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at 701-476-4263. Doosan is a VEVRAA federal contractor and seeks priority referrals of protected veterans.  Beware of Fraudulent Job Offers and Solicitations  Any legitimate job offer will be preceded by an official selection process.

Transforming the Future with Convergence of Simulation and Data CAE NVH engineer Job Summary:    Our client in Troy, MI is looking for a CAE NVH engineer. This is a Contract positions.   3-5 year’s experience in Automotive NVH Deep understanding of isolation, damping, stiffness and mass impact on vibration Expert in Normal Mode (BIW, Trimmed-body), Input Point Innertane, Mode Map , VTF and NTF.  Expert applied skill in NVH Director, Hyperworks, Optistruct and Nastran. Excellent root cause and problem-solving skills in automotive NVH. Understanding of vibrations analysis and the use of vibration transfer functions (VTF) Experience with body and chassis automotive components and vehicle systems Prior expertise in using CAE tools to identify and resolve vehicle NVH issues. Well-versed in acoustic analysis and understanding of road noise contributions. Job Responsibilities: Setup, run and evaluate NVH simulations at a subsystem, trimmed body and full vehicle level.  Evaluate NVH requirements using latest CAE methods & tools. Setup and evaluate the Mode Map of the Full Vehicle. Setup and evaluate different loading FRF’s. Develop process improvements to enable faster, enhanced, more robust analysis to be performed. Description: Job Brief This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home.Crane Aerospace & Electronics is seeking a Test Engineer III in Burbank, CA. Position: Test Engineer III Performs major Qualification Engineering activities. Interacts with other engineering groups to define, document, analyze, perform, and interpret tests for products, systems and components. Identifies functional problems, troubleshoots and suggests resolutions. Analyzes test cases and provides regular progress reports. This position is eligible for our Crane Flex Hybrid schedule which allows for the option of up to 2 days/week of work-from-home. Some conditions apply which will be discussed during the interview process. Full policy to be provided after hire. Essential Functions: Write test plans, procedures and reports for testing based on standards such as MIL-STD-810, and RTCA-DO-160. Collaborate with customers and engineers to establish/clarify qualification test levels.  Participate in the estimation of costs and schedules to develop or upgrade test platforms. Work independently under minimal supervision and guidance to perform tasks of substantial complexity and to be capable of leading and coordinating the efforts of junior engineers and technicians. Design, fabrication, standardization and documentation of Mechanical and Vibration Test Fixtures. Minimum Qualifications: Minimum BS degree in Mechanical Engineering or other related Science/Engineering field. Minimum of 5 years working experience with developing and testing hydraulic or mechanical assemblies in an engineering environment. Good verbal and written communication skills. Familiar with desktop computer applications such as Microsoft EXCEL, WORD, Outlook e-mail, and Internet Explorer applications. Ability to logically solve problems, organize materials, and keep projects moving in an orderly and structured fashion. Ability to work well with others in the areas of teamwork and communication. Expert in troubleshooting hardware failures related to qualification environments Familiar with planning, executing, and reporting on environmental testing (e.g. altitude, humidity, temperature, vibration, etc.) testing in accordance with MIL-STD-810 and RTCA/DO-160 test standards.Eligibility Requirement: This position may require access to Controlled Data or Information. Where the position requires such access only US persons will be considered. As a US Department of Defense contractor, we are bound by International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). Preferred Qualifications: Experience using SolidWorks for test fixture design. Experience with hydraulics (safety, testing, bending and flaring tubing, fluid cleanliness) About Crane: Crane Aerospace & Electronics supplies critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. You will find Crane Aerospace & Electronics in some of the toughest environments: from engines to landing gear; from satellites to medical implants and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems (UAS). We are committed to operational excellence and world-class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniques to optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value. Salary range: $112,611 to $128,918. Several factors contribute to actual salary, including experience in a similar role or performing comparable job responsibilities, skills, training, and other qualifications. Compensation packages also include comprehensive benefits, 401K contribution and match, Paid Time Off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement and more. Some roles may be eligible for participation in performance-based bonus programs. You can see a list of our benefits at https://www.craneae.com/company/careers or visit our website at www.CraneAE.com for more information on our company and great opportunitiesIn our efforts to maintain a safe and drug-free workplace, Crane Aerospace & Electronics requires that candidates complete a satisfactory background check. FAA sensitive positions require employees to participate in a random drug test pool. This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work being performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Crane Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, genetic information, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law. #LI-NT1 #CAE

Description: The Manufacturing Engineer evaluates the safety, quality and efficiency of current manufacturing processes, raw materials, vended parts, and part and system designs. Participates in the identification of alternate materials, parts, and processes that improve product quality, reliability, manufacturing efficiency, and cost. Compensation Data: Competitive salary based upon experience. Incentive Bonus eligible. Location: Newbury, OH. This position is 100% onsite, M-F, 8-5. Travel: None Key Responsibilities: Evaluates and recommends changes to current product designs to increase product reliability and manufacturability, and to reduce costs. Evaluates and recommends raw materials for manufacturing to increase product reliability and reduce costs. Evaluates and recommends changes to the production processes to increase efficiency, reduce costs and ensure safety. Identifies opportunities for automation within the manufacturing process. Serves as project lead for the implementation of automated equipment including hardware testing and software programming. Develops tools and machines and designs new automation equipment or processes to increase productivity and efficiency in all manufacturing areas. Defines and implements design and process validation plans, performs process failure mode effect analysis, and prepares control plans for manufactured and vended products. Writes Engineering Changes and deviations to document changes to form, fit or function of production parts or manufacturing processes. Coordinates with the Product and Manufacturing process specialists on potential material, part and system changes. Collaborates with product development teams on new product design and field testing. Evaluates returned goods for manufacturing defects, non-conformances, and product issues. Performs dimensional and functional review of manufactured and purchased parts. What you will need to succeed: Education & Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in manufacturing and industrial engineering with 5 -8 years of manufacturing process or manufacturing production experience. Lean Six Sigma Training – Preferred Green Belt level, Black Belt a plus. Competencies: Experience with Statistical Process Control (SPC). Experience using CAD and/or CAE Software. Experience with specifying, supporting and troubleshooting automation equipment and ancillary components. Experience with plastic injection molding a plus. Experience with plastic part design a plus. Good analytical and problem-solving skills. Good computer skills including word processing and spreadsheet proficiency. Good interpersonal/customer relation skills. Why Join Kinetico: Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Insurance Coverage Employer Provided Life Insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Benefits 401(k) Contribution Matching Program Employer Funded Defined Contribution Plan Paid Vacation, Holidays and Community Service Volunteer Time-off Benefit Wellness Program Educational Assistance Reimbursement Program Work-life Balance Advancement Opportunities Our Commitment and Difference: Founded in 1970, Kinetico pioneered the development of non-electric, fully automatic water treatment systems. In the years since, we have grown into a global company of independent Kinetico water experts and international distributors serving more than 100 countries. We offer complete water systems that deliver only the highest quality water for general use and drinking. We back every piece of our equipment with industry-leading warranties. Our approach reflects our deep commitment to preserving and conserving fresh water, one of our planet's most precious and endangered natural resources. Kinetico Incorporated is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, veteran status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status or disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act*), or any other legally protected status, with respect to employment opportunities. E-Verify: We verify the identity and employment authorization of individuals hired for employment in the United States.

Description: We are the movers of the world and the makers of the future. We get up every day, roll up our sleeves and build a better world - together. At Ford, we’re all a part of something bigger than ourselves. What will you make today?  The Ford Global Electrified Powertrain Team is a growing team committed to envisioning and creating simple, thoughtful, enjoyable, and compelling product experiences for our customers. As a team player, you will work on the cutting-edge technologies of EV and create impact by collaborating across the EV organization. eDrive Power Electronics Engineer will be responsible for the hardware development of traction inverter system, specifically focusing on inverter system design, analysis, and validation.You'll have... M.S. in Electrical Engineering with specialty in power electronics 3+ years of experience on power electronics system design and analysis. Proficiency in circuit and multi-physics FEA simulation tools (e.g. Matlab, PSIM, Saber, Spice, ANSYS, etc.) 3+ years of hands-on experience on power electronics hardware testing and troubleshooting. Proficiency in test equipment (e.g. oscilloscope, power analyzer, function generator, etc.)  Even better, you may have...  Ph.D. in Power Electronics or related field 5+ years of experience on power electronics system design and CAE analysis 5+ years of hands-on experience on power electronics hardware testing and troubleshooting Knowledge and experience on wide band gap devices (SiC and/or GaN) based converter is a plus Knowledge and experience on traction inverter design and validation in EV is another plus Excellent teamwork and communication skills Self-motivated with the ability to learn and manage multiple tasks You may not check every box, or your experience may look a little different from what we've outlined, but if you think you can bring value to Ford Motor Company, we encourage you to apply! As an established global company, we offer the benefit of choice. You can choose what your Ford future will look like: will your story span the globe, or keep you close to home? Will your career be a deep dive into what you love, or a series of new teams and new skills? Will you be a leader, a changemaker, a technical expert, a culture builder…or all of the above? No matter what you choose, we offer a work life that works for you, including: Immediate medical, dental, and prescription drug coverage Flexible family care, parental leave, new parent ramp-up programs, subsidized back-up child care and more Vehicle discount program for employees and family members, and management leases Tuition assistance Established and active employee resource groups Paid time off for individual and team community service A generous schedule of paid holidays, including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day Paid time off and the option to purchase additional vacation time. For a detailed look at our benefits, click here: https://clicktime.symantec.com/15uBY3m9Cf9aaHULb7Wkk?h=xlIIBBZlduvsYB7YLuO7n5CoHIjAgyMUQgB7M6NWgHU=&u=https://fordcareers.co/GSR-HTHD Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status. In the United States, if you need a reasonable accommodation for the online application process due to a disability, please call 1-888-336-0660.What you'll do… Conduct inverter hardware design for eDrive system, including simulation analysis and experimental investigation. Develop inverter functional and design verification method and procedure. Coordinate and conduct hardware testing and troubleshooting in the lab to verify and validate inverter design functionality and reliability. Ensure overall quality of inverter system throughout the design and verification process. Support root cause analysis for the field issues. Investigate the cutting-edge power electronics technologies and their applications for traction inverter of EV. Support inverter and eDrive benchmark activities.

Description: I STANLEY COMPANY, INCSALARIED POSITION DESCRIPTIONTITLE: Electronics Engineer II PLANT / SECTION: Design Department   ____________________________________________________________ BASIC FUNCTION:  Under the direction of the Design Section Manager and Design Program Leader, design electronics systems for automotive lighting projects. The key responsibilities include developing high quality and cost effective electronic products for the OEM automotive field that are government compliant and achieve customer satisfaction.   ________________________________________________________________ KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:Execute the design and development of electronic products (HW & SW) from initial concept to production by utilizing CAD and CAE resources.Ensure compliance to customer and regulation requirements through robust product design.Conduct and oversee design validation testing for prototypes and production hardware.Identify, investigate, and resolve design concerns/issues as early as possible in the development process.Investigate and integrate new technologies into product design.Provide electronics related guidance and technical advice to design, engineering, and sales for new product development and production programs.Create electronic diagrams and circuits using CAD software for product design output.Execute delivery of technical information to the Customer, other company depts., and within the Design Department.Identify and negotiate solutions to technical issues with the Customer and other company departments, and within the Design Department.Ensure compliance to quality management system requirements.Support Planning and Execution of Automotive Lighting projectsEDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:  A four year degree or B.S., in Electrical Engineering with 4-6 years of experience in a position involving automotive electronics development. OR  A Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or a related discipline with 2-4 years of experience in automotive electronics development. PREFFERED QUALIFICATIONS:  Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering with 3 years’ experience in the automotive electronics development, including experience with layout design & worst case analysis strategies. REQUIRED SKILLS:Knowledge in electronics circuit design (hardware design and layout) for automotive lighting.Knowledge of testing methods and government requirements for automotive designs.Knowledge of manufacturing capabilities for automotive lighting and electronics.Data Analysis and problem solving skills.Organizational and planning skills.Computer skills using standard business software (including MS Office programs).Computer skills using Math CAD, OrCAD or PSpice.Candidates must have good written and verbal communication, along with good presentation skills.Interpersonal skills – Able to speak confidently to individuals at all levels of authority.Willing to travel: customer on-site location, out of town, overseasOPTIONAL SKILLS:Knowledge in DFMEA CreationREPORTING RELATIONSHIPS:  Above: Design Section Manager   Below: None Physical Requirements and Work Environment:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this position, the associate is required to sit for extended periods, the position is frequently required to stand, use hands and fingers to handle or feel. The position must occasionally lift up to 10 pounds and have specific vision abilities related to close and color vision. While performing this job the position is often exposed to moving or mechanical parts and moderate noise levels found in a factory environment. Position is required to travel, occasionally overnight, to perform essential functions. Position is often required to work overtime on little or no notice.

Why engineering at Stryker? At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development. Need another reason to apply? Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team: https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com Stryker is seeking to hire a Staff Mechanical Engineer, R&D to support Stryker’s Instruments Division. This is a hybrid role, working 2-3 days per week in the office and you will be located Portage, MI. WHO WE WANT Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues. Dedicated achievers. Relentless about quality, people who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure a project is complete and meets regulations and expectations. Curious learners. People who seek out cutting-edge research and information to expand and enhance their ability to be ready for what’s next. Leaders. People who are passionate about seeing those around them succeed and are able to provide constructive feedback and mentorship that drives the positive, excited, and driven team culture. WHAT YOU WILL DO As the Staff Mechanical Engineer, you will work with R&D, Quality, Manufacturing, Regulatory, Clinical, Marketing and Project Management to ensure project success. With minimal supervision you will develop, modify, evaluate and verify mechanical components for medical devices. This is a unique opportunity to learn all areas of Stryker and to work with a variety of products. The project timeline is fast paced and this person will work to solve problems and create efficiencies within the OEM/CM product lines. Technical Responsibilities: Under minimal supervision, design, develop, modify, and verify mechanical components for medical devices. Develop prototyping and bench testing. Perform fundamental and advanced problem solving, root cause analysis, identify potential solutions, and evaluate them against requirements. Independently create or refine engineering documentation, such as the Design History file. Follow R&D procedure like design controls and risk management, per the Quality Management System. Engineering Competencies: Fundamental knowledge and understanding of mechanical engineering practices and tools, design principles within a regulated environment. Technical ability to create engineering drawings and models, applying GD&T and CAE tools. Demonstrated ability to apply knowledge of materials and manufacturing processes to product design. Ability to Communicate basic plans and technical information to team members. Strong knowledge of analysis tools and statistical methods. Med Device Compliance: Follow fundamental industry standards, design requirements and test strategies which apply to regulatory requirements. Independently create or refine engineering documentation, such as the Design History file. Follow R&D procedure like design controls and risk management, per the Quality Management System. Strong understanding of GD&T standards and application. Knowledge in Creo for designing and evaluating designs through CAE. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 130 million patients annually. More information is available at stryker.com.  Know someone at Stryker? Description: Description       The University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) Engineering and Technology Development (EITD) department https://www.uab.edu/engineering/eitd/ is seeking a Project Engineer to join our team. This position will provide the opportunity to work as part of a multi-discipline engineering team that specializes in the development of cold stowage systems for use in microgravity and space exploration. The systems developed by our team provide researchers with a means of preserving experiments in a thermally controlled environment onboard the International Space Station, as well as onboard launch and landing vehicles.      Duties and Responsibilities:       Primary responsibilities will include developing viable mechanical or electrical systems and component designs based on project requirements and specifications. Produces and supervises the associated engineering drawings and schematics for use in the fabrication and assembly of complex engineering hardware and devices. Reviews and checks engineering drawings produced by others for adherence to technical specifications and requirements. Works with CAE (Computer-Aided Engineering) (SolidEdge and/or ProE) Mechanical design software or OrCAD electrical design software. Demonstrates design experience with high-reliability instruments and works closely with engineers of other disciplines to develop systems.              Other responsibilities will include general support for the multi-disciplinary engineering team, in areas such as reviewing and checking engineering drawings produced by others for adherence to technical specifications and requirements.             Supervises/mentors less experienced engineers and student employees on projects.             Perform other duties as assigned.      ($77,640 - $126,170)  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering and six (6) years of related experience required. Work experience may NOT substitute for education requirement. STEM related degree preferred and U.S. Citizenship is required.  Primary Location: University     Job Category: Professional & Managerial     Organization: 440002000 Engineering & Innovative Tech Develop     Employee Status: Regular     Shift: Day/1st Shift     Work Arrangement (final schedule to be determined by the department/hiring manager): Onsite

Position: Aeronautical Engineer (Computational Fluid Dynamics) OR Principal Aeronautical Engineer (Computational Fluid Dynamics)
Description: Requisition ID: R10128054 Category: Engineering Location: Clearfield, Utah, United States of America Citizenship required: United States Citizenship Clearance Type: Secret Telecommute: No- Teleworking not available for this position Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America) Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Assistance: Relocation assistance may be available Positions Available: 1   At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.  Northrop Grumman Aeronautics Systems has an opening for an Aeronautical Engineer OR Principal Aeronautical Engineer to join our Design and Analysis team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in Clearfield, UT. Our Design and Analysis team works with experienced engineers, supporting sophisticated analysis of composite aerospace structures and processes. We engineer the latest composite structures for military/commercial aircraft and launch structures and are leaders in next-generation structure development. Would you like to work on the cutting edge of aerospace? Come join our team! Responsibilities: Primary focus of position is working in the Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD)/Thermal Analysis team performing analysis on aerospace vehicle external protection material systems for multiple environments.     Aeroheating analysis for flight applications Aeroheating analysis for test configuration applications Position also includes working with the team of experienced engineers to apply heat transfer and fluid dynamic analysis skills to composite cure applications Support will also include, but is not limited to, performing thermal surveys of part equipment/tooling, developing fluid flow models, thermal analysis support for preliminary and critical design phases, and preparing presentations     Survey support includes working with thermal and fluid specific instrumentation such as thermocouples, hot wire anemometers, etc. Performing data reduction and interpretation of measurements Additional support may include performing simulations of thermal standardization efforts for composite manufactured parts and conducting flow tests to support equipment such as autoclaves and ovens Characterization of material thermal properties: Test planning, test support, and data reduction Supporting Research & Development, Testing, and Manufacturing groups during the development process Our team enjoys a significantly diverse range of assignments and collaborates with many Northrop Grumman teams to provide innovative solutions to complex and exciting problems. We are part of the analysis engineering organization, and work closely with the composites technology development organization, research & development engineers, engineering technicians, structure design and analysis engineers, and process engineers to provide state-of-the-art solutions to the most engaging problems. We are currently supporting both unclassified and classified programs. We work a 9/80 work week, which gives us every other Friday off to pursue passions outside the office. Travel is up to 10%, all within the continental US and typically involves a 2-3 day trip once per year. Northrop Grumman offers a full suite of benefits to our employees. We are regularly voted among the top companies for work life balance. Our Clearfield location is surrounded by the beautiful Wasatch Mountains which provide numerous opportunities for outdoor recreation. Do you enjoy skiing, hiking, or biking? Picture yourself in Utah! This position may be filled at either the Aeronautical Engineer OR Principal Aeronautical Engineer level, depending upon the qualifications below. Basic Qualifications for Aeronautical Engineer: Bachelor’s of Science in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) field and 2 years of applicable engineering experience OR a Master’s Degree in a STEM field with 0 years of experience. Knowledge of or industry experience with heat transfer analysis Knowledge of or experience with fluid flow analysis and Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) software Ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret Clearance. This clearance must be obtained within a reasonable amount of time as determined by the company to meet its business needs. Ability to obtain and maintain Special Program Access (SAP). This SAP must be obtained within a reasonable amount of time as determined by the company to meet its business needs. Basic Qualifications for Principal Aeronautical Engineer: Bachelor’s of Science in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) field and 5 years of applicable engineering experience; OR a Master’s Degree in a STEM field with 3 years of applicable engineering experience; OR a PhD in a STEM field with 0 years of applicable experience. Experience with heat transfer analysis Experience with fluid flow analysis and Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) software Ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret Clearance. This clearance must be obtained within a reasonable amount of time as determined by the company to meet its business needs. Ability to obtain and maintain Special Program Access (SAP). This SAP must be obtained within a reasonable amount of time as determined by the company to meet its business needs. Preferred Qualifications for both levels: Current DoD Secret Security Clearance Experience with any of the following software packages: ANSYS Fluent, Thermal Desktop, STAR-CCM+, Siemens NX, MATLAB, Abaqus CAE, Python scripting Composite thermal/structural Finite Element Analysis (FEA) experience Basic or intermediate skills using CAD software packages Knowledge of composite materials Experience supporting engineering testing and characterization of material mechanical and/or thermal properties: Test planning, test support, and data reduction What We Offer: At Northrop Grumman, we are on the cutting edge of innovation- building the next generation of sophisticated aircraft to protect our country. Our diverse portfolio of programs means there are endless paths to cultivate your career. We are well-known for our inclusive, family environment, phenomenal learning opportunities, and exposure to a wide variety of projects and customers. We also offer exceptional benefits/healthcare, a great 401K matching program, and 14 Employee Resource Groups inclusive of all employees! Salary Range: $73,400 - $110,000   Salary Range 2: $90,400 - $135,600     Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.  Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Wood-Mizer provides forestry and timber professionals around the world with a complete line of narrowband portable and industrial sawmills, wideband sawmilling equipment, resaws, edgers, kilns, molders/planers, firewood processing equipment, pallet recycling equipment, material handling equipment, bandsaw blades, and blade maintenance equipment.Our Culture and Values:Wood-Mizer is dedicated to customer and employee-owner success, putting compassion and faith at the heart of the business, and committing to providing high-quality equipment that makes a positive difference in people's lives. Wood-Mizer is a 100% employee-owned company that believes every mill owner is an extension of our Wood-Mizer family - a philosophy that makes both our customers and employee-owners feel at ease.What Makes Wood-Mizer Stand-Out:Wood-Mizer believes that investing in people is an investment in the future. Each year, they are also given money to spend on Wood-Mizer apparel and swag.Other Rewards: Companywide celebrations, company outings, complimentary coffee stations and fruit, gift cards for your birthday and anniversary, referral reward program, discounted shipping rate, and much more!For more details about what Wood-Mizer has to offer, please visit our career’s page at: https://woodmizer.com/us/About-Us/Careers*Summary of the Role You Are Applying For:*As a Design Engineer, you will help Wood-Mizer design, develop, or redesign new or existing products.
