Location: Irvine, CA 92618 (Irvine Health and Science Complex area)
Description: About Rivian:     Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.  Responsibilities:  Candidate will be responsible for project management and engineering deliverables for development of aluminum and steel wheels, and wheel accessories (wheel covers, caps, fasteners) Design and implement wheel component and systems, integrating with chassis component systems from concept into serial production. Capture vehicle level wheel related requirements & attributes, and deliver against those targets. Seek solutions to technical challenges & problem solve issues arising during the wheel development & in serial production (with tire and assembly) Ensure wheel component and subsystems meet all markets into which Rivian vehicles will be offered. Deliver wheel programs according to Rivian standards and guidelines. Utilize knowledge and experience gained from working within wheel development in conjunction with lean principles to enhance the wheel offering for future vehicles at Rivian. Operate as a standalone role and responsible for owning program specific wheel chassis deliverables (engaging with Lead & Senior Lead Chassis & Vehicle Dynamics Engineers) Create and develop engineering specification packages that effectively communicate to internal and external partners to ensure products meet given project parameters Understand, interpret and ensure tire related local, regional and international homologation requirements are met. Maintain and manage wheel component and vehicle level sub system design verification requirements & testing. Complete and release wheel and/or tire wheel assembly documentation, including 2D drawings Manage designed parts in the virtual environment and support virtual build and release activities Develop collaborative relationships with wheel suppliers & wheel/tire assemblers, and manage them to deliver projects on time and to specification Supporting initial wheel 2D & 3D Themes, working alongside Rivian Studio Engineering and Design Teams; assess wheel design feasibility, monitor wheel attribute targets, offer technical direction on maturing wheel designs into feasible solutions. Working confidently in CATIA 3DX environment performing; assembly, packaging, measurement, surfacing GSD, drawings Evaluating wheel designs with CAE software. Working with nominated wheel supplier after award to develop wheel designs, balancing supplier and studio requirements whilst protecting wheel attribute targets Facilitate regular touchpoints between supplier and studio, whilst managing project schedule Confidently mediate design compromise discussions between studio and supplier. Effectively balance multiple projects, responsibilities, and tasks simultaneously Meet program timing & budget constraints whilst achieving mass, vehicle dynamics, crash, aero, NVH and chassis attribute targets Define validation procedures to ensure only optimized, integrated and robust designs are released Travel as necessary to support testing, supplier visits & production engineering support Qualifications:  Minimum Bachelor’s degree (Automotive, Mechanical or Motorsport engineering) and 3 years experience wheel design and/or development experience required at Wheel Supplier or OEM or Minimum Master’s degree (Automotive, Mechanical or Motorsport engineering) and 1 years experience wheel design and/or development experience required at Wheel Supplier or OEM Must be familiar with DFMEA/DVPR usage and review of these documents Strong experience using CAD (ideally CATIA V6) required Solid fundamental knowledge of chassis design, vehicle dynamics, wheel & tire alignment, tire uniformity and tire design contributors to vehicle level performance Understanding of wheel & tire design standards & code (ETRTO, TR&A etc) & homologation Candidates should be self-motivated and able to work in a fast-paced team environment Candidates should have the ability to manage multiple wheel projects at the same time Excellent communication skills, able to interact effectively with domestic and international teammates & suppliers Must be a self-starter, use initiative and engineering judgement Ability to interpret data and solve complex problems using first principles Pay Disclosure:     Salary range for California Based Applicants: $121,000-$139,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law).  Benefits Summary: Rivian provides robust medical/Rx, dental and vision insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Rivian covers most of the premiums.  Company Statements:  Equal Opportunity   Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.  Candidate Data Privacy   Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law. Description: About Rivian:     Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.  Role Summary:     This role fulfills restraint system modeling and optimization requirements for MSP platform. This will include assessments of interior surface proposals by studio, dial in safety requirements for interior safety, work with body structures and safety structures team on structural design strategies and its implications on vehicle pulse and occupant loading criteria (OLC) and work with restraints SMEs and DREs to tune restraints and dial in performance. This role will be highly collaborative in nature with this role cross functionally working across product development towards occupant systems integration. During MSP program, this role will be required to be present frequently onsite at restraints suppliers in Metro Detroit, for design reviews, design/validation discussions, sled/static testing, sled validations and crash testing in Buffalo NY. This role will confirm and validate Safety restraints strategies numerically and propose path forward for restraints safety system integration.  Responsibilities:  Build, correlate and maintain occupant safety CAE models related to FMVSS-201/208/214, UNECE, USNCAP, IIHS, Euro NCAP, China NCAP regulations, component, and system level. Build CAE models for interior components if these models aren’t provided by suppliers. Integrate interior component models such as restraints/seats/cockpit/header/trim/carpet into the systems model. Verify proper behavior of each sub-component model within the CAE system. Ensure proper model organization, model robustness, and run time efficiency. Analyze and optimize restraint system performance for compliance to regulations. Develop pragmatic counter measures for compliance with FMVSS, UNECE, USNCAP, IIHS, Euro NCAP and China NCAP. Work cross-functionally with component/system DRE’s to ensure capturing safety aspects and/or countermeasures into vehicle design. Correlate subsystem/ system CAE models to component level and full system level tests incl. full vehicle level tests. Engage directly with component suppliers in case model revisions are required to achieve performance targets. Closely work with test team to ensure test-setup reflects capturing test objective(s) and any data for model correlation. Update and maintain Rivians test specifications as source for confirmation and validation methodologies. Generate reports and executive summaries for communication as required. Qualifications:  MS in Mechanical or Automotive Engineering required with 5+ years of relevant OEM or TIER1 experience Demonstrable strong LS-Dyna expertise in CAE modeling application of restraint systems, dummy models & full vehicle/restraint/dummy models. Be a self-starter and take initiative to frame and solve occupant performance issues working collaboratively with all stakeholders. Ability to set high level safety targets for occupant safety, restraints, interior IP/trim & related structural components. Hands-on proficiency with common pre- and post-processing tools (such as, ANSA, Primer, LS-PrePost, Hyperworks) Good understanding of overall global safety protocols and regulations Experience with physical testing (component, sled & full vehicle) Experience with correlating CAE models to test outcomes. Excellent ability in presentation & writing reports for documentation, engineering, and senior management communications. ConMet has a new opportunity for two Design Engineering Managers to join our plastics engineering team based in Vancouver, WA. In this newly created role, you will have the opportunity to help shape the future of the ConMet plastics design engineering group. These design engineering managers will be responsible for planning, directing, and overseeing the day-to-day work and engineering development for new interior and exterior injection molded components and assemblies. This individual will have responsibility for reviewing and providing feedback on engineering work of assigned engineering team, coaching and mentoring their team, and tracking resource utilization to ensure adequate engineering resources are assigned to projects. In addition to a strong working understanding of plastics design engineering principles, this role requires a high level of organizational and planning proficiency to review incoming work requests from many different internal and external customers to establish resource plans, assign, track and report on progress of design engineering activities. Both jobs require working in an office environment (not hybrid or remote) at ConMet's corporate headquarters in Vancouver, Washington. Non-local candidates must be open to relocation (relocation assistance available. Key Duties Leads, directs and manages the work of design engineering resources including design engineers and designers, CAE analysts, dimensional engineers, and outside contract design resources.Directs the engineering design, development, test planning and analysis of interior and exterior plastics (parts and systems) based on outlined scope of work and OEM specifications.Lead and manage the day-to-day activities to ensure completion of project deliverables related but not limited to, 3D Modeling, 2D Drawing, structural analysis, stress analysis, prototype builds and testing validation.Review and provide feedback on engineering work completed by team such as CAD, drawings, and analysis.Lead and participate in engineering design reviews for interior and exterior plastic components and systems.Support the Director of Design Engineering, Program Managers, Design Leads, and Application Engineering to establish resource plans and forecasting needs for new programs.Conducts, documents, reviews and oversees all design activities via APQP processes.Coordinate, onboard, and manage internal and outside design resources as needed based on program and forecasting needs.Required QualificationsBachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent required.Minimum 7-10 years’ experience required in engineering or manufacturing process environment required.Plastics design and manufacturing experience related to automotive/trucking required.Interior and exterior trim systems design and development experience required.Experience managing and leading complex projects.Working knowledge of at least 1 of the following CAD systems (NX, Catia V5, Creo).Working knowledge of GD&T and experience creating and releasing 2D engineering drawings.Experience using PLM software such as Teamcenter/Enovia/Windchill.Preferred QualificationsWorking knowledge of APQP processes.Experience working with styling studios, managing tier 2 Description: Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  We are currently seeking experts in the field of Crashworthiness & Occupant Protection CAE. This position requires an experienced professional with a balanced approach to CAE and testing. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches their work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment. Role Execute simulations to evaluate full vehicle structural crashworthiness performance for high and low speed frontal, side, rear impact and pedestrian protection Generate feasible vehicle design recommendations, working cross functionally with engineering teams. Assist with building a high-fidelity CAE model from CAD data. Create analysis reports and communicate program status to relevant teams. Participate in post-test teardowns to correlate CAE results to physical tests. Where appropriate, conduct DOE/DFSS studies by utilizing optimization tools, on vehicle designs to meet performance requirements within the constraints of conflicting attributes such cost and mass. Support the creation of standard work procedures for delivering quality models and simulation results. Lead/mentor junior engineers Qualifications This position requires an experienced professional with a balanced approach to CAE and testing Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches their work with vigor and determination 5+ years’ experience in full vehicle crashworthiness CAE working for an Automotive OEM or equivalent experience Knowledge of Global regulatory and consumer safety requirements: FMVSS / UNECE / China, USNCAP, IIHS, Euro NCAP, China NCAP etc Strong analytical skills to draw meaningful conclusions from CAE results Demonstrable experience of root causing test performance, and correlation of CAE models Demonstrable ability to concisely present technical issues, CAE results, findings and propose next steps Advanced user of tools such as: Ansa, LS-Dyna, Meta-post, Primer, Hyperworks etc Experience with CATIA Education BS minimum in Mechanical Engineering or similar Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors.  California (Bay Area) - $115,000 - $165,000 Additional Compensation and Benefits: Lucid offers a wide range of competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, vacation, and 401k. The successful candidate may also be eligible to participate in Lucid’s equity program and/or a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing such programs. (Cash or equity incentive awards, if any, will depend on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and company performance.) Description: Who we are:  Founded in 2017, Gatik is the leader in autonomous middle mile logistics. We deliver goods safely and efficiently using medium duty trucks with a focus on short-haul, B2B logistics for Fortune 500 customers such as Walmart and Loblaw. Gatik enables our customers to optimize their hub-and-spoke operations, enhance service levels and product flow across multiple locations while reducing labor costs and meeting an unprecedented expectation for faster deliveries. About the role:Gatik is hiring a Senior Structural Validation Engineer who will be responsible for the overall structural validation of Gatik's hardware and Drive-by-wire components. This individual will be tasked with analyzing systems, developing validation plans and collaborating with cross-functional peers. Your area of expertise is the full range of structural validation composed of a wide range of materials and leveraging a cutting-edge tool set. Independence, good communication and documentation skills are key to succeed in this role. This role is onsite 4 days a week at our Mountain View, CA office!What you'll do:Analyze components, sub-assemblies, assemblies, and full vehicle using FEA toolsEnhance and develop FEA performance criteria and scope for component, subsystem and system levels based on (autonomous-) vehicle performance criteriaDevelop FEA validation plans for Durability, Stiffness and Strength throughout a full development cycleCollaborate with cross-functional engineering team members to optimize and improve component and system performanceLead structural component, sub-systems, and vehicle testing to correlate CAE modelsCollaborate with suppliers/vendors as needed to improve the material database and accuracy of CAE modelsDevelop and refine CAE analysis procedures and methodsManage work and deliverables with internal & external CAE and test resourcesDocument findings and reports stating clear recommendations and proposals for improvements to relevant peers and leadershipContinue to develop technology roadmaps for simulation and analysis toolsetsMentor wider engineering team in the principles of design for Structural Durability, Stiffness and StrengthWhat we're looking for:Masters degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar engineering discipline (Ph.D. preferred)5+ years of experience with Implicit (static and dynamic structural analysis) and explicit analysisExperience in the Automotive, Truck/Transportation and AV industryExpert knowledge of linear and non-linear structural and random vibration analysisAdvanced knowledge of crash analysis around vehicle components or subsystemsExpert in linear & non-linear FEA software for example Optistruct, Nastran, ABAQUS, and/or LS-DYNAProficient knowledge of materials engineering and experience in material characterization for FEAAbility to use instrumentation / experimental data to demonstrate model correlationExperience with multi-body dynamics and vehicle dynamicsStrong computer skills with programming and Python scripting experience, preferredExperience with CAD software (preferred)More about Gatik:    With headquarters in Mountain View, CA and offices in Canada, Texas and Arkansas. Gatik is establishing new standards of success for the autonomous trucking industry every day. Visit us at Gatik for more company information and Jobs @ Gatik for more open roles.   Gatik News:      The 10 most innovative companies in transportation of 2023            America's Best Startup Employers of 2023 by Forbes            America's Best Startup Employers of 2022 by Forbes            Gatik been named as a 2023 FreightTech 25 winner!            Gatik named a TIME Best Invention of 2022            Apeksha Kumavat recognized on the Inc. 2022 Female Founders 100 List            Gatik's Gautam Narang on the importance of knowing your customer      Gatik CEO Gautam Narang was Named Among the Most Exceptional Entrepreneurs of 2022 by Goldman SachsTaking care of our team:    At Gatik, we connect people of extraordinary talent and experience to an opportunity to create a more resilient supply chain and contribute to our environment's sustainability. We are diverse in our backgrounds and perspectives yet united by a bold vision and shared commitment to our values. Our culture emphasizes the importance of collaboration, respect and agility.       We at Gatik strive to create a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels they have opportunities to succeed and grow because we know that together we can do great things. We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

Position: Chief Technical Engineer, Vehicle and Multibody Simulations
Description: Position Overview:     Navistar CAE team has an exciting opportunity for a   Chief Technical Engineer Vehicle and MultibodySimulations position in full vehicle simulation area.  Navistar Structural and MBD team within Navistar Product Validation is accountable for all structural strength, durability, NVH and vehicle dynamic simulations across all our commercial vehicles.  The Chief Technical Engineer will provide technical expertise and leadership in the full vehicle simulation area including full vehicle (MBS, and FEA) simulations for ride, and NVH evaluations as well as loads generation for durability FEA team to use in structural durability simulations. Position is expected to lead cross disciplinary projects and teams, with up to 4 direct reports.  The Chief Technical Engineer will oversee overall support functions for Product Development Engineering and will be responsible for leading the processes, problem solving and implementing solutions to complex and high-risk engineering issues. The individual will Influence technical and regulatory standards bodies, provide proactive strategy around identified opportunities.  Responsibilities:  As an expert in the field, uses professional concepts in developing resolution to critical issues and broad design matters. Works on issues that impact design/selling success or address future concepts, products or technologies. Significantly influences functional strategy; may participate in the development of the product or division strategy. Leads the largest projects/initiatives that have a significant impact upon a complex, global business. Influences the strategy to address internal or external business and regulatory issues. Proactively identifies, defines, and solves the most complex problems that impact product performance and direction of the business. Recognized as an external thought leader within strategic function or discipline and contributing external thought leadership and innovation that influences change and advancement of the industry and/or profession. Achievements include major innovations that change and advance the industry and/or profession. Creates formal networks with key decision makers and serves as external spokesperson for the organization. Exercises wide latitude in determining objectives and approaches to critical assignments. Leads large multidisciplinary projects/initiatives that impact the business on a domestic or international scale. Serve as a critical asset in helping senior management articulate financial and technical strategy. Serve as a critical asset in helping Corporation influence the engineering strategy of key partners. Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 15 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies and/or computer science experience At least 2 years of lead experience   OR  Master’s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 12 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies and/or computer science experience At least 2 years of lead experience   OR  PhD in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science At least 9 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies and/or computer science experience At least 2 years of experience of lead experience Additional Requirements:  Qualified candidates, excluding current Navistar employees, must be legally authorized on an unrestricted basis (US Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident, Refugee or Asylee) to be employed in the United States. Navistar does not anticipate providing employment related work sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B status) Desired Skills:  Expertise in Vehicle Dynamics and NVH simulation tools and techniques (ADAMS/SimPack etc.) Preferred Expertise in full vehicle FEA simulation tools and techniques. Preferred Experience in Vehicle dynamics and NVH testing methods. Preferred Expertise in non-linear system behaviors (e.g. shocks, air-springs, rubber mounts, suspension components etc.) Preferred Expertise in truck and/or automotive design and development process.   Preferred:  Experience in design release process Experience in problem solving tools such as 8D, Six-sigma, Lean Proven track record of team leadership and project management Excellent Oral and Written communication skills Experience with working on timing plans and budget planning Experience with formal presentations Leadership – coaching, developing others MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Project Company Overview:     Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t.  Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts.  With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com.  Accelerating the Impact of Sustainable Mobility:     Visit us at   www.Navistar.com to discover more about our organization  Navistar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.  #ridewithnavistar

Position: Senior Engineer or Engineer II - EV Battery System research and Development
Location: Hybrid remote in Township of Superior, MI 48198
Description: Job Description: Our Team Advanced Engineering Lab. (AEL) is an engineering group at HATCI that focuses on advanced technology research and development that can be applied to current/future production vehicles and future mobility. AEL covers a wide range of areas from the development of new vehicle concepts to CAE and vehicle energy analysis and management.  The Position HATCI is currently seeking a Senior Engineer or Engineer II - EV Battery System Research and Development (BSD) for our Superior Township, MI facility (near Ann Arbor). The BSD is an Engineering Department within AEL, which was recently established to undertake projects related to EV high voltage Battery system research and development. This position reports to Manager of BSD.  Core Responsibilities Understand and follow department’s business model, strategic direction, purpose, and mission and continually communicate them with direct reports. Set up engineering goals and objectives aligned with department’s direction, and drive execution, engagement, and results to accomplish them. Develop engineering plan, strategy, and budget usage. Work with Manager and Senior Manager to participate in department’s resource planning, goal setting, and technology road map creation. Facilitate inter-team collaboration and knowledge sharing through transparent communication. Produce and deliver presentations on key project milestones and achievements. Remain current with new technology and competitive products as a means to drive innovation. Provide technical support for EV battery system related concerns for both pre-production and post-production issues. Execute engineering projects related to: Development or identification of new technologies, strategies, and methods for high voltage battery system of current and future Hyundai, Kia, and Genesis production hybrid and battery electric vehicles Support of North American electric vehicle plant including localized production parts verification and technical support Local response to EV quality issues in NA such as quality data acquisition, root cause analysis, improvement verification Feasibility analysis of new battery system technologies through simulation, lab tests, and on-road evaluations Introduction of selected battery technologies to current or next gen productions through active communications with Korean R&D Headquarter production programs. Research activities with external partners including national labs, universities, and tech suppliers. Investigation of industry trend in the area through benchmarking competitors’ systems & vehicles, application of the information to development directions and performance target settings Industry trend investigation, publication of technical papers and reports internally/externally. Travel both domestically and internationally (up to 20%) What We Offer: Zero-dollar employee premiums on Medical, dental, and vision for you and your family 100% employer-paid disability and Life insurance Generous paid Time Off including vacation, sick, and abundant holidays A Global Environment that fosters diversity Competitive Salaries Retirement savings and planning benefits Flexible work hours, and hybrid work schedule options Access to Health savings accounts and flexible spending accounts Experience and Skills: Basic Qualifications B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science and Engineering or other related fields 3+ years of automotive engineering experience Demonstrated ability to work collegially with others with the highest standards of integrity. Strong working knowledge and experience in xEV components or high voltage battery system, principles, operation, and vehicle electrification technology Proven track record of engineering projects related to engineering design, testing or simulation of xEVs and their systems & components such as batteries, and/or charging systems. Must be able to work with many different departments within HATCI and with its affiliates (e.g., Korea R&D Center, Hyundai Motor North America, Kia US, etc.) with a demonstrated ability to create relationships and facilitate work across company functions. Knowledge in vehicle or vehicle component test procedures Good written communication and interpersonal skills Valid Driver’s License with satisfactory driving record Candidates applying for positions with Hyundai and KIA must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. HATCI is an Equal Opportunity Employer including Disabled and Veteran. VEVRAA Federal contractor Preferred Qualifications M.S. in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science and Engineering or other related fields Experience with energy storage system and/or thermal management system development including test equipment, test processes, and system design processes. #LI-MC1 From: Hyundai America Technical Center, Inc. skills              An education in Mechanical Engineering, Physics or similar              Proven experience (minimum 5years) in multibody or other mechanical system modelling Joby Overview: Located in Northern California, the team at Joby Aviation is driven by our goal of creating an affordable, all-electric air transportation system. Imagine a piloted air taxi that takes off vertically, then quietly carries you and your fellow passengers over the congested city streets below, enabling you to spend more time with the people and places that matter most. Since 2009, our team has worked steadily to make this dream a reality. We’ve designed and tested many generations of prototype aircraft capable of serving in a network of electric air taxis. We’re looking for talented, committed individuals to join our team as we push onwards toward certifying the Joby aircraft with the Federal Aviation Administration, scaling our manufacturing, and preparing to launch commercial service in 2025. Overview:     Joby Aviation is seeking a passionate lead stress engineer who believes in the ability of urban air mobility to positively impact our cities. This role is an exciting position within the structures engineering team, as it allows for the engineer to interface with many disciplines within the company and assume a major role in the design of the aircraft. Prototypes are designed quickly and efficiently, meaning attention to detail is critical. The engineer will have experience analyzing aircraft powerplants, structures, developing load cases, and preparing aircraft certification documents.  Responsibilities:       Outline road map to satisfy static strength, stiffness, stability margin, fatigue life, damage tolerance, durability, thermal performance, and other requirements        Review and support publication of stress analysis documentation        Support design reviews and release of parts        Support component and assembly tests, including definition, planning, requirements, and report writing        Provide procedural and technical guidance to the stress team to ensure all analysis work is performed to a high standard.        Perform structural analyses by classical hand calculation and finite element analysis for both composites and metals        Directly communicate with mechanical design teams, structural test, integration teams and DERs        Support stress method definition        Coordinate with methods and allowables to ensure allowable coverage for necessary design space    Required:       B.S. in aerospace engineering, mechanical engineering, or another relevant discipline        10+ years of working experience in relevant industry          Previous leadership experience, including directly managing others          In-depth understanding of loading scenarios, free body diagrams, and behavior of aircraft components        Experience performing analysis on aircraft powerplant systems        Excellent problem-solving skills        Highly proactive attitude with the ability to manage multiple assignments        Strong written and verbal communication skills        Advanced proficiency in hand calculations and finite element analysis, including nonlinear static and dynamic analysis of composite structures and metallic structures        Ability to generate and review detailed analysis reports and aircraft type certification documents        Proficiency with CAD        Ability to work as part of a team in a fast-paced dynamic environment        Aircraft Certification Experience    Desired:       M.S./Ph.D. in relevant discipline        15+ years of working experience in relevant industry        Expert knowledge of Abaqus/CAE or Femap/Nastran        Experience with method validation process based on test data (test benches, flight test)        Hands on experience working within aircraft certification program        Excellent understanding of FAR Part 23, 27, and 29 regulations        Experience with MRB        Experience with Dassault Systems CAD      Compensation at Joby is a combination of base pay and Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). The target base pay for this position is $192,850 - $228,800 /annually. The compensation package will be determined by job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.  Joby also offers a comprehensive benefits package, including paid time off, healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan with a company match, an employee stock purchase plan (ESPP), short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, and more.  Min: USD $192,850.00/Yr. Max: USD $228,800.00/Yr. EEO:     Joby is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Position: Sr. Engineer, Electric Motor & BEV Simulation
Description: Tula is driven by an overriding passion to increase efficiency and improve the environment. With more than 340 patents issued or pending for multiple technologies, and a combined 450 years of engineering behind those patents, we’re focused primarily on applications for passenger automobiles, commercial vehicles for on and off road and electric vehicles of any size. Our approach to improving efficiency sets us apart. We come at it with demonstrated software solutions, and we deliver proven results with more than one million vehicles on the road using our technologies to decrease greenhouse gas emissions and increase fuel savings. But we’re not stopping there. We’re working to reduce or eliminate the use of rare earth elements in electric vehicles through improved electric motor efficiency and exploring efficiency in other means of mobility, too, including robotics, e-aviation and industrial machinery. Tula drives efficiency. The Senior Engineer, Electric Motor and BEV Simulation will be a core member of the team developing advanced motor control strategies at Tula. They will work closely with cross-functional team members on both customer and internal development programs focusing on advanced electric motor and BEV applications to meet challenging performance targets. Primary responsibilities include: Develop and validate simulation models for electric motors, inverters, batteries, and BEV powertrainsCarefully create simulation and experimental test plans to support identification of key static and dynamic characteristics of electric motor and powertrain systemsConduct detailed analysis of simulation and test results to draw strong conclusions about operating characteristics and to evaluate proposed algorithms with respect to stringent targets for energy efficiency, drivability and NVHEnhance analytical practices to improve model accuracy and/or increase execution speedUtilize simulation models to develop system-level optimization strategies and algorithmsCoordinate closely with the electric motor, vehicle, and battery Test and Algorithms teams, utilizing vendors and contractors as neededDevelop project plans and contribute to the generation of innovative ideas Requirements MS in electrical or mechanical engineering, or equivalent technical backgroundMature understanding of electric motor and BEV powertrain design principles and R&D methodologyStrong analysis skills for predicting and verifying energy efficiency, drivability and NVHDemonstrated experience with CAE tools such as JMAG, Ansys Maxwell, or Motor-CAD and associated model correlation and validation methodologiesKnowledge of electric motor and vehicle instrumentation, data acquisition and experiment designSystematic approach toward engineering developmentEffective verbal and written communication skills including the ability to influence technical directionDemonstrated team orientation and project management skillsAbility to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced start-up environment Salary Range: $132,000 – 195,000 + benefits and stock options (actual compensation will be determined based on experience level). Flexible work from home options available.

Job Description: Senior Drainage Engineer - Transportation Infrastructure – Pacific Northwest Region Overview : Parsons has a challenging and rewarding opportunity for a motivated Senior Drainage Engineer to join our team in the Parsons Pacific Northwest Area. The successful candidate will have a key role in the drainage and hydrology & hydraulics (H&H) practice specializing in Transportation Drainage, Stormwater Management, Hydrology and Hydraulics, and Floodplain Management engineering services. In this role, you will have a lead role in a team of professionals overseeing drainage and hydrology components of multiple transportation projects. The project portfolio includes highway improvement projects, rail and transit projects, and other critical infrastructure projects, with an emphasis on drainage and stormwater design work in the Seattle and Washington area. There are also opportunities to support projects in other regions of the U.S. and Canada. Responsibilities: In this role, you will provide technical guidance to designers, lower-level engineers and drafters; act in an advisory capacity to senior management personal on technical matters and bring technical expertise to all drainage/hydrology aspects of major transportation projects on both conventional and design/build projects. You will be a key member of our Mobility Solutions practice assisting in pursuing and executing these projects. Responsibilities Include: Assists in leading discipline design teams on projects while assisting with building of relationships with key clients. Provides mentorship and guides development of junior staff with standard engineering practice/methodologies, and commonly used CAD/CAE and modeling software for the drainage and H&H discipline. Coordinates with discipline counterparts such as roadway, structural, utilities and others during design efforts. Communicates with project managers and discipline leads to ensure success of projects. Able to meet deadlines and independently manage assigned tasks and workloads. Assists with managing tasks of junior staff. Participates in company-wide technical H&H community and professional societies to keep abreast of current technologies and networking. Applies advanced engineering principles to complex analytical models and proficient in commonly used engineering software and methodologies. Performs and leads design plan production, specifications, and reports for projects of all sizes. Highly proficient in commonly used software environments as needed for project requirements for both plan production and analytic modeling/reporting. Understands QA/QC standard practices and procedures, ensuring quality requirements and project criteria and scope are met during project delivery. Qualifications: 8 years or more of experience in transportation drainage, stormwater, and hydrology engineering and design-build experience strongly preferred. 5 years or more of WSDOT stormwater design experience is essential. Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Environmental Engineering, or related field. (PE) license is required, and ability to obtain license in Washington State within 6 months of hire. Knowledge of standard DOT/FHWA drainage, hydraulic and hydrology standards and practices; Experience with FEMA designated floodplains; Experience on alternative project delivery and design-build projects, and experience with typical drainage and H&H design software commonly used in final design is strongly preferred. Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None  This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.  For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.  Salary Range: $81,500.00 - $161,400.00  We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!  The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates. Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.  We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

Some assignments involve CAE (computer aided engineering)/CAD (computer aided design) applications. Willingness to travel or relocate to supplier, client, or construction site locations, is expected. Requisition ID: 270591 Location: Houston, TX Relocation Authorized: National - Family Telework Type: Part-Time Telework Other Requirements: Pre-employment drug screen and background check Company Overview Since 1898, we have helped customers complete more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents that have created jobs, grown economies, improved the resiliency of the world's infrastructure, increased access to energy, resources, and vital services, and made the world a safer, cleaner place. Differentiated by the quality of our people and our relentless drive to deliver the most successful outcomes, we align our capabilities to our customers’ objectives to create a lasting positive impact. We serve the Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; Mining & Metals, and the Manufacturing and Technology markets. Our services span from initial planning and investment, through start-up and operations. Core to Bechtel is our values – ethics, safety, quality, people, culture, relationships, innovation and sustainability, and our covenants – integrity, respect, collaboration, trust, and delivery. They are what we believe, what customers can expect, and how we deliver. Responsibilities Plans, schedules and conducts independent work in the evaluation, selection, application and adaptation of engineering techniques, procedures and criteria in one discipline in a project or staff group. Coordinates detailed phases of engineering work requiring judgment in the application of techniques. Performs work that involves conventional engineering practice but may include complex features such as resolving conflicting design requirements, unsuitability of conventional materials and/or difficult coordination requirements. Performs work using standard application programs and appropriate 2-D and 3-D computer-aided design and computer-aided engineering (CAD and CAE) tools. Plans, coordinates or prepares equipment or work specifications, bid evaluations and award recommendations for equipment. Prepares and/or assists in the preparation of cost estimates, quantity take-offs and staffing requirements for proposals, forecasts and change orders. Reviews bid analyses and makes recommendations. Prepares or assists in preparation of conceptual studies, designs, reports or proposals. Performs or assists in the performance of problem analysis and original design and normally uses conventional approaches to solving technical problems encountered. Coordinates engineering efforts in assigned areas between specialty and other engineering groups or disciplines with the client, suppliers, and contractors and between other groups to gather or give information. Provides technical direction and assigns work to subordinate engineers, designers, drafters, technicians and others who assist in performing specific assignments. Plans and conducts independent work within a Global Business Unit that requires judgment in evaluating, selecting, applying, and adapting engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria. Devises new approaches to solving problems. Manages the work of a small group of engineers. Qualifications and Skills Basic Qualification A recognized degree in a job-related engineering or scientific discipline from an accredited college or university. Practical work experience in design engineering or relevant equivalent experience in all types of engineering is sufficient to demonstrate competence as a trained engineer. Thorough knowledge of discipline engineering techniques, the design of engineered systems, and engineering and design calculations. Understanding of industry or regulatory codes and standards and design criteria pertinent to the particular engineering discipline. Broad knowledge of the application of engineering to plant constructability as applied to construction methods and materials. Understands the standard engineering work planning, scheduling and cost estimating. Knowledge of current computer applications for engineering and design including appropriate knowledge of CAD (both 2-D and 3-D) and CAE and relevant standard computer applications to perform the work. Understanding of engineering planning and control methods including computerized methods. Understanding of the roles played by other departments on projects including basic construction practices and the economics involved. Working knowledge of precedents in the specialty area, the principles and practices of related technical areas and of coordinating work with other technical disciplines. Skill in oral and written communication. Preferred Qualifications Specific experience in planning and executing greenfield or brownfield projects in one or more of the following market segments: Natural gas processing including liquefaction and regasification. Coal, gas or biomass to chemicals such as methanol and ammonia. Petrochemicals Carbon capture and sequestration. Solar and/or combined cycle power plants. Hydrogen value chain including electrolysis, reforming, liquefaction, transportation and fueling stations. Offshore and onshore pipelines. Desalination, raw water, demineralized water and wastewater treatment plants. Familiarity with current process technologies and licensors associated with the above. Additional Qualifications E.I.T. / F.E. Certification is preferred. Registration as Professional Engineer is strongly preferred. ETAP calculation experience is strongly preferred. Previous experience on FEEDs or Project Proposals is strongly preferred. Previous experience preparing estimated quantities, jobhour estimates, and schedule planning is strongly preferred. Ability to develop innovative ideas to reduce project total installed costs (TIC). Ability to present technical design issues to the customer and supplier and the ability to recommend solutions based on knowledge and experience. Demonstrated depth & breadth of technical competency in at least one of the following subjects: Gas Insulated Switchgear, High Voltage Installations, Customer Owned High Voltage Transmission Lines, Prefabricated Substations, Electrical System Design and Analysis, Electrical Calculations (Load Flow, Motor Starting, Short Circuit, Harmonic Analysis, Transient Stability, Relay Coordination, Arc Flash), Protective Relaying, Power Management Systems, Power Transformers, High Power Adjustable Speed Drive Systems, Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS), PV/Wind Energy, Microgrid Systems, etc. Shaping tomorrow together Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live. www.bechtel.com Bechtel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In accordance with Bechtel's duty to provide and maintain a safe workplace for our employees and to safeguard the health of our families, customers, and visitors, we have adopted mandatory COVID-19 safety protocols for each work location, which may include a vaccination or testing requirement. Please speak with your Bechtel recruiter to determine which protocols apply to the work location for the job you are seeking.

About McNeilus, an Oshkosh company    McNeilus Truck and Manufacturing Inc. is an industry leading manufacturer of concrete mixers and refuse truck bodies. McNeilus has long been the industry standard when it comes to transporting concrete to the job site with our rear discharge mixers, as well as the Oshkosh S-Series front discharge mixer. McNeilus also produces a complete line of high-performance rear load, front load, and automated side load refuse bodies to augment any refuse collection fleet.    As a Senior Engineer in Body/Structures you will lead the development of structural components to achieve best-in-class performance. You will work with cutting edge automotive technologies including hybrid structures to assure designs meet customer requirements, corporate objectives, are safe, can be manufactured, and produced economically. Areas you will be supporting include electro-hydraulic control systems, hybrid and electric vehicles, autonomous vehicle systems, active safety systems, advanced connectivity systems, and other auxiliary systems and technology for on-road and off-road vehicle applications. To be successful in this role, you will exhibit the following skills and behaviors:  Business Acumen: Drive connections between individual roles, functional goals and organizational goals to ensure we have workforce plans that align with short- and long-term needs Communication Expertise: Collaborate with large technical teams, provide guidance to small teams, and partner with internal and external resources. Ensure information and project status is conveyed in a concise and accurate manner to leadership Project Management: Identify action plans, assign resources, and monitor activities to ensure project deliverables are met Team Member Development: Provide mentoring on the engineering design process and sound design principles.   YOUR IMPACT  Coordinate activities for projects to ensure that they meet customer expectations Design to specific requirements set by our internal leadership, support the creation/modification of requirements, connect designs with customer requirements, and specifications such as ANSI Z245.1 Determine whether customer requirements have been satisfied and evaluate designs for performance, safety, and reliability Contribute to the development of new technologies and establish system and sub-system requirements according to the needs of a project Analyzes feedback from customer and suppliers regarding performance Analyzes incoming designs to be sure the design can be manufactured in a modern high flow system Determines priorities for items to be completed and supports Product/Program team members with updates and guidance on steps to successful solutions Assistance is given to others and utilizes motivation techniques to ensure that projects are completed on schedule Defines program objectives and requirements to both customer and suppliers Contacts other departments to ensure that all questions have been answered Assume engineering responsibility for assigned program Provide leadership to a technical staff to ensure program success Maintain effective communication with suppliers, customers, and internal departments concerning technical issues affecting the program Enforce the proper use of engineering criteria and drawing standards. Ensure that technical issues are conducted with the framework of company policies and procedure Provides assistance in service activities and manual preparation Work closely with CAE teams interpreting FEA and using analysis-based results to guide and evolve the designs assigned Guide less experienced engineers through new design best practices Prepare system and sub-system level design reviews (Preliminary, Detailed, and Final Design Reviews. etc.) Developing solutions that exceed regulatory compliance, drive increased reliability, push cross functional teams through Advance Product Quality Planning (APQP)   MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS  Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Mechanical, or a related field 3-plus years related experience Experience with automotive body structures and heavy-duty body on chassis design Ability to read, comprehend, and develop an advanced engineering Technical Drawing Package Ability to troubleshoot structural failures with our Test and Development and FEA teams Ability to attain a Commercial Driver’s License (CDL) to accomplish assigned projects Experience with automotive or heavy-duty equipment system architectures SolidWorks, CREO, SmarTeam, Windchill experience Weldment (WLDMT) drawings and design experience   STANDOUT QUALIFICATIONS  Knowledge and ability to integrate state-of-the-art design and manufacturing methods into product concepts and designs including familiarity with GD&T and dimensional engineering Working knowledge of aluminum/steel/composite structure, and joining techniques Experience in product development, from concept through prototyping to full rate production   Oshkosh is committed to working with and offering reasonable accommodation to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to disability for any part of the employment process, please contact us at: 920-502-3009 or corporatetalentacquisition@oshkoshcorp.com.    Oshkosh Corporation is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. This company will provide equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Information collected regarding categories as provided by law will in no way affect the decision regarding an employment application.    Oshkosh Corporation will not discharge or in any manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with Oshkosh Corporation's legal duty to furnish information.    Certain positions with Oshkosh Corporation require access to controlled goods and technologies subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations or the Export Administration Regulations. Applicants for these positions may need to be "U.S. Persons," as defined in these regulations. Generally, a "U.S. Person" is a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident, or an individual who has been admitted as a refugee or granted asylum.

At SimuTech Group, we truly believe that we are driving innovation and changing the world through the power of engineering simulation. Our growing team of energetic, tech savvy professionals work hard every day to inspire our clients to push the boundaries of innovation and deliver transformational products. If you are motivated and driven by a culture where excellent work ethic and passion are rewarded, then a career with SimuTech Group may be for you! Looking for your next career move? Help today’s engineers build tomorrow’s products by providing solutions and guidance with the power of simulation. We are looking for a Mechanical Engineer with 8 to 10 years of experience to join our world-class FEA Support and Consulting team! This position would be based out of either SimuTech office in Rochester, NY, or Everett, WA. For the right candidate, a remote position can be accommodated elsewhere in the US. The right candidate will become a key member of our technical staff, working in an exciting and challenging technical environment. Success of the Mechanical Engineer will be measured by helping grow SimuTech’s FEA business and developing your own technical skills by solving challenging problems in a wide variety of industries. Each member of our staff is a FEA expert who also maintains expertise in one or more specialized fields. Many of our engineers hold advanced degrees with extensive experience in the engineering consulting business. We maintain a high level of professionalism in a friendly, cooperative, flexible environment. Location: Flexible Essential Job Functions/Accountabilities: The Mechanical Engineer will use software such as ANSYS Mechanical and Mechanical APDL to provide: 1. Technical Support - Provide Support to end users of ANSYS by phone, e-mail, or in person. 2. Pre-sales Support - Work with our account managers to determine the customer's software needs, answer customer technical questions during the sales process and provide software demos/presentations on a variety of subjects. 3. Consulting Work with customers to determine their analysis requirements and expectations. Develop quotes/proposals by determining scopes, costs, and schedules Perform all aspects of analysis (Meshing, Load Cases, Solving, Post Processing, Conclusions) Work with customers to propose alternative design ideas Write analysis reports and other technical documents requested by the customer 4. Technical Training - Teach ANSYS classes at client sites, on-line, and in SimuTech offices across the U.S. and Canada Desired Skills/Experience: Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria: Must be permanently authorized to work in the US Professional appearance and presentation required. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Must be able to work well in a group and independently. Excellent English-based communication skills, technical writing and verbal skills required. Documented industry experience with enterprise level finite element analysis tools Ansys (preferred). Abacus, Nastran, Altair, etc. Ability to communicate with customers on a technical pre-sales basis to help drive software and services sales Demonstrates creative problem-solving and strong analytical skills Solid theoretical background in structural mechanics and numerical methods backed up by real-world, production-level experience Documented experience (as evidenced by industry experience and/or publications in reputable journals) in:             Structural linear and non-linear static implicit analysis methods (non-linear materials including plasticity and hyper elasticity as well as contact and large strain/large deformation) Implicit dynamics including linear (modal, harmonic, response spectrum, random vibration) and thermal analysis including both steady-state and time domain transient. ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code Analyses Methods Kinematics and Rigid Body Dynamics Familiarity with grid generation and meshing techniques (Ansys CAE, Femap, Hypermesh) Personable attitude with an ability to work well with clients and other staff Bachelor's degree in engineering required; master's degree considered a plus Helpful Qualifications/Non-requirements: ANSYS programming skills, including GUI customization in J-script and Python Explicit dynamics modeling experience (crash impact, metal forming simulations, etc.) using LS-Dyna, Autodyn, or Abaqus Explicit Ability to use 3-D CAD to modify parts and assemblies (Discovery (preferred), SpaceClaim Direct Modeler (preferred), DM, Solidworks, ProE or Siemens NX ) Practical ANSYS experience manipulating and/or modeling complex 3-D assemblies Academic background or work experience in fluid mechanics and CFD Experience with optimization and DOE methods LF/Maxwell experience Concrete modeling experience a plus. Benefits: Medical insurance 100% paid for by employer (no employee out-of-pocket costs required for the premiums, deductibles, and copays) Dental insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Vision insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Short Term Disability Long Term Disability 401k Plan with employer match Limited Flexible Spending Account Life Insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Referral program Tuition reimbursement Bonus plan Pay Range: $80,000 - 130,000 Annually ABOUT THE COMPANY: We have a 35+ year relationship with ANSYS and we are their largest Elite Channel Partner in North America. We provide world-class ANSYS engineering simulation software as well as support, training, consulting and physical testing services. We are headquartered in Rochester, NY with additional offices in Cleveland, Seattle, Montreal, and Toronto. We also have remote sales and engineering personnel throughout North America. SimuTech Group employs over 140 people with nearly half being engineers; most holding Master's or PhD degrees. SimuTech Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.
Benefits: ['401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'Dental insurance', 'Disability insurance', 'Flexible spending account', 'Health insurance', 'Life insurance']
