Description: Role and Responsibilities Who We Are: CAE Vision: Our vision is to be the worldwide partner of choice in defense and security, civil aviation, and healthcare by revolutionizing our customers’ training and critical operations with digitally immersive solutions to elevate safety, efficiency and readiness. CAE Defense & Security Mission: CAE's Defense and Security business unit focuses on helping prepare military customers to develop and maintain the highest levels of mission readiness. CAE Values: Empowerment, Innovation, Excellence, Integrity and OneCAE make us who we are and we strive to make a difference in the world while helping each other succeed. What We Have to Offer: Comprehensive and competitive benefits package and flexibility that promotes work-life balance A work environment where all employees are valued, respected and safe Freedom to succeed by enabling team members to deliver, take initiatives and make decisions Recognition, professional development, advancement and having fun! Summary Provides technical leadership for the design, development, production, and test of simulation training devices. Applies mature engineering knowledge and planning. Fosters the development of a common vision, provides technical direction and priorities; clarifies roles and responsibilities within the team. Acts as technical link between CAE and customer. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Responsible for arranging and directing technical activities of large scale programs, coordinates engineering activities across many disciplines. Provides technical expertise during subjective and objective evaluations of training devices Provides support for Program Managers on all technical matters and schedule performance. Provide risk assessments and mitigation planning Act as the focal point for all customer technical matters, including hands on solutions Ensures that company’s simulation products meet contractual requirements and all functional areas within engineering are compliant to the technical requirements for each assigned project Authors, coordinates, and leads presentations of formal reviews with customers Resolves technical problems and provides technical support to suppliers and manufacturing Supports the resolution of all non-conformances. Participate in installations and final sell off of training devices. Coordinate and review technical/operational deliverables prior to submission to customer Responsible for training device from requirements to final acceptance Budget performance responsibility for technical team using the earned value management system (EVMS) Support bid and proposal by reviewing technical specifications, recommending design and manufacturing solutions, and writing detailed technical responses Undertakes independent studies, analysis, interpretations, and conclusions Provides guidance to junior team members Qualifications and Education Requirements BS or MS Degree in engineering Minimum of 10 years work experience; prefer simulation, military training, or aerospace experience Exceptional written and verbal communication skills Ability to develop strong customer relationships Experience using CAD tools and Microsoft Office products Due to U.S. Government contract requirements, only U.S. citizens are eligible for this role. Security Responsibilities Must comply with all company security and data protection / usage policies and procedures. Personally responsible for proper marking and handling of all information and materials, in any form. Shall not divulge any information, or afford access, to other employees not having a need-to-know. Shall not divulge information outside company without management approval. All government and proprietary information will be accessed and stored electronically on company provided resources. Incumbent must be eligible for DoD Personal Security Clearance. Due to U.S. Government contract requirements, only U.S. citizens are eligible for this role. Work Environment Work is performed in an environment where irritants such as noise from telephones, temperature, and lighting variations may exist, but there is little chance of injury, accident, or occupational health problems. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Must be able to perform normal office duties (sitting for long periods at a desk and in technical meetings) Must be able to travel CONUS and to International sites for extended periods Should be familiar with and be able to operate simulation training devices such as: full flight motion devices, maintenance training devices, entertainment devices and fixed base training devices. Should be familiar with and able to support Engineering or Operations staff on any type and sub-component of training devices. Must be able to climb stairs on a regular basis Must be willing to work overtime Other Duties Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for their job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. CAE USA Inc. is an EOE/AA employer and gives consideration for employment to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you’d like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please click here Know Your Rights: Workplace Discrimination is Illegal. PAY TRANSPARENCY NONDISCRIMINATION PROVISION The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. Position Type Regular  CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted. Equal Employment Opportunity At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception. As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team. At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, neurodiversity or age. The masculine form may be used in this job description solely for ease of reading, but refers to men, women and the gender diverse.

Requisition ID: 270511 Location: Houston, TX Relocation Authorized: National - Family Telework Type: Part-Time Telework Other Requirements: Pre-employment drug screen and background check Responsibilities: Plans, schedules and conducts independent work in the evaluation, selection, application and adaptation of engineering techniques, procedures and criteria in one discipline in a project or staff group. Coordinates detailed phases of engineering work requiring judgment in the application of techniques. Performs work that involves conventional engineering practice but may include complex features such as resolving conflicting design requirements, unsuitability of conventional materials and/or difficult coordination requirements. Performs work using standard application programs and appropriate 2-D and 3-D computer-aided design and computer-aided engineering (CAD and CAE) tools. Plans, coordinates or prepares equipment or work specifications, bid evaluations and award recommendations for equipment. Prepares and/or assists in the preparation of cost estimates, quantity take-offs and staffing requirements for proposals, forecasts and change orders. Reviews bid analyses and makes recommendations. Prepares or assists in preparation of conceptual studies, designs, reports or proposals. Performs or assists in the performance of problem analysis and original design and normally uses conventional approaches to solving technical problems encountered. Coordinates engineering efforts in assigned areas between specialty and other engineering groups or disciplines with the client, suppliers, and contractors and between other groups to gather or give information. Provides technical direction and assigns work to subordinate engineers, designers, drafters, technicians and others who assist in performing specific assignments. Plans and conducts independent work within a Global Business Unit that requires judgment in evaluating, selecting, applying, and adapting engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria. Devises new approaches to solving problems. Manages the work of a small group of engineers. Qualifications and Skills Basic Qualification: A recognized degree in a job-related engineering or scientific discipline from an accredited college or university. Practical work experience in design engineering or relevant equivalent experience in all types of engineering is sufficient to demonstrate competence as a trained engineer. Thorough knowledge of discipline engineering techniques, the design of engineered systems, and engineering and design calculations. Understanding of industry or regulatory codes and standards and design criteria pertinent to the particular engineering discipline. Broad knowledge of the application of engineering to plant constructability as applied to construction methods and materials. Understands the standard engineering work planning, scheduling and cost estimating. Knowledge of current computer applications for engineering and design including appropriate knowledge of CAD (both 2-D and 3-D) and CAE and relevant standard computer applications to perform the work. Understanding of engineering planning and control methods including computerized methods. Understanding of the roles played by other departments on projects including basic construction practices and the economics involved. Working knowledge of precedents in the specialty area, the principles and practices of related technical areas and of coordinating work with other technical disciplines. Skill in oral and written communication. Preferred Qualification: Specific experience in planning and executing greenfield or brownfield projects in one or more of the following market segments: Natural gas processing including liquefaction and regasification. Coal, gas or biomass to chemicals such as methanol and ammonia. Petrochemicals such as HDPE, LDPE, MEG, PET, PTA, PVC and others. Carbon capture and sequestration. Solar and/or combined cycle power plants. Hydrogen value chain including electrolysis, reforming, liquefaction, transportation and fueling stations. Offshore and onshore pipelines. Desalination, raw water, demineralized water and wastewater treatment plants. Familiarity with current process technologies and licensors associated with the above. Additional Qualifications: E.I.T. / F.E. Certification is required. Registration as Professional Engineer is strongly preferred. ETAP calculation experience is strongly preferred. Previous experience on FEEDs or Project Proposals is strongly preferred. Previous experience preparing estimated quantities, jobhour estimates, and schedule planning is strongly preferred. Ability to develop innovative ideas to reduce project total installed costs (TIC). Ability to present technical design issues to the customer and supplier and the ability to recommend solutions based on knowledge and experience. Demonstrated depth & breadth of technical competency in at least one of the following subjects: Gas Insulated Switchgear, High Voltage Installations, Customer Owned High Voltage Transmission Lines, Prefabricated Substations, Electrical System Design and Analysis, Electrical Calculations (Load Flow, Motor Starting, Short Circuit, Harmonic Analysis, Transient Stability, Relay Coordination, Arc Flash), Protective Relaying, Power Management Systems, Power Transformers, High Power Adjustable Speed Drive Systems, Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS), PV/Wind Energy, Microgrid Systems, etc. #LI-ML1 Shaping tomorrow together Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live. www.bechtel.com Bechtel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In accordance with Bechtel's duty to provide and maintain a safe workplace for our employees and to safeguard the health of our families, customers, and visitors, we have adopted mandatory COVID-19 safety protocols for each work location, which may include a vaccination or testing requirement. Please speak with your Bechtel recruiter to determine which protocols apply to the work location for the job you are seeking.

Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  Lucid Motors is seeking an experienced and highly skilled professional to fill the position of Director of Body Structures and Closures. This is an opportunity to help shape the future of electric vehicles atone of the world’s leading innovators in electric vehicle technologies.  The ideal candidate will be a highly experienced engineer and leader with exceptional understanding of technical fundamentals, and an instinct for building high performing teams of industry-leading experts. As the Director, you will oversee concept design, engineering execution, and innovation activities in the field of body structures, closures, body sealing, CAE simulation, and advanced manufacturing techniques. Responsibilities: Lead and manage the body structure team, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to ensure successful execution of projects related to BIW, Closures, body sealing, and their associated engineering activities. Oversee the engineering of Body in White and Closures, including design, development, validation, and integration, ensuring compliance with industry standards, performance objectives, and cost targets. Drive the engineering of body sealing, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to develop lightweight, safe, and efficient solutions that optimize performance and range. Utilize CAE-simulation techniques to analyze and optimize the performance of body structures, closures, and body sealing, ensuring structural integrity, crashworthiness, and overall vehicle performance. Collaborate with manufacturing engineering teams to develop advanced manufacturing processes and techniques for efficient and high-quality production of body structures and closures. Foster a culture of continuous improvement, innovation, and excellence within the team, encouraging employees to think creatively, learn quickly, and strive for perfection in a fast-paced environment. Collaborate closely with other directors and stakeholders across the organization, including design, electrical engineering, vehicle dynamics, and quality assurance, to ensure seamless integration of body structures and closures within the overall vehicle architecture. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in engineering required. Masters or similarly advanced degree in materials, mechanical engineering, or related field preferred. 10+ years of experience in automotive body structures and closures engineering, with a focus on electric vehicles and advanced materials. Strong technical expertise in body attributes, structural analysis, and CAE-simulation techniques. Proven track record of successfully leading and managing cross-functional engineering teams, preferably in the automotive industry. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to make sound engineering decisions in a complex and dynamic environment. Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks, manage budgets, and deliver projects on schedule. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams and influence key stakeholders. Demonstrated passion for electric vehicles, sustainable transportation, and the pursuit of excellence in the automotive industry. Familiarity with industry regulations, standards, and best practices related to body structures, and closures. Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors. California (Bay Area) - $192,000-$275,000 Lucid maintains your privacy according to its Candidate Privacy Notice. If you are a California resident, please refer to our California Candidate Privacy Notice.    At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.  To all recruitment agencies:   Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Your Job Molex creates connections for life by enabling technologies that transform the future and improve lives. With a presence in more than 40 countries, Molex offers a complete range of connectivity products, services and solutions for the data communications, medical, industrial, automotive and consumer electronics industries. Our Datacom and Specialty Solutions (DSS) team designs an extensive product line serving customers in telecommunications, datacom, hyperscalers, cloud, data center and storage applications. The widespread growth of high speed and broadband systems introduces unique signal integrity issues. Our team is providing signal integrity solutions that are a fundamental need in building reliable communications equipment. We are delivering solutions to meet the demands of the 224G PAM4 market and beyond. Molex is seeking an experienced Signal Integrity Project Engineer to design, model, analyze, and characterize high-speed connectors, cables, and systems serving cutting edge technology in data center and storage industry. The Senior Signal Integrity Engineer will lead technical design and provide direction and guidance to others. This person will also interface directly with customers on Signal Integrity issues to gather requirements and provide technical support. In order to meet the fast speed demands of the industry, this person will understand market to drive cutting edge technology to our customers. This person will play a key role in our Signal Integrity team. This position is eligible for hybrid or remote work for the right candidate with travel to sites in Arkansas and Lisle. What You Will Do  Develop unique interconnect solutions based on customer objectives of performance and cost for overall channel Make recommendations for improvement of existing interconnect systems (connectors and cable assemblies) Perform characterization and correlation of high-speed connectors, cable assemblies, and systems using high-speed digital testing and electromagnetic modeling techniques Provide supervision to lower level engineers, review and approve their work to meet performance standard Be up-to-date with industry trend on high speed connector requirements and disseminate / share information among team members Lead research and development work on or advanced technologies in electrical design capabilities Provide technical guidance on Signal Integrity to Product Design Engineering, Marketing and Sales personnel or others as required Prepare and conduct technical presentations to Sales, Marketing and/or Customers Generate evaluation and qualification reports or presentation materials for both internal and customer use Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)Bachelors Degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics, or Applied math At least 3 years participating in Signal Integrity design projects Experience with simulation and design Experience with statistical and time domain serial link simulation techniques/methods Experience with high-speed serdes design, architectures, protocols and modeling methods Experience with electromagnetics Experience correlating simulation results with lab measurements using oscilloscopes, TDRs, VNAs, and spectrum analyzers What Will Put You AheadMasters Degree in Engineering, Physics, or Applied math 10+ years SI design and simulation experience Experience with available CAD/CAE tools such as Channel Designer, HFSS, CST, FDTD tools, MoM tools, Sigrity PowerSI, PAKSI-E, Power-grid, Agilent ADS, Agilent PLTS, Cadence CAD tools or related tools a plus Capability of scripting/automating the analysis flow with point tools is a plus At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy. For this role, we anticipate paying $100,000-140,000 per year. This role is eligible for variable pay, issued as a monetary bonus or in another form. Hiring Philosophy All Koch companies value diversity of thought, perspectives, aptitudes, experiences, and backgrounds. We are Military Ready and Second Chance employers. Learn more about our hiring philosophy here . Who We Are As a Koch company, Molex is a leading supplier of connectors and interconnect components, driving innovation in electronics and supporting industries from automotive to health care and consumer to data communications. The thousands of innovators who work for Molex have made us a global electronics leader. Our experienced people, groundbreaking products and leading-edge technologies help us deliver a wider array of solutions to more markets than ever before. At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company. Our Benefits Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter. Equal Opportunities Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status. Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test. This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: http://www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf #LI-AP3

Description: Your Job Molex creates connections for life by enabling technologies that transform the future and improve lives. With a presence in more than 40 countries, Molex offers a complete range of connectivity products, services and solutions for the data communications, medical, industrial, automotive and consumer electronics industries. Our Datacom and Specialty Solutions (DSS) team designs an extensive product line serving customers in telecommunications, datacom, hyperscalers, cloud, data center and storage applications. The widespread growth of high speed and broadband systems introduces unique signal integrity issues. Our team is providing signal integrity solutions that are a fundamental need in building reliable communications equipment. We are delivering solutions to meet the demands of the 224G PAM4 market and beyond. Molex is seeking an experienced Signal Integrity Project Engineer to design, model, analyze, and characterize high-speed connectors, cables, and systems serving cutting edge technology in data center and storage industry. The Senior Signal Integrity Engineer will lead technical design and provide direction and guidance to others. This person will also interface directly with customers on Signal Integrity issues to gather requirements and provide technical support. In order to meet the fast speed demands of the industry, this person will understand market to drive cutting edge technology to our customers. This person will play a key role in our Signal Integrity team. What You Will Do  Develop unique interconnect solutions based on customer objectives of performance and cost for overall channel Make recommendations for improvement of existing interconnect systems (connectors and cable assemblies) Perform characterization and correlation of high-speed connectors, cable assemblies, and systems using high-speed digital testing and electromagnetic modeling techniques Provide supervision to lower level engineers, review and approve their work to meet performance standard Be up-to-date with industry trend on high speed connector requirements and disseminate / share information among team members Lead research and development work on or advanced technologies in electrical design capabilities Provide technical guidance on Signal Integrity to Product Design Engineering, Marketing and Sales personnel or others as required Prepare and conduct technical presentations to Sales, Marketing and/or Customers Generate evaluation and qualification reports or presentation materials for both internal and customer use Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)Bachelors Degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics, or Applied math At least 3 years serdes design, architectures, protocols and modeling methods Experience with electromagnetics Experience correlating simulation results with lab measurements using oscilloscopes, TDRs, VNAs, and spectrum analyzers What Will Put You AheadMasters Degree in Engineering, Physics, or Applied math 10+ years SI design and simulation experience Experience with available CAD/CAE tools such as Channel Description: Job Number: 59004 Group: Magna Steyr Division: Magna Steyr USA Inc. Job Type: Permanent/Regular Location: TROY Group Description Over 120 years of experience in vehicle production and a broad range of services make Magna Steyr the worldwide leading brand-independent engineering and manufacturing partner for OEMs. Our extensive range of services covers product groups Engineering Services - from systems and modules to complete vehicle engineering - and Complete Vehicle Manufacturing, where we offer World Class flexible solutions from niche to volume production. So far, Magna Steyr has produced more than 4 million vehicles - of 32 different models. Magna Steyr is the ideal automotive contract manufacturer worldwide to produce vehicles with conventional, hybrid and electric powertrains – in some cases, all on the same production line. This further demonstrates the automotive supplier's experience in electrification and electromobility. Role Summary Magna Steyr is looking for a talented team member with experience in vehicle homologation to guide overall vehicle design including systems and components. This would be a passionate individual interested in being involved in developing the next level industry standard for vehicle architecture and production solutions. This position will be responsible to support the engineering team within the design and development activities through the product development phases of concept, production design and engineering, product release, and manufacturing and assembly Key Responsibilities      Technical Responsibility      Contribute to the Global Technical Area (GTA) strategy and growth by supporting the Lead Engineering roles and the whole engineering team in areas such as:     Responsible to define regulation requirements according to intended market and model yearSupport engineering team with clear interpretation of regulationsResponsible to create and execute homologation test matrix, including liaison with customer and test facilitiesSupport as liaison of communication between engineering and customer for technical advisory on regulations requirementsSupport documentation preparation for certification and/or guidance to engineering teamSupport NHTSA forums for regulations assessment and first hand guidance to engineering teams with trend of upcoming regulationsSupport engineering team to drive decisions based on regulatory requirementsResponsible to create roadmap for certificationSupport DVP&R creation (complete vehicle, systems, and component level)Responsible to maintain regulation matrix as required upon approval of new regulations (FMVSS, ECE, GB, etc.)Responsible to perform homologation tests and witness with regulatory bodies      Project Planning, Target Achievement, Monitoring & Reporting      Employ knowledge and technical experience to support the engineering development of one or more subsystems     Support the project team(s) engineering in achieving project objectives, performance and cost requirements, and timing milestonesLead external support, services and resources supporting the project engineering developmentSupport work development packages assigned to third partiesSupport the Technical Manager and contribute to the project resource planning, budget development, and status reportingSet appropriate actions to meet project requirements to achieve relevant gates/milestonesContinuous monitoring of work progress, timing, costs, qualityProvide regular reports to the line managers and project committees (CV/Technical meeting/task force meetings/etc.)Identification of necessary training for team membersEnsure consistent application of MS / customer processes and standardsAssign work scope to team members      Project Related Interface      Support and Promote Project and Operations Collaboration     Participate in global development touchpoint and milestone meetingsCollaborate with Advanced Manufacturing Engineering (AME) to assure production feasibilityCollaborate with the design studio to assure product appearance harmonyCollaborate with all cross functions to make complex decisionsCollaborate with the other project GTAs Key Qualifications/Requirements      To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, ability and/or physical demands required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.     Must have a positive “can do” attitudeMust be flexible and able to course correct paths according to priority alignmentShould be team oriented with a focus on striving for the best solutions for the group as a whole5 to 10 years’ relevant experience as homologation specialistEducation– Bachelor’s Degree in EngineeringFamiliar with BOM and product development processExperience with worldwide Safety/Impact, Chassis, and Electrical regulationsExperience guiding engineering teams towards complete vehicle certification throughout development, and official homologation process Additional InformationProficient Computer knowledge and skills, Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)Computer knowledge and skills in CAD and CAE simulation preferredSix Sigma certification preferredProfessional Communication skills (written and verbal) Awareness. Unity. Empowerment. At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Group Description At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle. We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey. Role Summary Magna New Mobility is a startup inside Magna International, a mobility technology company and one of the largest automotive suppliers in the world. We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Mechanical Engineer to join the New Mobility group in Lowell, MA. As the Senior ME, you will take a lead role in mechanical development of Autonomous Mobile Robots and New Mobility projects to move goods and people - generating and evaluating innovative concepts, building and testing designs, and launching them into production. Key Responsibilities Design including but not limited to: Requirements analysis, Mechanical architecture development, component design and assembly management       In depth analysis, simulation, development of design documentation (3D models, 2D drawings, ME/EE interface, DFMEA) Mechanical integration of PCBAs and sensors (e.g. radar, lidar, cameras, etc.) Thermal management, design and analysis of electronic assemblies Prototyping and Testing including but not limited to: Verify mechanical requirements at component and assembly level testing       Support design, fabrication and build of test set-ups and test equipment used by design and test engineering groups. Support building, modifying and verifying of engineering prototype samples, Support ED, DV, PV testing by conducting tests and documenting results as needed. Key Qualifications/Requirements 6+ years’ relevant experience regarding the Responsibility/ Activities in serial development. Experience with related robotic and vehicle systems. Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects; requires good time management and organizational skills to meet stringent deadlines. Knowledge in mechanical design, development, and testing of robotic or mechatronic systems. Knowledge of structural and thermal design methodologies. Knowledge in mechanical analysis techniques (first order through CAE). Additional Information Awareness. Unity. Empowerment. At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Company Information PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium-, and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF nameplates. PACCAR also designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines, provides financial services and information technology, and distributes truck parts related to its principal business. Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services — you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started! Division Information Kenworth Truck Company, founded in 1923, is the manufacturer of The World’s Best® heavy and medium duty trucks. With an excellent heritage of quality, innovation, and technology, Kenworth has played an essential role in the development of trucks that are more fuel efficient, productive, and economical to operate. Today, Kenworth is leading transportation innovation with the introduction of battery-electric vehicles, exploration of fuel cell electric powertrains, and autonomous driving systems. Kenworth is committed to fostering an environment of diversity, equality, and inclusivity in the workplace. Requisition Summary: Kenworth Truck Company is seeking a Lead CAE Durability Engineer to support Product Development and Validation by using CAE to analyze new designs and provide design recommendations to meet functional/performance requirements. This role offers professional development and access to global opportunities in a challenging, high-performance environment with the opportunity to grow your expertise and be recognized among your peers. Job Functions / Responsibilities: Analyze components, sub-assemblies, assemblies, and full vehicle using FEA tools (such as ABAQUS, LS-DYNA, Altair products), Fatigue life calculation tools (such as nCode, Fe-safe) Develop DFMEA driven upfront CAE scope, performance requirement targets, and plan for Design Development and Validation for Durability, Stiffness, NVH and Strength Guide Engineering Design in the development, tuning and optimization to create durable components and assemblies Lead component, sub-systems, and vehicle testing to correlate CAE models Collaborate with suppliers/vendors to improve the material database and accuracy of CAE models Develop and refine CAE analysis procedures and process through method development and capability enhancements Collaborate with Property Owner for Durability/NVH for new vehicles Conduct or coordinate work with internal & external CAE and test resources including other PACCAR divisions Collaborate with Property Owner to conduct or coordinate benchmark tests of PACCAR and competitive vehicles Deliver CAE reports stating clear recommendations and proposals for improvements to Engineering teams Manage delivery of outsourced CAE activities Develop technology roadmaps for Kenworth simulation and analysis toolset Mentor vehicle engineers in the principles of design for Structural Durability, Fatigue, and NVH Qualifications: Technical Skills (required): 7+ years of experience with Implicit (static and dynamic structural analysis) and explicit analysis Expert in linear & non-linear FEA software: Optistruct, Nastran, ABAQUS, and LS-DYNA Working experience of fatigue life calculators (nCode, Fe-safe) Knowledge and previous working experience with structural analysis Knowledge of Fatigue theory Experience with CAD software such as Creo Parametric Demonstrate the ability and desire to learn new tools and stay updated with the latest technological advancements in the industry Work independently while building cooperation among individuals and departments, sharing information and resources, and working to achieve goals and outcomes meeting expectations of internal and external customers Effective analysis and project management skills and excellent engineering judgment Effective communication, administration, and presentation skills Self-driven with concentration on ownership, execution and accountability Ability to manage personal workload, demonstrate flexibility, initiative, and the willingness to respond to shifting timelines and project demands Technical Skills (preferred): Interest or experience with multi-body dynamics and vehicle dynamics Interest or experience with explicit analysis such as crash or drop Scripting experience – Python and MatLab preferred Background in the automotive or heavy truck industry Education: Bachelor’s degree in Structural/Mechanical Engineering or equivalent required; Master’s degree in Structural/Mechanical Engineering or equivalent preferred As a U.S. PACCAR employee, you have a full range of benefit options including: 401k with up to a 5% company match Fully funded pension plan that provides monthly benefits after retirement Comprehensive paid time off – minimum of 10 paid vacation days (additional days are provided with additional seniority/years of service), 12 paid holidays, and sick time Tuition reimbursement for continued education Medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your family Flexible spending accounts (FSA) and health savings account (HSA) Paid short-and long-term disability programs Life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance EAP services include wellness plans, estate planning, financial counseling, and more Additional Job Board Information At PACCAR, we value talent and promote growth and development. We carefully consider numerous compensation factors including your education, training, or experience. The salary range for Lead Structural CAE Engineer is $93,000-$145,500 annually. This position is also eligible for a holiday gift. Additionally, this role is eligible for the full range of benefit options listed above. PACCAR promotes equal employment opportunities by implementing policies and practices that ensure employees and applicants are not discriminated against because of their race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status or other legally protected status. This applies to recruitment, selection, placement, promotion, termination, rates of pay, and other conditions of employment.

Position: Aero Thermal Management, Cooling Systems Design Expert
Description: Established in 1969, TAT Technologies (“TAT”) is a fast-growing profitable provider of aerospace thermal management, power and actuation products and repair services. TAT is a strategic global partner to leading players in the aerospace industry and specializes in providing innovative commercial, defense, OEM and repair/overhaul solutions. Our experience, flexibility, and commitment to meeting customer’s requirements have positioned us to be a trusted partner to some of the world’s leading aircraft manufacturers, OEM’s, airlines, MRO’s, air forces and defense organizations. TAT employs more than 600 employees’ worldwide, with facilities in the US, Israel, and Russia.Adopting a global approach to R&D by linking R&D strategy to the company’s overall business strategy, TAT decided to move its main R&D activities from Israel the US, but in the process, lost most of its R&D capabilities. We are building a brand-new R&D team faced with the challenge of developing innovative products, supporting ongoing contracts, and developing procedures, methodologies, design tools, setting standards, etc. JOB SUMMARY:As a Cooling Systems Design Expert, you will work as part of our newly created R&D team and will be responsible for the development of the company’s cooling systems design capabilities. You will lead and perform the cooling systems design and provide support for all company projects from concept to production. Your ability to be creative and innovative and use design tools for the development of traditional and new generation cooling systems will be crucial to enabling our company to diversify its products portfolio and strengthen its position as a leader in providing the most advanced thermal solutions to our aerospace customers.ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Lead the cooling systems activities for R&D projects and support ongoing and new Engineering contracts.In charge of developing the cooling systems design capabilities and infrastructure (design tools, design analysis tools, design procedures, design manual, streamline processes, etc.).Support the R&D director in fostering a strong collaboration between R&D and business development, to effectively bridge the gap between technological innovation and market opportunities, leading to the successful development and commercialization of cooling systems that meet customer needs and drive business growth.In charge of creating a state-of-the-art testing laboratory for testing cooling systems – Lead all steps for lab creation, including defining objectives and Scope, identifying requirements, allocating space, acquiring equipment, installing infrastructure, designing test setups, developing test procedures, calibration and instrumentation, safety measures, staff training, documentation and reporting, continuous improvement.In charge of designing and developing cooling systems based on project requirements, technical specifications, and industry standard (analyze cooling load requirements, select appropriate cooling technologies, and create system layouts). This includes performing heat transfer calculations and analysis to determine the cooling capacity required for a given system and selecting and specifying various components required for the cooling system, such as compressors, heat exchangers, fans, pumps, and control devices. In charge of supervising the construction of cooling system prototypes and conducting performance tests to verify their functionality, efficiency, reliability, and safety, as well as, analyzing test data and making necessary adjustments or improvements to optimize system performance.In charge of Cooling System Integration by collaborating with other engineering teams (such as mechanical, electrical, and control engineers), as well as customers’ engineering teams to integrate cooling systems into larger projects or products. You must ensure that the cooling system interfaces correctly with other subsystems and meets overall project requirements.In charge of Troubleshooting and Maintenance: you must diagnose and resolve issues related to cooling system performance, efficiency, or reliability. If required by customers, you must conduct regular inspections, preventive maintenance, and repairs to ensure optimal operation of cooling systems throughout their lifecycle.In charge of Documentation and Compliance: You must prepare technical specifications, system documentation, and operational manuals. You must ensure that the cooling systems comply with relevant aerospace & defense industry standards, safety regulations, and environmental requirements.In charge of Continuous Improvement: You must stay updated with the latest advancements in cooling technologies, industry trends, and energy efficiency standards. You must identify opportunities for improvement, propose innovative solutions, and optimize existing cooling systems for enhanced performance and reduced energy consumption.Investigate cutting-edge technology that can help the company develop state-of-the art product solutions and improve efficiency and productivity.Collaborate with cross-functional teams, suppliers, manufacturing, testing, and validation teams on the complete life cycle of the company projects.Continuously monitor relevant regulatory requirements and evaluate their impact on the Company's products.Top of FormRequirements QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:PhD or Master of Science in Aero-Thermal Engineering / Aerospace EngineeringStrong knowledge of thermodynamics and fluid dynamics principles needed for designing effective cooling systems. Must master heat transfer mechanisms, fluid flow, pressure drop calculations, and the behavior of different cooling mediums (e.g., gas, liquid, refrigerants).Expertise of cooling systems’ components, such as heat exchangers, radiators, fans, pumps, compressors, control valves. etc. (must master factors like heat dissipation requirements, space limitations, cost-effectiveness, and environmental considerations).Strong knowledge in computer simulations and modeling techniques to analyze and optimize cooling system performance. This involves creating mathematical models, conducting simulations, running DOE optimizations, and evaluating different design alternatives to identify the most efficient configurations.Strong knowledge of various materials and manufacturing processes used in the production of cooling system components (good knowledge of factors such as corrosion resistance, thermal conductivity, durability, and cost when selecting materials and processes).Expertise in designing and conducting experiments or tests to validate the performance and reliability of the cooling systems (use of instruments to measure temperature, pressure, and flow rates and analyze the collected data to verify the system's effectiveness). Strong and effective communication and collaboration skills required to work in multidisciplinary teams, interacting with other engineers, project managers, suppliers, and clients (clear communication helps ensure that the cooling system design meets the desired specifications and requirements).Regulatory Compliance: Must consider and comply with the aerospace & defense industry standards, regulations, and safety guidelines (such as FAA, FAR, DFAR, ITAR, etc.). Must ensure that the cooling system design meets all necessary requirements and specifications, including environmental regulations and energy efficiency standards. Must be passionate about technology, innovation and discovering creative and cost-effective cooling systems 15+ years in the field of Cooling Systems & Aero-Thermal ManagementExtensive experience in the design, development, and testing of all thermal control systems for aerospace & defense applications, including HVAC for cockpit, thermal management systems for battery systems, and cooling systems required for other flying vehicles components Highly skilled in using engineering principles and CAD and CAE software to conceptualize, design, and develop efficient and reliable cooling solutions.Must possess a combination of technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and creativity to develop innovative cooling solutions that optimize performance, reliability, and energy efficiency. Benefits TAT Technologies offers competitive compensation, including Health Insurance and a 401K plan. It is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

Description: Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  As a Brakes Design Senior Engineer for Chassis, you will help develop braking technologies and components in production vehicles. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches their work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment. Role Design and develop foundation brake components from initial concept to production Establish requirements for components based on desired vehicle attributes Design with excellence at system and component level, with great attention to every detail Work closely with both internal teams and external suppliers, using creativity and teamwork to integrate multiple systems in the most efficient way possible Coordinate virtual engineering and physical validation testing activities for your designs Manage multiple complex projects in a demanding environment Future technology development and implementation Qualifications 5+ years of automotive industry experience, focus on braking system design Proven experience taking brake components from concept to production Proven 3D CAD skills Experience in prototype assembly Experience in technology, system, and supplier selection Experience in design release, change management and project management Ability to Travel domestically and internationally Advantageous Demonstrated ability of hands-on problem solving Experience with brake pipe and hose, wheel end wiring harness, and pedal box design Experience and proficiency with CATIA V5/V6 Project leadership and mentoring skills Knowledge of vehicle dynamics principles Knowledge of NVH principles Ability to run CAE analysis tools Driven-vehicle attributes development experience Experience and understanding of automotive mechatronics design and control theory Education BS/BEng or MS/MEng in a relevant Engineering/Physics/Mathematics discipline, or equivalent experience Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors.    California (Bay Area) - $115,000-165,000 per year  Additional Compensation and Benefits: Lucid offers a wide range of competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, vacation, and 401k. The successful candidate may also be eligible to participate in Lucid’s equity program and/or a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing such programs. (Cash or equity incentive awards, if any, will depend on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and company performance.)  Lucid maintains your privacy according to its Candidate Privacy Notice. If you are a California resident, please refer to our California Candidate Privacy Notice.    At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.  To all recruitment agencies:   Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Role Design and develop actuation and modulation brake components from initial concept to production Establish requirements for components based on desired vehicle attributes Design with excellence at system and component level, with great attention to every detail Work closely with both internal teams and external suppliers, using creativity and teamwork to integrate multiple systems in the most efficient way possible Coordinate virtual engineering and physical validation testing activities for your designs Manage multiple complex projects in a demanding environment Future technology development and implementation Qualifications 5+ years of automotive industry experience, with a focus on braking systems & actuation design Proven experience taking brake components from concept to production Proven 3D CAD skills Hands-on practical experience in prototype assembly Experience in technology, system, and supplier selection Experience in design release, change management and project management Ability to Travel domestically and internationally Advantageous Demonstrated ability of hands-on problem solving Experience with brake pipe and hose, wheel end wiring harness, and pedal box design Experience and proficiency with CATIA V5/V6 Project leadership and mentoring skills Knowledge of vehicle dynamics principles Knowledge of NVH principles Ability to run CAE analysis tools Driven-vehicle attributes development experience Experience and understanding of automotive mechatronics design and control theory Education BS/BEng or MS/MEng, or equivalent experience, in Mechanical Engineering or similar Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors. Description: POSITION SUMMARY: Controls Engineers are responsible for designing, developing, installing, and maintaining equipment used to monitor and control systems, equipment and processes. They work in various industries including industrial controls and power controls and protection systems. Controls engineers are technical experts in areas such as advanced process control, instrumentation, distributed control systems, PLCs, and SCADA systems. Controls engineers use these skills to design and implement solutions to our customer's complex needs.Specific areas of expertise for this position include power chain monitoring and control systems in Data Centers and /or mission critical environments. Experience in Building Automation Systems (BAS), Electrical Power Monitoring Systems (EPMS) and field device configuration such as controllers, gateways, PLC, Meters, Relays, and SCADA/HMI software.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Technical ResponsibilitiesDesign / EngineeringInitiates design documents and leads designsPlans and Design Procedures and Equipment for Integrated Systems Factory TestingComment ResolutionProgrammingLead programming / configuration team efforts for complex automation and SCADA applications.Program / Configure / troubleshoot Controllers, PLCs, RTUs, and/or HMI systemsTesting / Troubleshooting / Deployment / CommissioningAuthor test plans for large programsLeads / supervises testing activitiesAuthor testing / commissioning proceduresPreparation of test reportsOriginates test proceduresCommissioning of deployed systemsDevelopment of test equipment and simulation devicesPerform Factory and Field TestingMaintenancePerform troubleshooting on service calls to existing and legacy system operatorsManagerial ResponsibilitiesEstimatesLeads proposal efforts (Research requiredPrepares cost estimates and supporting documents for small projectsEvaluation and pricing of change ordersDivisional ManagementActively follows emerging technical trends and contributes to entry-level engineersAssigns tasks and coordinates with Technical StaffQUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Education/Experience:Bachelor's degree in mechanical or electrical engineering and 8 years field experience Associate degree in mechanical or electrical field and 10 years field experience High school diploma and 12 years field experience 7-10 years' experience Experience in reading mechanical, electrical and control schematics and plans Experience in control system startup, configuration, and calibration Experience in testing and troubleshooting control systems Experience using basic electrical and machinist hand toolsExperience using testing, calibration, or industry-specific tools and softwareComputer Skills:Experience in computer networksExperience in CAD/CAE Software (Visio, AutoCAD)Experience in schedule management softwareStandard Office Software (Microsoft Word, Excel, Project, etc.)Certificates and Licenses:Required CertificationsCertification in one or more PLC / Automation Platform, such as: Niagara N4, Schneider, Rockwell, Siemens, JCI, etc.Certification in one or more SCADA platform, such as: Iconics, Ignition, etc.Preferred Licenses / CertificationsDesign Build Institute of America (DBIA)Certified SCADA Security Architect (CSSA)Certified Automation Professional (CAP)Supervisory Responsibilities: Manage and Develop Junior Engineers and Technicians While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to computer screens for an extended period of time; Saratoga, CAE-Space US – Space Systems Engineering /Full-Time/ On-Site     Ready to make connectivity from space universally accessible, secure and actionable? Then you’ve come to the right place!        E-Space is bridging Earth and space to enable hyper-scaled deployments of space-powered Internet of Things (IoT) solutions and services. We are fundamentally changing the design, economics, manufacturing, coverage limitations and service delivery associated with traditional satellite and terrestrial IoT systems.        By building a highly-advanced low Earth orbit (LEO) space system—with a unique antenna design, highly sustainable spacecraft system and low-cost, small portable end-user devices—we can extend global satellite coverage, capacity and connectivity beyond legacy space services to provide a new kind of IoT platform that lets users sense, track, connect and act on information gathered, anywhere.        We’re intentional, we’re unapologetically curious and we’re 100% committed to saving space, protecting our planet and turning connectivity into actionable intelligence.    What is the role: As a Senior AIT Engineer, you will participate in the E-Space satellite assembly integration and testing (AIT) activities. As part of the E-Space AIT team, you will have the opportunity to test thousands of flight hardware units and directly contribute to the success of an innovative satellite architecture on-orbit.    This position is based in Saratoga, CA.    What you will do: Spacecraft sub-system acceptance: Organize the acceptance of the spacecraft sub-systems before integration to the flatsat (EM), or to the satellite structure (FM) EM flatsat activities:Define the Verification and Validation (V&V) requirements for the activityGSE definition and procurementSatellite procedure creation and execution on the flatsatResult collectionV&V requirement Statement of Compliance Participate in the spacecraft unit qualification test campaigns. FM AIT activities:GSE definition and procurementSatellite procedure creation and execution on the FM SpacecraftResult collectionV&V requirement statement of complianceFM Satellite environmental test Campaign What you bring to this role: Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering 7+ years of experience in spacecraft engineering Previous experience with a satellite AIT campaign Good understanding of spacecraft subsystem development, having been involved in the development of at least one Understanding of electrical test equipment, test procedures, data acquisition systems and instrumentation Experience in environmental testing such as vibration, shock, thermal and TVAC Programming experience in Python, MATLAB/Simulink Demonstrated success working in a dynamic environment Bonus points: Experience with radiation effects testing Project/program management skills     $100,000 - $170,000 a year    The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position in question, which is based on market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on location, skills and expertise, depth of relevant experience, and other relevant factors. For questions about this, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply for the role and are selected for an interview.     We are redefining how satellites are designed, manufactured and used—so we’re looking for candidates with passion, deep knowledge and direct experience on LEO satellite component development, design and in-orbit activities. If that’s your experience – then we’ll be immediately wow-ed.    Why E-Space is right for you: We want you to make the most of your journey at E-Space. That’s why we support and invest in the physical, emotional and financial well-being of our team members and their families. Some of what you can expect when working at E-Space:    An opportunity to really make a differenceSustainability at our coreFair and honest workplaceInnovative thinking is encouragedCompetitive salariesContinuous learning and developmentHealth and wellness care optionsFinancial solutions for the future Optional legal services (US only)Paid holidaysPaid time off
Benefits: ['Paid time off']

Description: Job Summary    The Sr Manager, Engineering will be based in Fremont, CA.    Watch      this video   to learn why Nextracker is more than just a place to work.    Here is a glimpse of what you’ll do:  Contribute to the design and development of the next generations of Nextracker horizontal tracking products Perform and manage engineering work using CAD/CAE software to solve problems in mechanical/structural design, finite element analysis, design optimization, prototype generation (such as stereo lithography on NC machining), fatigue analysis, structural dynamics and kinematics, vibrations, thermal analysis, production of manufacturing drawings, and plastic part design Develop testing fixtures that accurately simulate real world scenarios Perform and document engineering tests under general supervision Write proposals, technical reports and papers Participate in brainstorming sessions with the mechanical engineering team to identify concepts and designs for future products Develop and maintain best practices to foster the creative process Design mechanical components, execute prototyping, and manage design iterations Implement continuous improvement in order to maximize efficiency in the design process Partner with the Manufacturing Engineer on design for manufacturability to address questions and issues.   Here is some of what you’ll need (required):  B.S. or M.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering, Structural Engineering or a related field (advanced degree preferred) 8 years of experience Toolsets required: SolidWorks, ePDM, FEA, Ansys Extensive knowledge/experience with drawings, model and GD&T standards and application. Hands on experience with shop tools such as chop saw, band saw, grinders, wrenches, etc. Strong understanding of DFM for castings and sheet metal stampings Strong aptitude and intuition in mechanical failure analysis Practical knowledge of prototyping manufacturing process Must possess solid written and verbal communication skills Ability to prioritize and juggle multiple projects Self-motivated team player Ability to work within a cross-functional team while maintaining self-sufficiency Proficient in most common PC based applications (Word, Excel, Visio, PPT, MSProject, and the like) Willingness to travel and work at client sites both domestically and internationally   Here are a few of our preferred experiences:  Experience with Solar or renewable energy Management experience Labview, MATLAB Netsuite, Arena, Miro (Real Time board), Jira, Confluence Python or other coding Automation experience   Nextracker is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on: age, race, religion, color, sex, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, pregnancy status, or any other status protected by law. We're happy to provide reasonable accommodations to those with a disability for assistance in the recruitment process. Please advise us of any accommodations you may need by e-mailing:      accessibility@flex.com  .  Pay Range (Applicable to California)  $87,700.00 USD - $120,600.00 USD Annual    Job Category  Production Engineering  Relocation: Eligible for domestic and international relocation    Is Sponsorship Available?  Yes
